Product > furniture: residential/dining.description_html: The Alabaster Table measures an ample 18' 8" L x 6' 2" W x 29" H and seats 16. It is constructed of an under-lit, alabaster tabletop, its surface delineated with thin metal, patinated bronze accents. The tabletop is edged with a 38-foot band of hammered, black patinated, sand-casted bronze; the legs are also fabricated of the same material. LED lighting is integrated into the alabaster stone tabletop lending it a moon-lit glow and, when the light is activated 'on' via a remote control or through home automation, there is a range of brightness radiating cool or warm illumination.

More than a table, a sculpture, a perfect union of beauty and harmonious proportions. The meeting of two volumes achieves a perfect balance of one over the other. Disassembling table with base in rigid polyurethane covered with the new metallic finishes (metal bronze, metal rusty, metal grey) : micronized metal powder mixed with resin and spread by hand. An exclusively made in Italy product that combines artisan skills whit high technological content, aesthetics with functionality for a perfect sartorial experience. Available in round or oval shape, in eight different dimensions. Reduced dimensions yet intact personality also for the Mini Clay version.

Overall description
The Aaron dining table is strong, edgy and timeless featuring a solid bronze base with a knife edge top and inlaid bronze detailing. Pure quartzite and architectural bronze with a subtle aluminum substrate are the only materials used.

Design brief
A favorite client was looking for a dining table to replace the one they had since they were first married. They needed something durable and flexible that would allow a few extra chairs to be easily squeezed around for larger family gatherings. They also wanted something edgy; as art collectors and consultants, their home is a mix of elegant and provocative, and this table, needed to strike that balance.

The result is Aaron. Strong, elegant, edgy and timeless, using pure quartzite and architectural bronze with a subtle aluminum substrate as his only materials. His pedestal legs butterfly at a shallow 140-degree angle to triangulate his stance firmly with a minimal footprint and no wobble. A felted-underside of each base protects the wood floors. A hollow 4" x 1 1/4" structural centre spine runs the length of the table ending in a 10 degree chamfer which is capped and filled

Each leg is narrowest at knee-height offering maximum squeezing-in space, and lighter weight. The pedestals then flare-out wide at the top to meet the edge of the table at an impossible 10-degree angle; shallow enough to ensure knees don't touch it. The tight angle demands an impressive 10-degree chamfer to the 3/4" thick top edge of the stone, polished to a paper-thin 3/8" radius edge. Natural Quartzite is hard enough and stable enough to achieve this fine edge with a 100% pure natural material top.

The legs and top are intimately integrated with the 1/4" thick bronze leg appearing to slice through the stone edge and completing itself in a V on the surface, flush with the polished stone. The bronze line is inlaid into the continuous stone slab.

Key features
The Aaron dining table was designed with materials that provide a striking contrast each other. The cool rigid grey of the stone is softened by the warm glow of the bronze metal. The inlaid bronze gleams on the surface of the table.

There is a great strength in the materials used for this table. The stone and bronze are extremely durable with a lifespan that allows the table to stay in the family for many generations.

The shape of the table base is practical and convenient as it allows many people to sit around the table with almost no leg interference. The Aaron table is beautiful and practical dining table to gather your family and friends around.

Specialist artisan skills
The quartzite stone selected for the table top is an incredibly hard material. The craftsmen who worked on the stone had to leave the CNC cutter on overnight to cut get through the hard surface. Achieving a 3/8” radius on the stone edge could only have been done using great skill.

The Mira XL Table designed by Mac Stopa for Casali is a glass dining table with an organic octagonal shape supported by four polished aluminum legs. The tabletop is made of 12 mm extra-clear tempered glass. The curved geometry of the leg corresponds with the geometry of the tabletop and its rounded corners. The table’s outstanding design, quality materials and craftsmanship are not its only attributes. Thanks to the special connection system, the table’s legs are easily detachable from the glass top making the table easy to move and transport. Made in Italy.

Product > furniture: residential/dining.description_html: The Roulette Round Table features a pin wheel style base layout with slanted legs suggesting a rotating movement. Profiled legs and table edges add a softened tactile quality to the design. Available in round, square and rectangular tops in a wide range of sizes. Tops are offered in fixed and extension versions with one or two leaves. Standard finishes include 6 wood species in 31 standard finishes. Custom woods, finishes and sizes are available upon request. Shown in a 54" round with the solid wood top option in Cerused Silver Walnut.

The Andreen table is a simple, artistic, and functional table featuring a beveled underside edge on the table top and an interlocking base. The bevel creates the allusion of a thinner top and helps draw your eyes from the top to the base. The base features two center stretchers that lock into the legs and have removable end caps that are attached using hidden fasteners. The top stretcher and legs have multiple connection points to the table top that create a strong connection while also allowing the top to expand and contract. The table is designed to ship broken down and flat and can be assembled in 30 minutes.

Inspired by Chicago's boulevards and avenues, the Ashland Dining Table features bronze details that travel from the foot to bisect the top. Made of flat cut walnut that showcases its arch-shaped cathedral grain, the split continues to each of the legs to highlight the metal detail. Shown in medium bronze patina.

Inspired by flower petals and 3D modeling technology, CLARA table is unique and elegant. The design combines a marble tabletop and an exquisite base in smooth proportions. With its contrasting natural wood and shimmering gloss lacquer, CLARA exhibits a form both elegant and organic.

Kudo, a chic, modern new collection, consists of stunning powder coated aluminum tables perfect for hospitality, residential or business environments. Complete with a sleek Basalt Black ceramic table top, the dining table is perfect indoors and out. The anti-abrasion JANUScoat and architectural grade powder coat make this piece ideal for constant use.

Fluid and dynamic – Patricia Urquiola, once again explores the mutability of light in the Liquefy table collection for Glas Italia. Invoking the ephemeral beauty and lustrous iridescence of oil in water, these tables are available in three sizes, and two rich, yet subtle, hues: green and pink.

Crafted from tempered extra light glass and with faded, irregular decoration, Liquefy takes on the color and veins of marble. Enclosed by a coordinated color frame, the decoration is painted on the glass perimeter. Also available in pink hues.

OPUS table, design Antonio Citterio, in wood. It is produced using fine techniques and details, such as shaped solid wood and dovetail joints. The outer frame holds the inner slats firmly in place. Solid wood turned legs. Available wood: Walnut colour, Teak, Fumé Oak, Fossil Oak. It is available as workbench in slatted NTF (Natural Touch Finish) wood.
Presented at the recent edition of Eurocucina, its grained wood in a “rough” finish matches perfectly with stainless steel in the innovative colours generated with the PVD (Physical Vapour Deposition) technological process. Natural materials, innovative production technologies and artisan details in a dialogue with each other and with the evolution of work zones.
The limelight is on clever use of materials: steel as Arclinea’s heritage in technological innovation for finishes, and wood as a historic value, rendered unique and precious by artisan skills and surprising production processes.

KOSE more than lives up to its name. A collection consisting of a stacking café armchair and collapsible dining table, KOSE addresses the needs of both indoor and outdoor use. Each element is lightweight, comfortable, and durable against the elements. Each piece boasts unique blob-shaped perforations in its powder-coated aluminium form, allowing for water to flow through the chair and table rather than accumulate. The collection strikes an iconic, minimal silhouette, serving elegance while remaining affordable. Simultaneously embodying firmness and flexibility, KOSE represents the NOW.

The Cassidy table strikes a chord with its simplicity of form yet pays close attention to precise details, resulting in a complex and memorably distinctive design. Cassidy’s classic aesthetic combines tapered legs with a slight geometric shape that seamlessly blends into the walnut top. The table top is constructed with a subtle curved shape, creating an engaging design that enhances the visual appeal when used in a more linear setting. Cassidy is available in two sizes and shapes. A rectangular table with a flat cut walnut veneer surface measures ninety inches long and forty inches wide. A circular table forty-eight inches in diameter has a unique walnut reverse diamond pattern on the top.

Plexi-Craft is proud to unveil its newest acrylic masterpiece, the Iceland Chess Table.

The crisp, clean combination of a crystal-clear acrylic table, and a gleaming ultra-clear starphire glass top, is a sleek way for this unique chess table to make a stunning presence in any home. Material is sourced in the USA and it is of the highest optical clarity. There is simply nothing like this chess table in the world.

This full size 23” x 23” tournament chess board and pieces seemingly float on a frame of fine acrylic that has been peerlessly cut, glued and buffered by our expert team of NYC artisans. The entire table has the strength and solidarity of strong hard wood and yet the optical clarity of ice.

The tempered glass chess board with individually hand-crafted acrylic pieces is perfectly centered on a comfortable table and rests between two glistening tempered glass plates. The transparency and precision is so precise that you’ll believe the board itself is floating mid-air.

When you enter the room your vision will immediately be drawn to the boldly printed ebony checkered chess board and its stunning ebony chess pieces that face off against their ultimate adversaries, the clear-as-ice chess pieces. The ongoing ebony versus ice rivalry is staged in a calm, cool Islandic setting.

Underneath the ¼” thick glass chess board is a white sub-board of the exact same dimension that can be easily interchanged with clear glass depending on personal preference.

Each lustrous chess piece, from the humble pawn to the magnificent King, has been hand-cut and polished to perfection. At Plexi-Craft, everything touched by our artisans is worked to precision using the care of an old world watchmaker. That personal embrace of the material is why our craftsmen loved working on this masterpiece.

Lastly, the chess board can be easily lifted out and swapped with a solid white leather insert so the entire top is flush and the table can be utilized as a gorgeous clear console with leather wrap center.

Given its transparency the game table is a compliment to any living room decor. It can be tucked into a quiet nook for the most serious match, or it can be a stunning centerpiece display so all may appreciate its visual beauty. No matter if you are grandmaster or a beginner, this is the game table you have been waiting for.

Plexi-Craft is unique among custom acrylic furniture manufacturers having been located in NYC since the 1960’s. Over the years Plexi-Craft has become synonymous with precision, reliability and stretching creative boundaries. At any point in time our design team is collaborating with award-winning architects and interior designers to satisfy their equally accomplished and discriminating clientele. We’re as demanding on ourselves as your clients are with you. At Plexi-Craft every design becomes a masterpiece.

The combination of wood, steel and leather define this new collection of tiered, utilitarian side tables.

Open Bar

Our new spin on the classic bar cart, this piece is cast in our Crete finish with pieces of polished crushed clear glass, featuring grey mirrors on the top and bottom shelves, as well as a mirror on the underside of the top shelf creating an infinite reflection inside. The Open Bar glides on recessed locking casters for cocktail mobility.

A capsule collection has been a passion project of Mondi’s for many years. In 2001, Mondi established her firm, working with a curated roster of discerning clients and industry leaders on residential projects. Her signature style and reputation for creating environments that reimagine the possibilities of spatial design quickly caught the attention of media and city-based clients alike, resulting in an expansion of services to include custom pieces where possible. After years of interest from clients, she is excited to announce she’ll be formally launching a capsule collection.

The full collection, dubbed En Vie, is an assortment of fine furnishings meant to entice and a reflection of Mondi’s unique design aesthetic. Inspired by a fusion of European sophistication and global modernity, the collection is intended to evoke emotions of desire. Sensual lines, bold graphics, and edgy elements are a few of the undercurrents running through the line. En Vie was a way to explore her own creative desires through functional, practical furnishings that can find their way into many different lifestyles and interiors. And, as the ultimate expression of desire, the pieces in the collection were named after mistresses of famous European rulers.

Charlotte: Mistress of King Henry IV of France, part of the notorious “Flying Squadron” a group of beautiful female spies known for their abilities to seduce important men. The Charlotte lucite cocktail table is sure to seduce you with it’s curves and almost disappears as if it were never there.

A SOLID STEPPED METAL COFFEE TABLE WITH INSET GLASS TOP. THE STEP TABLE IS MESMERIC INSIDE AND OUT WITH ITS HIGHLY POLISHED, FACETTED FORM TAKING ON EXTERNAL REFLECTIONS. A GLASS TOP REDERS THE INWARD VIEW EQUALLY AS COMPELLING. ITS LIKE LOOKING INTO A CITY.

This sleek piece with perfectly mitered corners looks like a solid pedestal but offers the added benefit of two hidden drawers with vacuum closures. Use just one or combine multiples to create a large coffee table arrangement. Available in Oak, Walnut, and White Lacquer. Made in Malaysia.

The Tower harmonizes two geometric halves into an architectonic companion piece. A recessed bronze space, peeks between the forms, emphasizing the visual rhythm of its surrounding volumes. Customizable in combinations of lacquer, walnut, oak, or paldao, the Tower is yours to design as a pairing of contrasts.

The perfect blend between organic and contemporary, the Geometry tables are crafted from solid slabs of acacia wood over a matte black iron base. Clean lines and a diagonal division between materials makes these natural wood tables modern and dynamic. Available in six sizes.

The Cactus Console Table has a quartered oak veneered top & base in a signature sandalwood finish.
The cactus form is cast from composite and finished in 'soleil bronze'.

According to the designer, The Cactus Console reflects to his "love for the southern California Desert. This Console speaks of beauty, art and the idea that modern sculpture emanates from nature. A focal point for an entry hall or living room."

ADJUSTABLE TEAR DROP TABLE

The Tear Drop table is a small yet significant piece of furniture. Elegant and sculptural. Understated and timeless. This highly functional side table with a sculptural shape is height adjustable making it perfectly adaptable for any setting. The Tear Drop table blends effortlessly into any surrounding and is the perfect compliment to any modern or classic interior from private offices, lounges, breakout areas and public spaces. The shapely tables are available in a variety powder coated finishes in both fixed height and adjustable height options. Table tops are offered in laminate or wood veneer. An expandable version of the square table top is also available. Made for even smaller spaces, this dynamic design offers all the clever space saving you require in a small, minimalist area. The table is incredibly easy to adjust, and with a couple of moves it doubles the table top size for when more surface space is required. The Tear Drop table is a uniquely adaptable design that brings an eclectic, sculptural element to any workplace.

One of the most celebrated interior architects in the world today, Lauren Rottet has designed stylish offices for Goldman Sachs, Disney, GE and a host of other companies; interiors for such renowned hospitality brands as St. Regis, Marriott and the Four Seasons Hotels and numerous residential projects, including the Central Park Tower in New York City, which is slated to be the tallest, most exclusive residential building in the U.S. when it is completed.

Her new furniture offerings incorporate Rottet’s love of architecture and detail and reflect her passion for creating spaces and objects that impart kinetic energy, visually enlivening each environment.

The Dichroic Table uses one of the oldest materials -- glass -- in unexpected ways and to beautiful effect. It features sheets of glass with micro-layers of metal oxide that refract light into multiple hues. At 13"L x 13"W x 18.5"H, it is extremely structural and minimal in profile, working beautifully as a side table in any interior. "I have worked for more than 20 years with dichroic glass," says Rottet. Driven by the goal to create a table that looks different from every angle, the Dichroic Table explores the relationship between lighting, color, location and reflection. It is a signature piece for its simplicity and dynamic beauty.

The frame of the table is stainless steel, but it can also come in bronze. The dichroic glass itself is composed of laminated glass with a layer of clear and a layer of dichroic glass. Glass to metal connections utilize newer technology machines that secure the hold better than before. The optic nature of the dichroic glass is a result of multiple ultra-thin layers of different metals (such as gold or silver); oxides of such metals as titanium, chromium, aluminum, zirconium, magnesium or silica which are vaporized by an electron beam in an advanced vacuum chamber. The vapor then condenses on the surface of the glass in the form of a crystal structure, which is as durable as the glass surface and fully integrated.

Rook Console: Console table made of solid quarter sawn walnut in a gray finish. Comes standard with one shelf. Top is elegant brown stone and feet are in stainless steel with a satin smoke finish.

ALCHEMY – the philosophy and practice of purifying, maturing and perfecting elements – is the inspiration behind Donghia’s 2017 Furniture and Lighting Collection.
For more than 40 years, Donghia has been synonymous with visionary American design and exquisite craftsmanship. Designed in Manhattan and made from the world’s finest materials, the 2017 Alchemy collection advances Donghia’s legacy of urban, contemporary design, legendary comfort, grounded in old-world artistry.
Wood, metal and glass have been worked upon by hand, tradition and time. Imagination becomes reality and beauty takes functional shape as wood suggests movement, metal energizes line, glass appears liquid.
Dovetail joinery links open-pore walnut, ancient stone and patinated stainless steel to create the entirely unique Rook Console.
Through the power of ALCHEMY, the 2017 Donghia Furniture and Lighting collection seamlessly integrates materials and transforms it into artwork. We invite you to experience The Art of Donghia with the 2017 ALCHEMY Collection.

The 3D Doodle Console is a moment of reverie that has been frozen in time: created by the 42cm wide doodle ribbon undulating in space.
A mirror finish is given to the 5mm thick brass plate doodle to enhance the reflectivity and curvilinearity of the resulting form. The front and back faces of the 200cm long console are in brass brushed finish.

Versatile in nature but sculptural in appearance, the Willow is a statement piece that craves to be utilized. Each block, designed to be equal parts form and function, is scaled to effortlessly evolve from a work of art into a coffee table, side table, stool or bench. Its two adjacent flat faces allow the form the flexibility to be brought together and continuously reconfigured to better shape a space.

The bold grain of the Douglas Fir stumps used to craft the piece has a dramatic effect as it maps its way around the form. On the Willow’s curved surfaces the grain flows as expected, smooth, steady and horizontal; but when the flat faces are encountered, the grain direction turns, emphasizing the flat planes that gift this design its originality.

The Willow is a design rooted in intension. Each surface, studied and shaped, was reduced until the design’s purest form was all that remained. Content in its simplicity, emphasis and personality are brought to the design not through decoration but through the wood’s natural characteristics. An idea once cultivated in a spontaneous moment of the subconscious, the Willow stands as a whimsical sculpture that seamlessly adapts to its surroundings, stretching beyond the bounds of a single function and endlessly evolving for its users.

A set of three modular tables. Expresses the contrast of natural geological formations with the man-made. The feeling of opposing force, and lightness from the South American mountain range of the same name inspired this modular table set.

Less is More with the Mies Collection from Michael Dawkins Minimal lines and detailing give the Mies Console a timeless classic quality yet thoroughly modern hand made of Nickel plated Brass and a 3" slab of exquisite plexiglass

Each element of the piece is carved separately from a single block of metal, then joined together with meticulous precision.The radial pattern of the Marquetry Side Table is inspired by centuries of handcrafted tradition. Yabu Pushelberg’s deceptively simple pieces for Glas Italia, though both very different, each impart a rarefied elegance, resulting from an approach that explores the technical limitations of glass and plays with the material’s most fundamental qualities.
From a very simple form, understood at first glance, comes a piece of furniture with expressive, playful nuances. Disciplined, pared back lines, flat planes, purposeful arcs and square edges quietly celebrate the qualities of clear glass and Glas Italia’s precision craftsmanship. Inspired by the innocent approachability of folded paper, the minimal Folio desk is smart and friendly.

Open Roller

The Open Roller is the newest take on our Roller family, with curving, angled openings to create a super functional table, chair, ottoman and more. Featuring our signature Crete finish with pieces of clear crushed glass and a disc of blackened steel for the interior shelf, the Open Roller glides around on recessed locking casters for ultimate utility.

Sophisticated, yet casual: a series of intricate weaves, are tightly entwined in the outdoor Ringo end tables. Apertures within the hand-woven, polyethylene structure lend an airy, feel. Adding a subtle pop of color, the Ringo End Tables by Kenneth Cobonpue are handcrafted in the Philippines and available in two sizes.
Perfect as a pair or stand alone, The Ringo is made for the outdoors.

The unusual material of the tops, previewed at the Salone, is a special resin in which, through a complex semi-artisanal process, a fabric developed especially by Rubelli has been incorporated. Enclosed in the transparent slab the fabric, produced in the gold, silver and bronze metallic versions, has the special feature of not appearing flattened and of retaining its 3D appearance, with a trompe-l’oeil effect.

Part of Formica® Writable Surfaces collection is SketchTable™, a ready-made table for the home. SketchTable™ is offered in two sizes; 16-inch and 24-inch, perfect for playing games, doing homework and even labeling those delicious appetizers for your guests at your next cocktail party. The taller size makes a lovely accent piece for a front entryway where reminders can be left, for a child’s play or study table or even as a practical and enjoyable end table. Each table has a two-sided flip top, giving the chance to have two writable surfaces you can simply flip when your project or artistic mood changes. Two surface options are available. The first is the Formica® Writable Surface with the ColorBook design on the front and black ChalkAble design on the back. The second Formica® Writable Surface option is the LoveWords design on the front and black ChalkAble design on the back. Price: $150.

Sauterelle Drinks Table by Jamie Drake for Theodore Alexander has a hand leafed silver eglomisé glass top and solid brass detailing. The table's column is inlaid with hand placed eggshell fragments.

Jamie Drake states, "Perched on graceful legs, a silvered verre eglomisé top, polished brass and an eggshell lacquer shaft come together to create a glamorous occasional table."

The curved glass legs offer a sense of perceived lightness while asymmetrically supporting a touch-latch drawer, completely enclosed in milky white tempered glass. The top also features a milled casing to house either cables or a double-faced mirror which, when inserted, transforms this elegant desk into a contemporary vanity.

Equally at home as a console table, vanity or elegant desk, this multi-purpose tour de force is as simple as it is dramatic.

"secrets &..” by Neri&Hu is the first edition of A Cabinet of Curiosity, an ongoing series to be launched in subsequent years, slowly peeling away the hidden to finally satisfy the curiosity in all of us.

In "secrets &..”, the seven deadly sins are represented by seven symbolic objects of everyday life. The Cabinet of Curiosity holds these objects linked to the many secrets of our personas that we wish to reveal, mask or memorialize.

Accompanying the representations of "sins" in the cabinet will be unspeakable secret notes written by the people driven by curiosity, each sealed in an envelope. The secrets give strength to the sins, providing them structure and comfort; filling each gap with their noisy silence.

The wooden cabinet with glass doors rests on a metal trolley inspired by scenes from a ceramic factory, before the cart enters the fiery furnace. The furnace represents trials and tribulations we all encounter in life, from which we offer up sweat and tears, pain and pleasure. Yet it is through the burning of these sins and secrets that we walk out white as snow. Secrets revealed. Or secrets concealed. That is up to us.

Note Design Studio and Afteroom are the latest studios to hack IKEA products for Danish brand Reform, with both taking cues from their Scandinavian origins to create minimal sideboards. Reform, which specialises in customising IKEA's Metod and Sektion kitchen cupboards, enlisted the two Stockholm-based studios to create sideboards in hopes of making design-led fittings more affordable. Note Design Studio and Afteroom are two of the biggest Scandinavian designers at the moment and their design philosophy is very much like Reforms. Note Design Studio and Afteroom join a list of studios that have collaborated with Reform to create hacked IKEA furniture. Reform usually focuses on kitchens, but its latest project expands the brand's remit to the living room.

Afteroom, founded by Hung-Ming Chen and Chen-Yen Wei, aimed to create a piece of furniture that would stand the test of time. They used a "classic" colour palette of powder blue, off-white, pink blush and black. Doors are textured with shallow grooves, which looks similar to corrugated metal sheeting. Dominating Afteroom's sideboard is the straight lines that are a fundamental element of classical interior design, and the graceful and elegant lines on the sideboard allow it to be easily integrated into any room and simply matched with other furniture for a look that is clean and uncluttered.

Note Design Studio aimed to create a decadent yet contemporary piece through the use of terrazzo and wood. While one cabinet takes its cues from 1970s furniture – combining brown-coloured materials – a second is all-white and offers a contemporary-looking alternative. Note's sideboard plays with the contrast between contemporary design and traditional elegance. It's a sculptural piece through colour, material, silhouette, and its mix of simplicity and indulgent materials.
Product > furniture: residential/storage.product_name: Afteroom and Note Design Studio sideboards

Character Chest

Picture this: Mickey Mouse and his dog Pluto—taking a selfie, no less! We fell for the original Disney image the moment we laid eyes on it. We loved its sweet humor and knew it deserved a proper showcase. Just like that, we took a Disney idea and transformed it into a brilliant statement piece. Finished in matte black and set on a sleek brushed nickel base for a contemporary vibe, our three-drawer chest proved the perfect backdrop for the enchanting panel that stole our hearts—and will surely steal yours.
Crafted from white oak and maple veneers and a stainless steel base
Matte black painted finish (Mickey's Ears 711) with brushed stainless steel base
Features dovetail drawers and soft-close slides

A tip-restraint kit is included with this item. It includes safety-tested hardware, a nylon strap, and mounting instructions. Furniture tip-over can cause serious injuries; for your safety, please affix this item securely to the wall.

Ethan Allen | Disney Collection

Designed by Ethan Allen and inspired by Disney’s iconic characters, Mickey Mouse and Minnie Mouse, the impressive collection includes over 500 fun, yet sophisticated, styles for the modern family. Combining Ethan Allen's core strengths of craftsmanship, style, and quality with Disney’s rich storytelling, we’ve created an experience that kids and parents will truly love and appreciate. The collection is designed for every room in the home—and everyone who lives there.

It includes a range of whimsical, fashionable, functional looks for nurseries, kids’ rooms, playrooms, and family living spaces. Consumers will also find an array of accessories such as art and wall décor, rugs, lighting, bedding, and chic, clever storage pieces. Many styles feature cool nods to retro Disney designs, playful shapes, and signature Mickey and Minnie details. Many styles are available in a selection of fabrics and finishes and handcrafted in the company’s own North American workshops.

Bowen Liu's debut as the furniture design brand was at International Contemporary Furniture Fair(ICFF), New York City in May 2017. It is a collection of five pieces of furniture including Gatsby Credenza, Feast Dining Table, Henry Dining Chair, Woo Candelabra, and U3 Serving Trolley. The collection is a unified sense body of work to enhance the conditions and ambiance of the contemporary dining and living experience. They are handmade with careful attention to detail, materiality, and tactility.

Gatsby Credenza
Inspired by the history and influences of the Prohibition era in the United States, Gatsby Credenza is designed to store liquors, records, and books. The height is good to pour a drink for your guests and yourself. Oh! One thing has to be mentioned, that there is a speakeasy door on the back! Of course.

The first closed casework piece in the Tom Kundig Collection, the Jack Box Cabinet features an interior shelf and four brake formed steel hinging doors. Handles and hinges are machined from solid cold-rolled steel, with bronze pins and bearings providing a subtle material contrast. Available in freestanding and wall-mounted versions, the Jack Box can function either as a sideboard or a media console piece.

Product > furniture: residential/storage.description_html:
Luna, the Roman goddess of the moon, will ensure a celestial sleep. This bed features tapered side return wings which enfold its lavish upholstered headboard. The headboard and bed frame ensemble are elevated by a thin
hardwood base which transitions into delicate legs. Luna Beds are available in standard and platform formats in COM or COL with a fully upholstered back. The wood base is available in 6 different wood species and 31 standard finishes. Custom woods, sizes and finishes are available upon request. Shown in COM with Bleached Walnut base.

Mies van der Rohe’s well-worn quote, “God is in the details,” aptly captures the sensibility of the polished and urbane Tokyo Console. A closer look at this deceptively simple piece reveals its defined leg structure, floating top with solid edge, and precise interior fittings. Available in a variety of sizes and materials, the spare but spirited Tokyo Console does more with less.

​TANAMI is a striking new addition to BDI’s growing credenza category, designed by Matthew Weatherly. Inspired by the Tanami desert, this credenza features three-dimensional dune-like waves across the door fascia and side panels, creating depth and texture. These flowing, sculpted patterns contrast with the credenza's straight lines, resulting a stunning console that is sure to be the focal point of any room.

The carved and textured doors conceal four compartments inside, each with an adjustable shelf for storage of various essentials, whether for the dining room, entryway, bedroom or entertainment room. Wire management holes in the back of the cabinet as well as integrated ventilation make it suitable for light media use.

Measuring 32" H x 84" W x 18" D, the Tanami can display a TV up to 85" if used as a media cabinet, and can also store up to 12 components. However used, Tanami boasts a stunning Satin White finish that makes it as beautiful as it is functional.

Deep set drawer fronts, detailed by a wood pull, reinforce the linear design and create a seductive shadow line. Dusk-colored drawer and door interiors provide a surprise dose of color while a square steel base ties it all together, forming an elegantly, uncomplicated form.

To maintain the quality of our handcrafted products Kisabeth still relies on the same traditional furniture making techniques we've used since 1958. Not only that, but we constantly reference our product archive dating back to the 1960s. We're as proud of our midcentury roots as we are our commitment to handcrafting furniture, which is why we introduced a collection with modern flair that highlights craftsmanship and our expanded casegood capabilities, and also serves as inspiration for our trade clientele. We wanted it to feel relevant & fresh, hence Cuba. Our 2017 spring/summer capsule collection, La Habana, is comprised of seven pieces: a smoking chair, smoking table, room screen, love seat, bar cabinet, humidor & tufted ottoman. Inspired by Cuba, designed to inspire.
+ Cristobal: smoking chair shown in leather with casters in brass with antiqued finish
+ Gloria: love seat in walnut with contrasting upholstery from Robert Allen
+ Celia: smoking table in African mahogany in natural finish
+ La Palma: room screen in Baltic birch with custom hand-applied finish
+ Desi: bar cabinet featuring a pull-out shelf in veneer with front doors veneered in broken striped sapele & primavera, back, legs & stretcher in African mahogany, maple interior (rendering in PDF does not show final configuration of interior), interior and exterior of cabinet and stretcher feature natural fiber wallcovering from Tri-Kes; doors telescope open
+ Felix: humidor with exterior in burl veneer, top & base are African mahogany, glass panel inset top, interior is Spanish cedar, 23K gold pinstripe, analog hygrometer & electric humidifier
+ Diaz: tufted leather ottoman

Soulbox is a unique piece with a chameleonic format, both in appearance and functionality. It is an altar, a vitrine, a display case, a source of light, an object with its own personality, its appearance transforming with the light that is reflected on its surface.
Soulbox is the treasure chest where we save relics, objects for a collection or with a specific emotional value; a place to display intimate pieces. It can also be the vitrine where objects of daily use can be organized: the wine glasses and bottles in the dining room, a selection of books in the office, or cosmetic products in a bathroom.
Soulbox does not need a material content to justify its raison d'etre. It can be empty and still fill the room with the color of its materials, the reflections and the light it shines.
Soulbox has a simple and functional design. The visual effect of the acrylic glass plates of different colors is highlighted by the installation of LED strips in its back, and by the use of iridescent vinyl.

SOULBOX has been exhibited in Zona MACO Art Fair, CDMX, Mexico (February 2017) and in Producto Fresco – Fresh Product, Madrid, Spain (June 2017).

Workshop/APD by Desiron marks New York-based architecture and design firm Workshop/APD’s first commercially available furniture collection and is largely inspired by American Craftsmanship and the power of man and machine. It highlights the strength and raw beauty of natural materials as exposed to the elements overtime with blackened steel, hand-charred woods and textured basalt stones and combines those natural pieces with modern black delrin and glass.

In bringing the collection to life, Desiron leveraged the skills and abilities of the artisans at its 30,000 square foot New Jersey factory experimenting with the ancient Japanese art of Shou Sugi Ban to create blackened wood while also developing a raw, gradient metal finish called “oil quenched steel” that creates an amber in both color and texture.

“In designing this collection, we were particularly inspired by the use of materials and how they tell the story of the artisans who manipulate them,” said Matt Berman, Co-Founder and Principal of Workshop/APD. “We were drawn to the idea of the craftsperson and chose to use textured stones, metals that show a natural patina and wood that was charred by hand using Desiron’s expert techniques.”

One of the standouts in this five-piece collection is the Bar Cart, designed to stand alone or serve as an accent piece in a residential living space. Each piece in this collection has a thin elegance in its line - like a drawing. Whether used for storing liquor, decanters, barware, or even used as a decorative piece to house candles, blankets, or other unconventional items for a bar cart – its sophisticated, sleek lines and rugged finishes, which are entirely customizable, lend an artistic point of view to interiors.

Inspired by Art Deco and the beauty of aeronautic design, the J28 Desk combines masculine materials and feminine curves. Composed of open pore oak, a stainless steel frame finished in medium bronze color, and topped with rich chocolate leather, the desk is a key piece in any home

Collection Story
Malden’s key property is its regal wrap-around metal frame. The vibrantly colored outline offsets the central rectangular components we embraced throughout the heart of these solid mahogany pieces, creating an extremely functional piece with a tasteful and lively trim.

How It Is Made
Hanging cabinet framed by hand-distressed, painted iron
Crafted from solid mahogany and treated with matte protective coating
Two fold-down shelves reveal large storage compartments
Adjustable feet to level table on uneven surfaces
Expect slight natural variation in the mahogany and iron

Details & Dimensions
DIMENSIONS

Overall Dimensions: 24"H x 55"W x 18"D
Table Top Dimensions: 55"W x 18"D
Flip-down Doors: 2
Number of Shelves: 1
Leg Height:3.5"

Product > green innovation.description_html:
At Naava we are reconnecting humanity with nature. We use future technology that embraces millions of years of natural innovation combined with Scandinavian design. We make the smartest green walls on the planet to bring nature inside, everywhere. Naava smart green walls transform indoor air and positively impact your wellbeing. Naava’s technology elevates the air purification efficiency of plants to a whole new level and creates fresh indoor air.

Wherever you are should feel like a walk in the park. Naava makes it happen by bringing fresh forest air and real nature indoors.

The Naava is a modular plug and play green wall system that fits seamlessly into any interior environment. All you have to do is plug your Naava into a standard outlet and Naava service and the system takes care of itself. All you have to do is Breathe.

Achieving the highest level of material transparency with the newest LEED v4 credit, Encryption illustrates the increasingly blurred line between people and technology while challenging the status quo of sustainable flooring. A technological exploration of shadow and highlights, layers of pixelated color blocks create pseudo-random patterns for familiar yet novel structure, while digitally encoded texture lends elevated dimensionality.

Encryption fulfills the stringent requirements of the newest LEED v4 credit addressing material traceability and transparency: LEED v4 MRc4 Building Product Disclosure and Optimization - Material Ingredients credit (Option 3). The next tier of material transparency, this credit dives into the chemical makeup of supplier materials for an elevated understanding of their resulting human and environmental health impacts. Milliken is the first flooring manufacturer that can contribute to this credit.

The new LEED v4 credit is designed to reward manufacturers who optimize supplier material chemistry. The rigorous process includes:

• Formalizing a plan to optimize supplier chemistry,
• Understanding what is in 99 percent by mass of all chemical ingredients in a supplier’s product, such as nylon yarn,
• Understanding the chemical composition and potential associated hazards in a supplier’s product,
• Notifying suppliers if hazardous ingredients are found in formulations, per Table 1 GHS Hazard Criteria for Endpoint for Option 3 Screening, and
• Confirming that manufacturers and suppliers had the appropriate environment and health and safety systems in place to cover potentially hazards ingredients.

This transparency level is revolutionary in the marketplace, but essential to fully understand the true health impact of materials.

The result of Milliken’s unparalleled design, research and development capabilities to solve some of the most pressing issues of interior flooring, Encryption merges a sustainable, performance-driven construction with innovative design.

To minimize raw materials without compromising performance, Encryption features 39.3% total recycled content. A proprietary moisture vapor-wicking cushion backing extends its usable life up to 40% more than other carpets and eliminates conditions in which mold and mildew grow.

The PVC-free construction also prioritizes occupant well-being. An optional TractionBack® bio-based, adhesive-free installation technology improves indoor air quality by reducing or eliminating volatile organic compound off-gassing. There is also no waste, such as peel/stick backings.

For environmental and material health impacts, Encryption carries a third-party verified Environmental Product Declaration and third-party verified Red List Compliant Declare Label to provide transparency for any ingredient that constitutes 0.01% of the carpet. Milliken believes in intelligent sourcing, and this deep understanding extends to the materials our suppliers use to create products, from yarn to recycled content. Encryption is also made with up to 52% renewable energy through Milliken-owned hydroelectric energy generation.

Zero process waste from the manufacturing of Encryption is sent to landfill – an achievement of Milliken’s for a quarter of a century. With Milliken’s Landfill Diversion Program, the company reclaims used carpet and identifies the eco-friendliest form of diversion.

Available in 25 cm x 1 m modular carpet tiles.

Tinted Paper Terrazzo and Tonal Paper Terrazzo are the result of Formica Corporation’s approach to recycled materials. With future generations in mind, natural and manmade materials collaborate to create something entirely new. Recycling goes further as we rethink what we throw away, resulting in something totally original. The intent is not only to enhance our resources, but also to manipulate and marry them with synthetic materials to create intriguing new composites. For example, two Paper Terrazzo patterns utilize small fragments of post-production solid-color paper from Formica® Laminate that would otherwise have gone to waste.
Product > green innovation.product_name: Tinted Paper Terrazzo and Tonal Paper Terrazzo

Product > green innovation.description_html:
Vinylife by Fil Doux Textiles is an innovative game-changer for the textile industry. Produced with a natural enzyme which reacts to microorganisms found in biologically active landfills and that acts as the catalyst for its decomposition, the material is now treated with Pro-Tech, the company’s standout proprietary ink and stain protectant.

“We’re so excited about this revolutionary product,” says Fil Doux Textiles president Leonardo Novik. “Vinylife is a huge step forward for the marketplace. We now have access to the durability and cleanability of vinyl, with a significantly improved sustainability story, which speaks to our goal of providing products that are beautiful and environmentally aware.”

Vinylife was accepted Material ConneXion, the comprehensive resource center dedicated to international material innovation, and achieved its enhanced status for biodegradability through the ASTM D5511 test method. The material’s durability makes it ideal for use in commercial projects of all kinds, as well as in the home.

In fall 2017, the ARTE collection will update Fil Doux Textiles’ Vinylife offerings, and will consist of sophisticated leather looks, ranging from natural beiges and browns to deep and expressive purples, greens, and reds. These new patterns provide an elegant touch of leather to any space, while being 100% cruelty free and maintaining a revolutionary, eco-friendly composition.

A collision of colors, textures, and surfaces gives rise to the Era & Karim Rashid furniture collection. Consisting of a sofa, table, and desk, the collection is a collaboration of essential design, sustainability, and expert craftsmanship that truly embodies Design for Everyone.

The plush Krate sofa is comprised of soft edged-planes converging into a minimal and sophisticated interplay of upholstery and wood. Eschewing with all but the most necessary details, Krate is simple but definitely not basic.

Kolor desk intelligently adds vibrancy to any environment. The clean, streamlined desk design gets a playful pop of color from its row of multi-color drawers, bestowing it with a lyrical quality while also providing an orderly visual system of organization.

Embodying balance and luxury, the Kollide table gets its name from 3 flat wooden (lacquered and natural) boards colliding and creating a base for a glass top. The repeated, intersecting ovoid shapes harmonize separate elements into an irresistible whole.

Another feature of the collection’s timeless design is its commitment to sustainability. Wood used in production is derived from raw materials from Croatian forests guaranteeing responsible management and adherence to strict environmental regulations. During the final processing vegetable oil is used instead of toxic paints or varnishes, preserving the natural state of the wood and eliminating harmful evaporation into the area. The result is progressive design that “lasts as long as an era."

The Lichen Collection by Mohawk Group is a new Red List Free modular plank carpet system resulting from innovations that merge leading concepts in biophilic design and sustainability. Designed by Jason F. McLennan, the founder of the Living Product Challenge (LPC), and his team at McLennan Design, Lichen is the first flooring product to achieve the International Living Future Institute’s LPC Petal Certification. Inspired by the idea of “Nature’s Carpet,” the design team looked at natural assemblages of rich multi-hued, multi-textured lichens from extreme climates as the foundation for the collection. Patterns within the collection mimic nature through a large-scale field of lichen “blooms,” a transitional style with fewer blooms, and a textured ground pattern, designed to be used as a system or to individually standalone.

The creation and specifying of Lichen has a net positive impact for people and the environment. Lichen continues to give back through innovations in materials, manufacturing and community involvement, which encompassed the donation of 140 low-flow shower heads to Morehouse College to offset the amount of water used in the collection’s manufacturing. It is truly sustainable, leaving a handprint rather than a footprint. Just as lichens play a regenerative role in their natural ecosystem, the Lichen Collection gives more resources back to the environment than it uses during its entire life cycle.

Product > hardware.description_html:
Baldwin Evolved is a premier collection of door hardware that delivers an electronic solution to exceed luxurious architectural standards. Powered by Kevo-technology, the Evolved collection is the next generation of smart lock technology handlesets and deadbolts.
Evolved is extremely secure, both digitally and mechanically. It uses multiple levels of encryption to increase digital security, and is continually reviewed by industry-leading digital security experts.
Evolved allows users to easily open and close doors via their smartphone and the Kevo mobile app which is available for iPhones 4S and above and select Android devices. The easy-to-use app also provides eKeys for remote access, real-time access history and remote unlocking abilities. Key fobs are available for entry without a smartphone.
While maintaining beautiful aesthetics and upholding iconic style, Evolved’s streamlined design easily conceals the technology in a smart, sleek interior design that is 60 percent smaller than other electronic products on the market.
By leveraging Bluetooth technology, Evolved offers an easy touch-to-open solution in 18 handleset styles, three deadbolts, and four interiors. Customers can choose from 18 Baldwin finishes for customizable look.
Customers can also bring Evolved to life on their own front door with Baldwin’s new augmented reality app.

Timber is a fascinating material. Its organic beauty is apparent in its grain, colour and texture, with each piece unique in its characteristics. At Designer Doorware, we’ve been using timber in a range of our entrance handles for years, its natural aesthetic creating a soft touch and giving a feeling of warmth to the entrance of any project. However, with a recent rise in the demands for architectural timber products from architects, we’ve begun looking at further ways to bring this natural material into our products.

The Monte Timber lever collection was the culmination of 4 years of on-going research and development. The aim was to design a beautiful timber lever range that met the needs of the time. The desire to introduce warmth and comfort into our product range by utilizing the natural characteristics of timber. We were driven by the tactile aspects of the user experience.

This year, we would like to present our latest additions to the Monte Timber Collection:

Timber Zola lever
Slimline and minimal, the perfect fusion of comfort and bold geometry. This door handle lever is capable of acclimatizing to both contemporary and timeless interiors.

Timber Niki knob
Natural, humble and elegant, the Timber Niki’s enchanting simplicity and earthen charisma are a testament to the statement – less is more. Mounted on a round rose, the Timber Niki adds a captivating touch to any door.

Materials: Brass/Wood (American White Oak and American Black Walnut). The use of AFS and PEFC certified timber upholds the sustainable use of a material that will promote warmth and comfort during use.

Warm and textured timber door hardware designs with clean lines, simple curvature, timeless silhouettes, refined proportions and the ability to be purchased in over 35 finish combinations so that you can personalise the finish to your liking.

Create the ultimate contemporary aesthetic with Emtek’s new Adelaide and Brisbane Narrow Mortise Locks and Door Pull. The entry plates feature a slender width of only 1¾” and are available in full-length, monolithic, lever by lever, and knob by knob configurations.

Joining this new collection of sleek door hardware is the Brisbane 8” door pull, which is also available for Back to Back applications.

The Adelaide and Brisbane designs are available in Satin Brass, Oil Rubbed Bronze, Satin Nickel, Flat Black, Polished Chrome and Unlacquered Brass.
Product > hardware.product_name: Adelaide and Brisbane Narrow Trim Mortise Locks

Product > hardware.description_html:
The Linn Collection is a unique, geometric design that is perfect for any application--from a nightstand to a bathroom cabinet knob, this hardware design is like jewelry for your door/drawer faces.

The Linn is milled out of solid brass right down the street from our studio in Los Angeles. Each piece is then carefully brushed by hand to give it a very soft, satin texture. The Linn will develop a rich, natural patina as the piece matures with age and use.

The Linn also comes in a black finish, which is milled out of solid aluminum and then anodized with a flat black finish.

Dimensions:
Diameter / 1.25"
Projection / 1.25"

“Less is more” has long been a minimalist design principle, and it’s one that Rocky Mountain Hardware has recently put into practice, creating a collection of door sets reflective of the aesthetic. “Edge” is the new arrival, distinguished by an escutcheon that measures 2 inches wide vs. the standard 2.5-inch. This slimmer, narrower style adds a more contemporary choice to Rocky Mountain’s swelling portfolio of products, and answers the call from architect and interior designer clients for hardware that has a smaller dimension . With the launch of “Edge” also come two new textured finishes exclusive to the series: Wire is a tactile as well as visual tease, with a tangle of lines enwrapping the surface; and Moonscape has a fluidity that’s frozen in place, created by a bronze over pour in production and resulting in an intriguing motif. In addition to these edgier treatments, “Edge” is offered in four other texture options that have long been in Rocky Mountain’s lineup along with a choice of 10 high quality finishes that are signatures of the brand’s art-bronze construction. Ideal for residential as well as commercial projects, the “Edge” group includes a complete offering of all door hardware functions—from entry to interior and even sliding. From the company’s inception, customization has been a core tenet, and it’s especially applicable with “Edge.” Architects and interior designers can specify their style of lever to match with the “Edge” escutcheon plate, plus propose individualized adaptions and modifications to satisfy a client’s tastes and needs. Nickum suggested one of the optimum ways to begin the selection process is to visit the company’s “Design Your Own” digital tool on its website, an easily navigable program for mixing and matching components and deciding choices.

Inspired by tropical nights and the captivating rhythm of Latin music, the new Conga Collection from Atlas Homewares combines tiki-style chic with the clean lines of mid-century minimalism. The end result is a hip, contemporary look that is decidedly unique and the perfect solution for those who want to add a cool hint of the Caribbean to their décor. Conga adds a tropical feel that is understated yet versatile and perfectly at home in South Beach, the Cape or in an upscale penthouse in the heart of the city.

The Conga Collection is notable for its drum-inspired knobs and a smooth, ergonomic design with a subtle groove for added interest. Options include two knob sizes and four pulls ranging from 3 ¾ to 7 ½. Available in a selection of five beautiful finishes, including Polished Chrome, Polished Nickel,
Brushed Nickel, Matte Black and new Warm Brass.

The Affinity Collection of bold pulls and knobs are a stunning addition to any modern cabinet or furniture piece. There is bulk and weight to these pieces which are available in clear, white or gray glass, with polished chrome, polished nickel, satin nickel or satin brass bases. Pulls are available in 6”, 8” and 10” lengths.

Sietto Handcrafted Cabinet Hardware fuses glass, making each piece by hand in the USA. We saw a need in the marketplace for distinctive, yet neutral, hardware. Designed to be bulky, and accommodate clear glass - an often requested option - this line of hardware has set itself apart from the crowd.

Pom Pom is a suite of hardware designed with Nina Campbell at the SA Baxter Design Studio in New York's Hudson Valley.

When asked about working with the SA Baxter Design Studio, Campbell replied, “Working with the SA Baxter Design Studio, I developed two ironmongery suites. The first, titled POMPOM, was inspired by a pattern with red and yellow alternating pompoms. The second suite which I titled Floral was inspired by another fabric; this time a whimsical floral design.”

This welded steel tube door pull has a vegetable-tanned leather grip that is stitched by hand. The door pull is available in standard blackened and waxed finished steel, in stainless steel with a satin bead-blasted finish, or in bronze with an oil-rubbed finish. The un-dyed natural color leather option darkens over time to a deep brown. For a less “live” finish, the leather is also available in black
Product > hardware.product_name: B. Hide - The Tom Kundig Collection

Product > hardware.description_html:
DLV Designs for Holland & Sherry
A hardware collection that represents a uniquely intuitive collaboration between creative minds. DLV Designs, founded in 2009 by Studio Sofield alumnus Mark de la Vega and based in Red Hook, Brooklyn, is sought out within the design world for its rugged yet luxurious take on modernism. DLV's rich palette and signature mix of materials combines with Holland & Sherry's clean lined aesthetic to create seven bold pieces, each with its own distinct personality. Four metal finishes, three wood finishes, and numerous specialty materials offer mix-and-match options to define beautifully suited hardware for both traditional and modern interiors.

The ASSA ABLOY PDU 8000 is a striking departure from industry offerings, in terms of security and attractiveness, and demonstrates ASSA ABLOY’s determination and capacity to reset expectations for what is achievable with glass.

Designed with the glazier in mind, the new ASSA ABLOY PDU 8000 panic device for glass is a top latching panic device with easy align security latch and engraved latch lines to ensure proper engagement with strike. It is available in keyed and non-keyed options and requires less than 5 lbs. of force to activate.

Designers and architects will be similarly impressed with a clever, attractive design; the availability of six standard exterior pull options; a post mount design that matches Rockwood architectural pulls; a selection of finishes and engraved push area and boundary grooves for enhanced visibility and tactility. Whether choosing a manual or electric strike, this line provides aesthetic sophistication, security, and peace of mind.

Each piece of the Freya Hardware Pull series is masterfully hand-crafted out of genuine, sustainably-sourced horn. Paying homage to earth’s bounty of elements and organic sophistication, the unique tonal, natural beauty of horn resonate against hand-cast metal. The Freya Pulls are offered in both light horn and dark variegated horn, in many sizes and metal finishes, and made locally in Matthew Studios' Harlem, NY studio.

The Pemko Designer Series flat track sliding door hardware is more than a standard decorative sliding door solution. Designed to effortlessly move wood doors weighing up to 500 lbs, it is a perfect fit for high end commercial properties, including offices and hotels, looking to save space while adding visual appeal to
the room.

Whether looking for a contemporary design or rustic appeal, the Designer Series’ four hanger options and five available finishes offer the flexibility to select a perfect match for the surrounding décor. The wheel style and fasteners are also carefully coordinated with the hanger design to give each configuration its own unique appeal. This attention to detail ensures the Pemko Designer Series will add form and function to any environment.

Each Designer Series flat track sliding door system comes complete with 2 hangers, 2 anti-rise blocks, 2 stops, 1 bottom guide, track and mounting hardware. Select from 6' or 8' track lengths with custom lengths available.

The Kyoto Collection is a new collaboration between Sun Valley Bronze & De Reus Architects. The Zen - inspired aesthetic of wabi sabi has guided the design in Kyoto for many centuries. In this ideal, the principles of both aesthetics and functionality motivate the designs of gardens, building and products. The result is often an elegant simplicity that is timeless. De Reus Architects pays their respect to this design philosophy of restraint and beauty by calling the this new line of hardware, The Kyoto Collection.

The Bullet Door Lever - It's all about the details

Perfectly shaped, and hand cast in Turnstyles’ trademark Amalfine™ composite, it is wonderfully tactile and ergonomic. Cast from a piece of rough hewn timber, the casting picks up every detail of wood grain
With the delicate balance between positive and negative space, the Channel collection adds a touch of Bauhaus with a modern, clean feel.
The Avenue collection applies a minimalist approach to the deliberate, function focused designs found in urban engineering; the resulting shape portrays strength and elegance.

Seprepnt is a suite of hardware designed in with by SA Baxter and Alexa Hampton at the SA Baxter Design Studio in New York's Hudson Valley. Each design is handcrafted using the ancient process of lost-wax casting, allowing SA Baxter to create designs unlike anyone else.

When asked about the design Alexa said, “The suite is named Serpent and Balthazar after a snake which inspired me. Looking at Serpent, you’ll notice the presence of scales on the rosette and doorknob.”

Top Knobs, known for their exceptional cabinet hardware, introduce the Brixton series in the transitional Devon Collection.

Crafted from the highest quality materials and backed by Top Knobs’ lifetime warranty, the Brixton series feature classic shapes that easily blend with any traditional, contemporary or modern kitchen or bath design. Both series include two new finishes: Ash Gray, a rich on-trend gray, and Honey Bronze, a light brass tone.

Featuring a masculine, industrial look, the Brixton series includes knobs, pulls and appliance pulls. Classic in feel, the series works in any style design. Each has layered, pipe-like details at base. The pulls in the series are a modern interpretation of the Top Knobs Normandy pull.

Product Details:
Available in 10 sizes and 8 finishes
• Three knobs: 1 ¼” Rimmed Knob, 1 ¼” Ridged Knob and 1 ¼” Button Knob
• Coordinating decorative back plate measuring 1 3/8”
• Six pulls: 3 ¾”, 5 1/16”, 6 5/16”, 7 9/16”, 8 13/16” and 12” center to center sizes
• Matching 12” Appliance Pull
• Eight finishes: Ash Gray, Black, Brushed Satin Nickel, Honey Bronze, Polished Chrome, Polished Nickel, Sable and Umbrio

MSRP is $7.00 to $74.50 per piece. The Devon Collection of 36 pieces in five series is inspired by the character of harbor towns and villages of Devon County in southwest England. All Top Knobs products come with proprietary sealed finish and lifetime warranty.

The Sutter is milled out of solid brass right down the street from our studio in Los Angeles. Each piece is then carefully brushed by hand to give it a very soft, satin texture. The Sutter will develop a rich, natural patina as the piece matures with age and use.

The Sutter also comes in a black finish, which is milled out of solid aluminum and then anodized with a flat black finish. This is a timeless design that will look amazing in any space, from your kitchen cabinets to a built in dresser.

You can choose from 2 different widths, 1" or .5"
Dimensions: Width / 1"W OR .5"W x 2"H x 1.25" projection

Otto is the most secure digital lock designed around the family experience.

Designed by a team of award-winning engineers from Apple, Microsoft and Nokia, Otto spent four years in development before unveiling in August 2017.

Founder and CEO, Sam Jadallah, was inspired to create Otto after being involved in his family’s door manufacturing company. Sam, a former Microsoft executive and VC, realized locks on the market were insecure, bulky, and dated. He vowed to create something better, focusing on security, design and performance.



Sam rounded up a team of designers and engineers (who share 175 patents and 13-years average experience) and investors from Greylock Partners, to reimagine home access and the relationship between people and spaces.

Nico Lylyk, Otto’s head of design, is an award-winning (Yellow Pencil Award, IDEA Award and AIDA Gold Award) Argentine designer who previously worked at Nokia. Tasked with creating a category-defining product, Nico focused on differentiating Otto with quality materials and timeless, minimalistic design.

But first Nico had to remove the object we most associate with locks: the key. Eliminating the key was a bold decision with security in mind–keys and keypads are the most vulnerable aspects of locks. Otto is the first digital lock designed without a key. And it’s no larger than the deadbolt it replaces.

Otto was designed to be a singular home access solution. It has built-in Wi-Fi (unique to the industry), and users can remotely check the status of their lock and lock/unlock from anywhere. By enabling Otto with Wi-Fi and ample processing power, the lock receives ongoing upgrades to features and security.

Otto recognizes authorized users as they arrive, allowing them to press to unlock without needing to pull out their phone--a feature unique to Otto. Using the Otto App, owners can grant access to guests 24x7 or designated times. Users can also gain access using a 4-digit entry code, with an intuitive interface akin to entering a code on a safe.

Otto set a new industry standard in lock testing. The team developed its own fleet of robots to test the device, slamming it over 100,000 times at 60Gs of force (two or three times more than the average door slam), and putting it through 250,000+ cycles of locking and unlocking to test durability. Otto’s design is built to last: durable, reliable, and secure.

A well-designed product delivers an “ah-ha” moment. Otto feels different yet familiar. It achieves the unexpected, but in ways that anticipate your needs.

The best product of the year should raise the bar. It should change our lives in small but meaningful ways. After experiencing Otto, we can’t imagine going back to what was. Despite years of hype, digital locks have yet to be adopted. Homeowners have been stuck with the nearly century-old deadbolt & key.

Until now. The Otto Digital Lock is unlike any other, demonstrating clear advances in security, design, and performance.

Product > kitchen: appliances.description_html:
Zephyr’s Anzio, Ravenna, and Savona are the industry’s first kitchen ventilation hoods in Black Stainless Steel made with titanium coating. A sleek alternative to standard stainless steel, the three hoods are made with titanium coating: a military-grade built-in layer of protection with an anti-smudge coating for easing cleaning. The hoods are available in chimney-style wall mount and the Ravenna features a smoke-gray glass canopy. In addition, the hoods are equipped with BriteStrip™ LED lighting, ICON Touch® Controls and Airflow Control Technology (ACT™).

The Black Stainless Steel hoods all include Zephyr’s new BriteStrip™ LED lighting and ICON Touch® Controls that seamlessly integrate into the hood’s canopy. Users can easily control the 5-speeds, delay-off function and auto reminders. Zephyr also incorporated its exclusive Airflow Control Technology (ACT™) - technology that gives builders and developers the freedom to install range hoods with maximum blower CFM, without having to compromise power or design.

Zephyr’s Black Stainless Steel hoods are made with Solid Titanium that is transported on the stainless steel through a Physical Vapor Deposition (PVD) process. This makes the material more uniform and durable than a traditional coating process. The PVD process is also an eco-friendly technology (in contrast to chemical and galvanic surface treatments) that is clean and dry with no hazardous materials involved, and does not generate chemical waste or water pollution.

The successful launch of Zephyr’s Black Stainless Steel hoods proves that designers and homeowners want options when it comes to their appliance finishes in the kitchen. The industry is moving away from all stainless steel kitchens with the introduction of warmer tones such as Rose Gold, Copper, and Brass. Black Stainless complements these products and gives consumers customization options that were never before available.

For those who aspire to achieve iconic style and premium performance in the home, meet the new LA CUCINA line from SUPERIORE. Characterized by clean lines, robust materials, and diverse finishes, LA CUCINA offers new possibilities in the kitchen. The LA CUCINA 30" range features SUPERIORE's unique PANORAMA Window and versatile five gas brass burner configuration. The range also boasts an extra-large capacity gas, convection oven with infrared broiler, delivering the efficient performance every home chef craves. In addition to the 30" range, available in stainless steel, the LA CUCINA line also offers a 36" range, available in stainless steel and eight other cutting-edge colors in four daring finishes.

The new Miele 24" PerfectCool Bottom Mount Refrigerator offers ideal storage conditions for food without the loss of vitamins and flavor. With respect to the design and user convenience, Miele PerfectCool appliances are first choice. Featuring PerfectFresh Pro technology, fruits and vegetables can be easily stored at the appropriate humidity level to keep them fresher longer while DynaCool offers uniform distribution of temperature and excellent circulation. With FlexiLight shelving, LED light sources can be positioned individually depending on how each shelf is filled. Maintenance is a breeze with ComfortClean shelves that are dishwasher safe. The compact, unpretentious design blends in harmoniously with kitchen cabinetry and SoftClose hinges allow the self-closing door to close slowly, preventing items from falling out. Clear, concise and convenient controls keep the user well informed. The idea conditions for simplifying your life!

For the first time, Frigidaire is bringing induction cooking to the masses, with ranges and cooktops that are available for less than $1,000. The new Frigidaire FS Induction Range (FFIF3054TS) streamlines, simplifies and quickens the cooking process. The induction technology brings water to a boil 50 percent faster than conventional ovens and heats pans faster so it takes less time to cook. The cooktop cools quickly since the heat is created in the pan itself, meaning it’s far less likely for the cooktop to cause a burn. Induction also allows for much more precise control of heat, with more temperature increments and better performance at very low heat settings for more even results every time. Finally, the technology makes clean-up far less-intensive. Since the cooktop seldom gets very hot, food doesn't burn onto it. This means a splatter, a spill or a pasta-sauce pop calls for a quick swipe of the sponge, not a good, long scrub.

The Thermador dish care line makes up its own unique category within the industry: the luxury dishwasher. This year’s newly introduced Star-Sapphire™ Dishwasher offers greater capacity, incredible speed and more flexibility, and is equipped with several exceptional features.

These features include: the Entertainer’s Drawer, a premium third rack that provides two inches of clearance for hard-to-place items that are typically hand-washed or that take up valuable space on the top rack; Star Glow, an industry first, which allows you to customize lighting and choose from three vivid shades of blue or three radiant shades of white to add extra ambiance when preparing or cleaning up after a meal – as well as to show off the clean, sparkling shine of the glass; Star Speed®, a hot water cycle at an unprecedented 20 minutes; Smooth Glide Racks, gentle racks that minimize friction and noise, and feel smooth no matter how many items you load, so you can discreetly fill the dishwasher while entertaining.

The Star-Sapphire™ Dishwasher offers the largest wine glass capacity available in the industry and can hold up to 18 wine glasses on the top and bottom rack. With a sleek stainless steel design that provides a choice of two handle designs, flush installation and the choice to utilize a custom panel, the ultra-premium touch and feel elevate this dishwasher to the level of luxury across your entire kitchen.

BlueStar®, manufacturer of high-performance kitchen appliances, is raising the standard once again for ultra-premium home kitchens with the introduction of a new Double Electric Wall Oven, bringing its iconic brand of true professional performance to electric cooking. The essence of the BlueStar® brand is putting the tools of the professional restaurant chef within reach of the home cook. Now, home cooks can design a complete electric kitchen with authentic, commercial-style accruements. Combine the new double electric wall oven with the new 36-inch Induction Cooktop, which features the most powerful single burner in the industry, for a complete commercial-grade electric kitchen.

New Double Electric Wall Oven: Professional Performance, Unmatched Capacity
The BlueStar® Double Electric Wall Oven offers unmatched performance and capacity for the home chef. The powerful 2,500 watt bake element and the intense 5,000 watt infrared broiler provide restaurant-quality results every time. The 1800 watt heat assist element in the back of the cavity means faster preheating and less time waiting. Twelve different cooking modes including Bake, Convection Bake, Roast, Convection Roast, Broil, StoneBake™, Proof and Sabbath, provide numerous cooking options for unmatched versatility.

The oven features True European Convection for optimal heat circulation and faster and more even results. A precision temperature probe offers the ideal way to obtain the perfect temperature for any meat. The extra-large cooking cavity is perfect for roasting, baking and broiling for a crowd and can accommodate a full-size 18″ x 26″ commercial-size baking sheet.

A professional-quality, integrated artesian baking stone can used to create perfectly crisp breads and pizza which can be cooked right on top of the baking stone for restaurant style results. The stone mimics the conditions in brick ovens by absorbing heat from the oven to bake bread – and practically anything else – directly on top of the heat source. The built-in temperature probe on the baking stone helps insure perfect results every time.
The exclusive, eco-friendly Continu Clean™ helps keep the oven cleaner without extreme temperatures or harsh cleaning chemicals. Continu Clean™ works every time the oven is on, saving the hassle of a dedicated cleaning cycle. Or, if preferred, the available Self Clean mode can be used so that the oven is cleaned automatically by a special high-temperature setting.

Like all BlueStar® products, the BlueStar® Double Electric Wall oven can be tailored to suit any individual style or cooking preference. To maximize the cooking experience, the oven is available in single or double drop down doors, and chef-preferred French doors: pull the left door open and the right one swings open automatically, adding functionality and style. A new feature, an intuitive, single controller, makes it easy to operate both the top and bottom oven.

Customize any BlueStar® Electric Wall Oven with over 750 colors and finishes. Even the knobs are available in 190 colors, and both knobs and trims are offered in 10+ designer metals. You can “Build Your Own BlueStar” online.

Designers can achieve the ultimate customization in luxury refrigeration with True®’s new Custom Finishes and Hardware options for its dynamic 30-Inch Columns. The Antique White, Matte Black and Gloss Black new custom finishes and Copper, Brass and Chrome timeless hardware options add up to nine unique combinations that suit different styles and kitchen needs.

The 30-Inch Refrigerator and Wine Column range includes both solid door and industry-exclusive glass door refrigerator with optional LED lighting. The 30-Inch Wine Column boasts intuitive dual-zone True Precision® Control, full-extension smooth-glide racks, and gentle TruLumina® LED lighting to protect, store and display up to 150 bottles. Twenty-five percent larger than other 30-inch built-in and integrated refrigerator columns, these models feature True’s industry-exclusive, 300-series stainless steel interiors and exteriors, making them hygienic, easy to clean and impervious to food odors.

Handcrafted in the USA, the units have 120-degree stay-open doors (with hinges that pass True’s million-opening test) and ergonomic, commercial-style tubular handles. With True’s new custom finishes and hardware available for its innovative 30-Inch Columns, designers and homeowners are now able to bring a level of sophisticated elegance previously unattainable in refrigeration.
Product > kitchen: appliances.product_name: 30-Inch Columns in Custom Finishes and Hardware

The only 36” double oven range on the market is now available without the need for a gas connection. The double oven option is offered in stainless steel in both the Verona N Series and the Verona Classic range Collections. The black ceramic glass cooktop is equipped with five sealed elements including a powerful dual element in the center.

Both range options are fully equipped with an easily programmed multi-function European convection oven. Both ovens provide seven cooking modes including three baking modes (Bake, Fan Oven, Convection Bake); three radiant modes (Broil, Convection Broil, Dual Broil) and a Defrost mode. Additionally, a full width compartment provides an expansive storage capacity.

MSRP starts at $3849
