Devised as an evolution of the Volta lamp, the delicate suspended arches now become iconic circles that sketch out different ensembles in the air depending on the way they are arranged. Empty planes that are optionally filled with color when upholstered to become practical sound-absorbing panels.
Customizable according to the layout of the circles, the Revolta lamp is equipped with adjustable-intensity LED technology. It features a tabletop version with the same circular body.

The Quorra contemporary light fixture by Feiss delivers a burst of energy as a completely modern interpretation of a traditional crystal chandelier, with a bit of Mid-Century modern inspiration. Sure to become the focal point of any room, the sculptural, asymmetric starburst silhouette of the Quorra chandelier boasts striated Clear Fluted glass pipes extending in all directions, with lengthy metal rods randomly interspersed between the glass piping, all of which are anchored to a hearty steel hub featuring a new Burnished Brass finish. The scale of this Feiss light fixture is as dramatic as its silhouette. Quorra is available in four sizes: a 12-light chandelier, a 14-light chandelier, a 16-light chandelier (which is depicted in the accompanying photos), and an amazing 41-light chandelier with a 48’ diameter. Installed as a single statement fixture or in a grouping as a stunning art installation, the Quorra chandelier is ideal as dramatic foyer lighting, contemporary dining room lighting, modern bedroom lighting, as well as a wide array of cool commercial lighting like in upscale restaurants and boutique hotels. Damp Rated, the Quorra could also be used as bathroom lighting or as the crowning touch on a covered patio.

Cassiopeia X Porcelain is a collection of mobile chandeliers that are built to order and are fully customizable. Andrea Claire Studio works closely with interior designers and architects around the world to craft custom light-art that complements any size and type of space.
The glowing cast porcelain "Polyhedrons" in this collection use LED technology and are made by hand with specially formulated porcelain slip. ACS has exhaustively tested slip formulas to arrive at the precise color and warmth of translucency Andrea wanted to achieve. The shapes are cast in plaster molds formed from Andrea Claire's signature bamboo Polyhedrons. Because the plaster is very sensitive the porcelain in turn retains traces of the bamboo's texture. Each surface is therefore slightly varied and dynamic. In this work Andrea explores both form and surface, while offering a timeless hand-crafted custom product.
These mobile chandeliers can hang from 1 to 7 stems, and grow from 7 light points to more than 20.
ACS was fortunate to have the first of this collection installed in 2016 in a gorgeous new residence on Martha's Vineyard designed by Robert A. M. Stern. The photo's shown are from that installation and the studio now has several more custom Cassiopeia X Porcelain chandeliers in production.

The Zephyr is an example of what is possible today in “sculptural lighting”. Our makers translate our designers' sketches and maquettes from a 2-D sheet of steel into a sculptural, 3-D form that brings a warmth into a space. An organic, elegant shape flows through the design of the Zephyr LED fixture. The heat-textured, artisan-forged steel morphs into the light guide, made of a seemingly flowing, ribbon-like, hand-shaped acrylic with a laser etched pattern that consistently draws the light from end-to-end, beautifully illuminating the Zephyr’s fine details. This adjustable, cable-hung LED fixture is offered in a choice of 8 finish options.

The hallmark of Hubbardton Forge lighting is design that is graceful and unembellished, allowing the materials and forms to speak for themselves. A continuous exploration of both understanding and pushing the limits of form and materials inspires us to create designs that beautifully meld artistry and functionality.

Hubbardton Forge combines time-honored forging techniques with elegant design and the latest LED technology. All of our products are made-to-order, in Castleton, Vermont. We make products where the craftsmanship and skill clearly show. Any piece leaving the Forge is touched by multiple hands throughout the process of its creation. When you look at a Hubbardton Forge lighting fixture, you're seeing the artistic achievements of a team dedicated to design.

DESCRIPTION
The Vichy Linear Chandelier consists of fourteen triangular pyramidal shades. Each shade is made by hand of thick walled brass. The body and top plate are machined by hand. All parts are hand polished and patina’d. The exterior of each shade is nished in black bronze and the interior shade is Lite Antique.

Glamorously goth or naturally powerful, this natural iron chandelier is the darker, edgier cousin of our gilded version. Perfect for the rustic mountain retreat or an industrial loft in the city. Finished in either gold leaf or natural iron. Additional pipe available. Approved for use in covered outdoor areas. Finish may vary. Designed by Barry Dixon as part of his Barry Dixon for Arteriors collection.

Engineered to the finest detail for unsurpassed performance and design sophistication, Modern Forms was established as a future forward manufacturer and innovative brand of unique upscale all-LED luminaires. Founded as an independent subsidiary of WAC Lighting, Modern Forms took North America by storm in the last five years with avant-garde designs that leverage LED technology developed exclusively by WAC engineering.
Modern Forms is designed to complement a diverse array of architectural interiors and exteriors while delivering high quality, functional illumination for luxury homes, hotels and commercial spaces. Each design is lovingly developed by our in-house designers to showcase innovative applications of upscale materials and painstakingly engineered for the tangible details that convey quality and years of robust performance.
Modern Forms offers a vast presentation that achieves superior illumination from clean upscale forms only made possible with proprietary LED technology. Premium powder coat and plated finishes, marine grade stainless steel constructed designs, gold and silver leafing, and exclusively developed glass and crystal techniques are just a few of the features that speak to discriminating specifiers.
Modern Forms can be reached at 1.866.810.6615 or by visiting www.modernforms.com.

Aesthetically minimal yet full of movement and sensuality, HALO is a bespoke display that features McCormick’s celebrated Halo light. A series of pendants will cascade from ceiling to oor creating the illusion of elegant hanging jewels. Originally conceived as a graphical interpretation of e ervescence, the Halo series is a bold family of lighting xtures inspired by the golden bub-bles oating in an Italian Prosecco. Their modular system allows the pendants to be suspended in a multitude of compositions. Halo echoes McCormick’s desire to convey precision, while inspir-ing the closeness and personal touch that jewelry brings. Machined to perfection so that it both houses the electronics and look sleek, the Halo lights are available in brass, copper, nickel and 24 karat gold nishes.

In collaboration with Rich Brilliant Willing, Meyer Davis designed a new lighting collection including the two pieces: Hoist and Pilot, pendant and sconce collections that combine cutting-edge technology with casual sophistication. With a shared taste for simplicity and “intelligent subtraction,” the two studios developed timeless fixtures suited to a wide range of indoor and outdoor environments, uniquely solving common interior design problems.
The Pilot chandelier is inspired by sculptural and modernist organic forms. Each branch of the Pilot chandelier features a rounded, shell-like shade. Sold as a kit of parts in a range of colors, lengths, and finishes, the compositions of these branches are sculptural exercise, allowing designers and architects to be playful. Configurations range from horizontal starburst ceiling fixtures to lengthy vertical staircase chandeliers. This transformative piece can be installed in spaces that vary dramatically.
We developed tools for designers to create their own atmosphere. Thoughtfully considered and meticulously executed, the pieces elevate practical features like accent finishes and durable materials with a relaxed elegance, adding endless possibilities for installation.

This reinterpretation of a classic candelabra with an LED light source has given rise to this delicately radiant luminaire. Designed to create and accentuate spaces by emanating a poetic and refined light.

The Petaluma is a collection of chandeliers with 1, 2 or 3 tiers. It has a sleek anodized black finish that gives the fixture a clean, modern appearance. This fixture features local-to-LA hand-spun aluminum shades with articulating swivels that direct the light in most any direction you choose. The brass swivels tilt 90° up and down and spin 320°.

The Petaluma Collection complies with Title 24 high efficacy requirements and is also UL listed for dry and damp locations.

With a nod to Mid-Century Modern, this classic Sputnik-shape becomes fresh and modern with the addition of the wood components. The story of the tree is coded in each cut piece as every piece is meticulously cut and hand sanded to create a silky smooth surface to hand finish. The Honeycomb chandelier adds warmth and brightness to any interior with 12 lights totaling 720 watts of light. The chandelier is engineered of a wrought iron frame finished in rich antique brass and embellished with dark walnut cut in a honeycomb shape.

Designer Jamie Beckwith is known for her prestige wood surfacing treatments for both floor and vertical surfaces. Ms. Beckwith shares, " I believe we are pushing boundaries with these new lighting concepts. We are taking a substrate that sometimes can feel bulky or heavy and reinterpreting it into a decorative element that truly is as beautiful as a crystal or a glass chandelier."

Jamie Beckwith Collection was inspired to take 2-dimensional wood components used for flooring and wall applications and create 3-dimensional ornaments for the collaboration with Currey lighting. The wood components were inspired by jewels and the intricate facets and bevels of fine cut jewelry.
Nested inside the hand woven steel sculpture, eight custom blown glass halogen lights cast a subtle dazzling light. Sizes are made to order.

Fire Farm redefines light and sound with the new Feltgood Light Collection.

A study in textural contrasts, glossy white acrylic is paired with soft colorful felt and fashioned into simple bold geometric pendants. The felt sides, a durable polyester made with 50% post-consumer recycled content, appear to be “stitched” into shape by the light glowing from the acrylic tabs. The sound-dampening qualities of the fabric make the Feltgood pendants an excellent choice for creating quieter spaces in hard interiors.

Hung individually, the scale of the Feltgood pendants can be a dramatic focal point in both traditional and modern interiors. The eight colorways and extensive shapes give the designer a full palette of options to create custom lighting environments.

Node-point shapes are available to create wayfinding lighting paths or large pattern arrays that take advantage of both negative and positive space.

Boom is a new series of LED chandeliers with explosive forms made from and inspired by destroyed buildings. Designed by RUX, a multidisciplinary design firm based in New York City, Boom features cast-brass joints and linear wooden bulbs to create forms of exploding light, and is available in two configurations - Single Boom (which comes in three sizes: Little, Middle & Big) and Double Boom - in polished brass and custom finishes.

The expressive form of Boom is achieved with minimal elements. At the center of the fixture is a singularity of cast-brass joints, elegantly curved to dramatically reflect the geometry of the fixture. Linear wooden bulbs – the essence of all Stickbulb designs – in varying lengths cantilever from the brass core, each one emitting a line of even light in a different direction. The result is an explosion of richly textured wood that casts dynamic patterns of light and shadow.

Boom is presented in a new wood type, Water Tower Redwood, which is sourced from dismantled water towers in New York City. The reclaimed wood is rich and red in color and threaded with occasional black veins. Years of exposure to sun, wind, rain, and snow on one side and contact with water on the other have resulted in a material with unique color banding that is full of character and strikingly beautiful.

A suspension lamp offering multiple lighting scenarios for personalized aesthetic and functional performance. Based on experimentation with the potential of LEDs, a technology that permits separation into very small units, Mesh is a dramatic and highly innovative project.

A lamp of great theatrical impact whose almost transparent structure, composed of a network of flexible cables with LED sources positioned at their intersections, conceals the complexity of the design, dematerializing it to make room for only the light, the true protagonist. The particular structure permits exceptional freedom in the control of luminance: it is possible to govern the intensity of the light and to choose which portions of the lamp to turn on. Mesh is available in two sizes.

“I set out to create a lamp by starting with this capacity for spatial separation of LEDs, scattering them to optimize the read of light, but above all with the aim of giving each of these points of light its own independence. I wanted to make a lamp that lets you control the position and the quantity of light, a flexible object to adapt to space and the needs of the user. To organize the breakdown of the luminous points I used parameters similar to those identified by Fibonacci in nature, like the arrangement of the seeds in a sunflower, the eye-shaped features of a male peacock's plumage, or the complex forms of a head of cabbage. A precise sequence that inspired me for the distribution of the lights in space.”

Material: Structure in steel, lenses in polycarbonate

How it Work: Mesh is controlled by a dedicated ele ronic board which is located in the canopy.
In order to control Mesh you need 4 wires: two to operate the standard ON/OFF switch and two to operate a “normally open switch” (push switch). The Push Switch will control the dimming and the different light scenes.

Light dances through a dazzling array of tiny bubbles within the solid mass of each glass crystal ball. A single source of LED illumination becomes refracted and diffused from within its effervescent volume. Champagne Bubbles can be hung singly or in multiple arrangements from a range of canopy sizes. Champagne Bubbles can be hung as a sole glass ball or in configurations of 3, 6, 9, 12, or 24.

The Mara Grande chandelier by Tech Lighting has a rare cohesion of warm, sophisticated styling and dramatic flair. Thoughtfully arranged clusters composed of 45 frosted glass globes softly diffuse the LED light for an unmistakably high-end modern chandelier. Available in an Aged Brass or a Satin Nickel finish, Mara Grande comes with 60” of variable rigid stems to accommodate high ceilings. With 45 LED modules, Mara Grande uses 117 watts and delivers a bright 3015 lumens at 2700K, 90 CRI. Its dimensions are 51” high and 32.6” in diameter.

From LBL Lighting, this quintessential Photon 48 starburst silhouette is fun and playful while still being tailored and elegant. This modern interpretation of a chandelier has solid acrylic arms which are squarely facetted to ensure an even glow from its integrated LED light source shining from the core. Available in a Satin Nickel or Aged Brass (shown) finish, its dimensions are 31.8” high and 48” in diameter. The integrated LED uses 35.1 watts while delivering 2709 lumens at 3000K, 90 CRI, and is dimmable down to five percent with a compatible ELV dimmer. Photon can also be ordered in the 227-volt version for commercial use. There’s also a smaller Photon 34.

Vinea – which is Latin for vine- was designed by Pedro Bodegas Jr. of Grupo Eco, manufactured by Littman Brands Contract Lighting and developed in collaboration with Troy Custom Design Studio for the new Sofitel México Reforma hotel in Mexico City. Inspired by the geometric patterns and contemporary architecture of the hotel, Vinea is built around a linear LED featuring four downlights. Around this luminous center, 720 aluminum links hang from each other, creating flexible strands that drape down and curve slightly inwards. These rippling metal “vines” sparkle with movement, reflecting Vinea’s inner glow. Its tiny pieces require extremely precise parametric design and CAM manufacturing, yet Vinea has an unmistakable organic quality to it.

The motorcycle is a potent symbol of American mythology, signaling strength and freedom of expression. It’s possible, in Desmond’s angle-cut arms and knurled bulb base, to see a homage to this iconic vehicle. Even in the straight, single pendant, Desmond shows its strength. Fitted with spiral carbon-filament bulbs, no detail is too small to be designed. Desmond is available in a variety of sizes which makes it suitable for any room in the home. The perfectly detailed yet quintessentially minimalist Desmond seeks to reinterpret an iconic American symbol of freedom through industrial features and it simultaneously focuses on minute details while having an overall streamlined design with its knurled cut base.

The Carousel Pendant [RC 42] from CL Sterling is composed of nuggets of recycled lead crystal that have been tumbled to remove sharp edges and then individually hand tied to a nickel plated brass frame using jeweler’s wire. 47.6” OAH x 23.6” Dia. A variety of glass diffuser options are offered. The fixture is suspended by silk rope covered stems. Accepts (3) 60W incandescent bulbs or equivalent. Approximately 65 lbs.

Vancouver has a number of features that define its physical beauty, including its parks, the surrounding local mountains and bodies of water, as well as the stars that light up the sky during the night. In order to reproduce this stunning view of stars, a radiant light fixture was created to leave an impression on visitors of the presentation centre. This seven-chandelier showpiece design is based on the seven Asteres Planetai of ancient Greek myth, referring to the planets that are visible to the naked eye. To illustrate this, each four-pointed star chandelier is surrounded by a circular inlay of metal trims. Suspended from polished black metal, the seven chandeliers allude to our neighbouring planets shining brilliantly in the night sky.

The seven repeating chandeliers convey a seamless motion across the ceiling, prompting viewers to follow along with the design. The black mirror plate provides a distinct contrasting backdrop --adding emphasis to the lights. The light design spreads further into the physical space by manifesting downwards through illuminated columns, culminating into its own reflection in a polished marble floor. The fluid light movements across the room help achieve a sense of unity and balance.

As the primary space in the presentation centre, the sales area plays a multifaceted role. It provides an excellent first impression while simultaneously serving as a business space. This feature scales perfectly with the grand room. With the extensive use of naturally appealing, luxurious finishes in the open sales area, it was only appropriate to complement this with the right quality and energy of lighting; working to embrace the centre's visitors with open arms.

A chandelier of this magnitude had two primary issues: time and cost. Our extensive experience has taught us that good planning and preparation is always key. The design and installation of the chandeliers needed to be realistically achievable within a relatively short time frame. To ensure a timely completion, we maintained a constant line of communication with project consultants to coordinate key items as quickly as possible while providing an efficient, sensible construction schedule to prevent delays. In using a tried and true design feature repeatedly, it ensured that production and installation costs were curtailed. Practical elements such as the mechanical air supply and return grills were designed to be almost invisible. They were structured to flow seamlessly with the light fixture, while the inlay of metal trims was designed simultaneously as a core visual element and essential structural support.

McGuire Furniture's Fall 2016 collection featured the brand’s first lighting collection in more than a decade: 22 pieces by design master Jonathan Browning. Aptly inspired by the design traditions of Northern California in the 1970s, the light fixtures are timeless and subtly elegant. This dramatic Muir Chandelier, exclusively designed by Jonathan Browning for McGuire, combines Jonathan's decades of design with the shadows and shapes created on the valley floor of Muir Woods. Crafted from solid brass and distinct in form, a graphic cage - in a lite antique finish - becomes a study in repetition with ten layers at varying heights. Crystal diffusers in each of the cages mimic the sunlight that falls between the branches of the Northern California redwoods. Each solid brass cage is carefully crafted to achieve the angle, proportion and scale; the result in the chandelier is a work of art. The oil rubbed bronze sockets and 21.875" diameter ceiling plate complete this piece.

A UNIQUE PENDANT LAMP MADE OF FINELY CRAFTED BRASS, RODS OF GLASS AND LEATHER. THE LIGHT FEELS LIKE IT HAS BEEN DE-COUPLED FROM A LARGER PIECE OF MACHINERY, YET IT IS SMOOTH AND POLISHED, PERFECTLY PROPORTIONED AND INTRIGUING. THE GLASS RODS ARE HELD BY STEPPED METAL SHAPED, WHERE A LEATHER HARNESS BISECTS TO METAL SUSPENSION POINTS, WHICH IN TURN RELATE TO A METAL CUFF THAT GRIPS THE GLASS RODS.

This September, Alison Berger, the renowned glass artist, will introduce a new body of work, called the Lyra series. This new series expands Alison’s existing body of work – drawing on historic forms to create a contemporary expression -- but continues Berger’s career-long exploration of the qualities of light.

The Lyra constellation of stars, which is said to look like Orpheus’ lyre, inspired the name of this series. Berger has long been inspired by the cosmos, as well as by the instruments that man has devised to see the unseen, such as microscopes and telescopes. As always, she marries her interest in scientific esoterica with her profound talent as a designer to create new forms and finishes that create an interplay with light.

The entire Lyra Series is based on a delicate bronze armature, from which hang circular lenses and reflectors. The series is scalable – from a one “star” sconce to a 7’4” structure with 13 “optical comets” (called Lyra No. 13) – with two sizes in between, Lyra No.3 and Lyra No. 5. Hand-carved optical crystal lenses surround the filament bulb, to capture and magnify the kinetic energy of illumination, and mirror reflectors punctuate the illumination.

For the first time in her career, Berger is experimenting with colored metal finishes for this line. In addition to her standard medium amber bronze patina, this series includes lacquered bronze in oxblood, white, and green with golden bronze highlights. These finishes lend the pieces an additional sense of luminescence; they all seem to glow from within. In this use of color, Berger was inspired by tones of the velvet boxes that were used to transport these devices of measurement.

The Corona Ceiling Mount fixture [RC 59] from CL Sterling is composed of nuggets of recycled lead crystal that have been tumbled to remove sharp edges and then individually handtied to a nickel plated brass frame using jeweler’s wire. 5.9”H x 13.8” Dia. A variety of glass diffuser options are offered. Accepts (2) 60W incandescent bulbs or equivalent. Approximately 20 lbs.

The chain lamp opens the Pylons collection, inspired by architecture, created in jewelry technique. Just as jewelry is a complement to the elegant outfit, so this lamp is a complement to the elegant interior.
Stainless steel, dimensions 35 x 35 x 110 cm.

Adopting Artemide’s guiding philosophy of “The Human Light,” where lighting is a means of improving quality of life, Neri&Hu’s design is a poetic interpretation of the concept. The charming image of birds resting on scaffolding or chirping within a woven bamboo cage—these are the delightful scenes of street life that one encounters daily in Shanghai. The collection, including pendant lamp, floor lamp, and table lamp, consists of black structures with brushed brass “yanzi,” or swallows, perched atop. Featuring two types of birds, an adjustable track system, as well as various extensions, there are endless possibilities to configure the light. With elegant lines and minimal shapes, Yanzi pays homage to both the urban and the natural, the rigid and the organic, while injecting a sense of playfulness into the design.

Linear lighting fixture, handcrafted in various combinations of polished stainless steel, wood and silicon bronze, two bulbs provide both up and down light. Highly- efficient LED technology. Available in custom sizes and finishes.

Capris, designed by Charles Loomis, is a fresh new contemporary pendant with a world of possibilities. Its glass diffusers may be configured to your specifications, its design is unique. Handmade to order exclusively in the USA, Capris is available in a range of sizes, metal finishes, and diffuser materials with incandescent or LED lamps.

Multiple clear crystal accents hang among the eight lights of this glamorous brushed steel foyer pendant. Large concentric oval rings make up the metal frame. In the center are eight candelabra style lights. The clear crystal accents dangle over the bulb light from arc arms, creating a sophisticated sparkle.

• 31 1/2" wide x 23" high.
• Canopy is 5" wide x 3/4" high.
• Weighs 8 lbs.
• Includes 6-feet of chain, 12-feet of wire.
• Sloped ceiling adaptable.
• Uses eight maximum 60 watt or equivalent type B bulbs (not included).
• Brushed steel finish frame.
• Clear crystal accents.
Product > lighting: chandelier (multiple.product_name: Tiller Brushed Steel Pendant Chandelier by Possini Euro Design

Product > lighting: chandelier (multiple.description_html:
Inspired by modern European chandeliers, this chandelier offers plenty of eye-catching appeal. The bold look of the minimalistic, multi-arm frame comes in a dark satin brass finish. Globe bulbs pointed up and down are arranged at the end of each arm.

• 37" wide x 23 1/2" deep x 19" high.
• Canopy is 5" wide x 2 1/2" high.
• Weighs 11 lbs.
• Includes one 6" and three 12" downrods, and 12-feet of clear wire.
• Sloped ceiling adaptable.
• Includes sixteen 40 watt type B bulbs.
• Dark satin brass finish.
Product > lighting: chandelier (multiple.product_name: Clark Satin Brass 16-Light Chandelier by Possini Euro Design

Product > lighting: chandelier (multiple.description_html: A shop sketch, a meditation on electricity, tension, and the connecting of poles. Steel, brass, ceramic, layered mulberry paper, and core sample.
Thin metal tubes bent into an unearthly form then grounded by silver rods piercing its heart. A little like first contact.

The linear T-Light Pendant features parallel pieces of extruded aluminum that hang from two stems. These two horizontal beams sandwich a ¾” thick piece of etched, water white glass which, together, form an upside down “T”. Two strips of 3000˚K LEDs provide warm up and down-light and are wired as dual circuits, which allows each light source to be dimmed separately. A diffuser on the top of the fixture diffuses glowing up-lighting, while light radiating from the bottom of the glass is soft yet strong. Once hung, each of the two stems can be adjusted independently to level the pendant. The T-Light comes in a myriad of standard powder coat finish options: Cinnamon Bronze; Rubbed Bronze; Silver Fog; Black Granite; Gossamer Aluminum; Gloss White; Golden Gate Orange; and Coffee Bean. The fixture can also be powder coated to compliment any interior scheme. The fixture is available in 5’, 6’ and 7’ lengths.

The idea of the T-light, according to Joshua Aidlin, “… was to create an extremely quiet linear pendant that honestly and elegantly expresses its structure while providing directional light above and below.”

The T-Light was co-designed by Aidlin Darling Design’s Peter Larsen, principal, and Adrienne Swiatocha, designer. While Aidlin Darling has been awarded regional, national and international design awards, Boyd Lighting is also the recipient of numerous awards for lighting design. The relationship between the firms goes back decades to when Dave Darling (then with Brayton and Hughes) helped design the landmark Boyd building at 944 Folsom Street in San Francisco.

Inspired by lily ponds, the Floating Lotus uses hand thrown porcelain discs to create beautiful indirect light and mimic the reflections of the water's surface. This piece is available as a single disc pendant, a trio, or as a custom installation. Each piece is hand crafted and can be customized and made to order.

Barn-Barn design is excited to announce the launch of the Orbital series: a modular kinetic lighting
system. These dynamic lamps distribute light with functionality and grace while conjuring the movements of
celestial bodies.
The Orbital series is an evolution of the mobile. At its heart is the proprietary rotatable connector. Minimal,
sturdy and unhindered by wires it allows the wood members to rotate around each other smoothly and
steadily. The interplay of the arms is captivating and welcomes interaction. Virtually frictionless, you can give
them a nudge to spin around effortlessly or set them in a desired configuration.

There are two variations in the series and gravitationally speaking they are opposites. The suspended
model is Orbit. Remarkably, when inverted it maintains its balance to become Floorbit, the floor standing
version. They are each made up of one to five arms, of solid glue laminated wood, in either straight or
curved options. New for the fall is the Strata: the CNC cut version made from maple plywood. The quality of the LED light is bright, warm and dimmable. Components are made from machined brushed aluminium. Beyond the models available for retail sale, a multitude of custom creations are possible, including a motorized option.

The lamps’ unique effects recall dewdrops on blades of grass, the motion of clock gears and the playfulness
of spirograph. The Orbital series embodies the spirit of its origins through craftsmanship and choice of
local birch, Douglas fir, western red cedar or Sitka spruce. Custom creations are now easy to make thanks to several years of experience and development.

Barn-Barn design is lead by Mich DuVernet who embraces a hands-on approach to his work that merges
old-school techniques with new technologies. Nestled in the mountains of Canada near Nelson BC, his
converted barn now design studio and workshop has evolved into a space for exploration, fabrication and
play.

The Orbital series will have a sculptural and ever changing presence in any space. Barn-Barn design
invites inquiry about how the Orbital series can compliment or inform your vision.

Engineered to the finest detail for unsurpassed performance and design sophistication, Modern Forms was established as a future forward manufacturer and innovative brand of unique upscale all-LED luminaires. Modern Forms took North America by storm in the last five years with avant-garde designs that leverage LED technology developed exclusively by WAC engineering.
Modern Forms is designed to complement a diverse array of architectural interiors and exteriors while delivering high quality, functional illumination for luxury homes, hotels and commercial spaces. Each design is lovingly developed by our in-house designers to showcase innovative applications of upscale materials and painstakingly engineered for the tangible details that convey quality and years of robust performance.
Modern Forms offers a vast presentation that achieves superior illumination from clean upscale forms only made possible with proprietary LED technology. Premium powder coat and plated finishes, marine grade stainless steel constructed designs, gold and silver leafing, and exclusively developed glass and crystal techniques are just a few of the features that speak to discriminating specifiers.
Modern Forms can be reached at 1.800.526.2588 or by visiting www.modernforms.com.

Product > lighting: floor.description_html:
From the designers at Possini Euro Design®, this lamp offers an interesting silhouette with an angular arc arm extending over seating areas or a favorite arm chair. The clear glass cylindrical bowl shade is decorated with a frosted band. A powder-coated black frame provides a wonderfully contemporary finish. Polished brass finish accents and hardware creates additional visual interest, while an on-off foot switch ensures easy operation.

• 66" high.
• Shade is 4 1/4" high x 10" wide.
• Base is 1 1/4" high x 10" wide x 14" deep.
• Takes one 100 watt medium base bulb (not included).
• Matte antique brass and black powder-coated finish; metal construction.
• Clear glass with frosted band cylindrical bowl shade.
• 16-inch clear-silver cord.
Product > lighting: floor.product_name: Marah Chairside Arc Floor Lamp by Possini Euro Design

Product > lighting: floor.description_html:
Through the language of textiles, Joan Gaspar has designed a fixture of flexible, ductile materials that sifts the light as readily as it moves with the wind. In the Jaima collection, the light is the shade and weaver of emotions.

This new collection takes its name from the Bedouin tents of North Africa, and is inspired by their varied fabrics and forms. The textilene shade is available in three sizes and four different colors, with an off-white interior to optimize the quality of the downward light.

The shades can be combined with two versatile stands to make various sizes of adjustable, rotating floor lamps; the fixture can also be a affixed directly to the floor or wall, and the shades can be hung independently as pendants.

Cornet has a personality strongly rooted in nature. A lamp that puts smiles in the faces of those who enjoy it. Its lines are harmonious and organic; it brightens the space it is in and it blends in with nature where there are no straight lines.

It is a lamp made of very high-density polyurethane, which is a very hard and resistant material that is perfect for public spaces. But the Cornet's use is very versatile. It can provide direct lighting like a bollard or more extensive lighting for illuminating larger surfaces. The Cornet lamp family works in the connectivity of spaces; a value that Alex Fernández Camps always upholds. It is mainly used as a bollard lamp but can quickly connect with a wider reality: interior wall lamps, or the post version for intermediate spaces. In all of its designs, Cornet includes a dimmable LED source that distributes light through the lamp's undulating layers, creating an atmosphere that is natural, slightly broken, but never dominant.

Cornet is a highly technical project, yet full of life. One of the most interesting moments occurred during the working process when Alex was surprised to discover that the Cornet's lines breathed the organic functionality of Gaudí's buildings, which he had visited as a boy with his father. But the coincidences did not stop there; his full name was Antoni Gaudí i Cornet, and Alex's studio is on Calle Cornet i Más (the engineer who made the metal structures for some of the famous Barcelona markets). An entirely magical crossing of lines involved in the history of this unique Bover lamp made in Barcelona.

In the words of Alex Fernández Camps: “Cornet surprised me during the process, and still amazes me every time I see it. The projects are generous with those who are a part of them, always creating experiences to remember. Especially Cornet.”

NORTH, design by Arik Levy, is inspired by the balance of elegant, dynamic and adaptable. North allows the user to bring light to exactly where they want it. Two arms rise from the base to supply light where it is needed, with telescopic adjustable rods. The base is supplied with black stones as a weight. North has an LED light source and is available in four finishes: matte graphite lacquer, matte cream lacquer, matte blue lacquer and matte white lacquer.

Inspired by European lighting design, this floor lamp offers a bright accent for seating areas or hallways. Four clear glass cylinders are arranged on an x-shaped frame at the top. The ribbed glass along with the decorative linear metal accents creates a distinctive profile. The top frame and thin column are all in a warm antique brass finish.

• 66" high x 11" wide.
• Shades are 10 1/2" high x 3 1/2" wide.
• Takes four 25 watt E26 base bulbs (not included).
• Warm antique brass finish; metal construction.
• On-off foot switch.
• 8-foot clear and silver cord.
Product > lighting: floor.product_name: Blake Antique Brass Metal Floor Lamp by Possini Euro Design

Product > lighting: floor.description_html:
With no more than fingertips, one can achieve a feeling of weightlessness with the Copérnica lamp. As if levitating, it moves through space effortlessly, without friction or resistance.

Circles, semicircles, tubes, and bars of different diameters, materials, and weights...with the combination of these primary elements the Copérnica collection constructs geometric sculptures of light, establishing an intimate relationship with space and combining functionality with the beauty of pure lines.

The collection consists of desktop and standing versions that play with counterweights of mixed materials and density, such as steel and aluminum. This design allows one to move the lamp with great precision, providing a wide range of heights, distances, and adjustments to the beam of light to suite one’s taste.

The upright version, a true statement piece, stands almost six feet in height and directly or indirectly illuminates the environment with its tilting head system.

Copérnica draws minimalist sculptures in space, as if your room were a canvas, and the carefully selected colors add soft chromatic touches to the ensemble.

Northern Lights, an intriguing kinetic sculptural lamp, was designed by interior designer, architect and artist Sherry Williamson. As a floor or table lamp, the fixture transforms the mood and environment in the space it occupies.

Williamson has designed custom lighting for over 20 years, and was inspired to create Northern Lights as an off-shoot of her ongoing series of whimsical wood, wire and ceramic sculptures.

The design for Northern Lights balances a minimalist machined aesthetic with hand-crafted elegance.

Williamson chose a small team including Phoenix Day Lighting, the venerable family-owned San Francisco manufacturer, to fabricate the unusual fixture. Phoenix Day’s skilled team of artisans calibrated and machined the refined components of Northern Lights, bringing the design to life.

The poetic lamp features a hand-thrown and glazed ceramic cylinder base topped by a polished nickel disk with an array of 240 gently waving stainless steel rods. A powerful custom LED light source spills an ever-changing array of luminous hues up through the wires and onto the walls and ceiling above, reaching 15 feet or more.

The fixture measures 45” in height, is 10" in diameter and is compliant with UL 2108 Low Voltage and 8750 LED standards.

http://bit.ly/2fLxQY5

The Pivot Plug-In was designed with an articulating assembly of hexagonal bars (either brass rods; or distressed threaded steel rods), bearings and joints that carry current to seven LED lux capacitors. These articulations were originally developed for stop-motion animation. The design allows for a significant range of adjustability, articulation and movement, with an exceptional level of customization. Three brass shields are included and can be mounted with any of the glass capsules that contain the LEDs. The Brass version features Opal glass; the Steel version features Amber and Smoke glass capsules. The Pivot is a floor lamp that is ceiling mountable with its base that rests on two brass balls. The light is turned on/off with a foot switch connected to the 10’ power cord. The Pivot Plug-In is offered in two versions: Waxed Brass + Blackened Steel; or Mixed Steel + Brass (images of both versions shown). Dedicated LED, 2700K, Dimmable.

ART + ALCHEMY began as an opportunity to elevate lighting design using exquisite, artisan-made, hand-finished materials. The designers’ mission was simple—remove all restraints and create the most beautiful, one-of-a-kind pieces that they could envision. No longer bridled by a defined set of materials or finishes, our designers were free to explore their ideas. What resulted was an eclectic gathering of unique pieces for extraordinary spaces, and the launch of an entirely new lighting design atelier, called ART + ALCHEMY.

Designers: David Kitts + Andy Morter
An extroverted introvert, David Kitts strives to solve more problems than he creates. His education and experience in both design and engineering have taught him to never let your ego get in the way of a good, solid design. His passion for seeing an idea come to life is only surpassed by being able to do so successfully, here, in Vermont. A quiet collaborator, David pulls inspiration from the designers, engineers and the artisans he works with every day.

As the son of two entrepreneurs in the decorative lighting business, Art + Alchemy Design Developer Andy Morter learned the importance of craftsmanship early, balancing engineering with beauty. Andy’s passion for all things mechanical was derived from watching his father build and restore hot rods and motorcycles – his version of moving works of art. This informs his view on everything he builds today. Andy might envision an LED platform as the “chassis” where the beauty of the piece is defined by its purpose. Constantly pushing himself to explore both the oldest and newest materials available, Andy works to blend and push the limits of what’s possible.

Bring a touch of Mid-Century style to your home with the exceptional look of this two-light floor lamp from Possini Euro Design®. The thin profile base and column are crafted in walnut wood and antique brass finish metal. A Brussels linen drum shade sits on top. Two on-off pull chains control the twin bulbs.
• 63 1/4" high. Shade is 6" high x 18" wide. Base is 2" high x 14 1/4" wide.
• Takes two 75 watt E26 base bulbs (not included).
• Antique brass and walnut finish; metal and wood construction.
• Brussel linen fabric drum shade.
• On-off pull chains.
• 16' brown cord.
Product > lighting: floor.product_name: Glenna Antique Brass and Walnut Floor Lamp by Possini Euro Design

Product > lighting: floor.description_html:
Designed exclusively for AVENUE ROAD, The Mainkai Floor Lamp and Table Lamp by Sebastian Herkner draw on the curving Main river and the Quay or Kai that runs at its side through Frankfurt where he studied, and Offenbach, where he works today. Mouth-blown opaline shades sit atop a Spanish Marble base, mimicking the mooring buoys in constant motion with the ebbs of the changing tides. This same motion is simulated by a simple touch of the dimming switch on the stem of the fixture.
The design reflects Herkner’s mastery in combining new technologies with traditional craftsmanship in order to highlight the multifaceted beauty of the materials, and to draw renewed attention to every detail. The Mainkai Floor Lamp and Mainkai Table Lamp are part of the ongoing collaboration between AVENUE ROAD and Sebastian Herkner which began in 2013.

The past and future come together in the present to create new design advancements, with MAYFAIR. The original inspiration for these luminaries was derived from the French Bouillotte lamps of the 19th century, a sophisticated piece of design comprising one or more candlesticks with a flameproof adjustable metal shade painted reflective white on the inside. These traditional fixtures have been revamped with a highly contemporary style featuring innovative materials, an elegant silhouette and a refined LED light.

This elegant floor lamp is inspired by vintage movie studio lights. The light source is cased in a brass bronze cone whose inside finish is mirror. Light is projected onto the translucent 40cm diameter onyx circular plane in front of the cone to render it soft and sophisticated.
The slim brass bronze support stands on a base of two intersecting semi-circular pipes providing balance and of total height of 150cm.

Vico Magistretti designed a light in 1977 called Lyndon with the idea of a structure holding a simple ball of light. The minimal approach to its support is contrasted with the delicate glass bowl with the idea of it reading like a cloud. To commentate the tenth year of his death, we selected the Lyndon light to pay homage and created a light with the same spirit in mind.

In our everyday existence, light serves us by enhancing everything around it, while it itself is often neglected. Here, the inspiration comes from the quintessential source of light; like its ancient predecessor, the fiery torch, this design consists simply of an upright rod with an illuminated tip. Celebrating the glorious spectacle of light itself, the tinted glass shade is a modest attachment that branches off the main support to gently shield its centerpiece.

Hashi is a floor lamp conceived to provide direct light in a simple and flexible manner. Its principle component is the pivot point between two “chopsticks” (Hashi) that serve as light sources. The two sticks can be positioned in different ways, creating a strong, graphic effect in space. Particular care has been given to the proportions. The sticks always appear lightweight and balanced.

Product > lighting: pendant (single bulb.description_html:
This Mid-Century inspired design features a twin shade design, with an outer sheer shade around a clear inner glass form. The ceiling canopy and frame are in a warm antique brass finish.

• 22 1/2" high x 19" wide.
• Outer shade is 19" wide x 4 3/4" high.
• Includes 6-feet of chain. 12-feet of clear wire. One 8" downrod.
• Uses one maximum 60 watt or equivalent E26 base bulb (not included).
• Warm antique brass finish metal frame.
• Silver organza outer shade and clear inner glass.
Product > lighting: pendant (single bulb.product_name: Layne Warm Antique Brass Pendant Light by Possini Euro Design

Product > lighting: pendant (single bulb.description_html:
Austrian designer Rainer Mutsch designs Orchid for Axolight, a collection of lamps with two separate yet complementary souls: one outer – that of nature, exuded by its flower shaped diffuser and its rod; the other, more hidden, is high-tech with avant-garde LED technology.

Orchid is a mix of emotions and technology stripped to the essentials.

Rainer Mutsch explains how these souls have merged in Orchid: "As a designer, I feel that nature is a major source of inspiration. In Orchid’s case I was studying how buds are connected to stems: and that’s what sparked the idea to develop a multidirectional floor lamp that could include direct lighting and diffused lighting in a single item. For the shape of the diffuser I was inspired by the funnel shape of the flower; I’m fascinated by how the flower seems relatively fragile near the stem and how then it reveals all its beauty when it blooms. Experimenting with these shapes I began sketching out a new diffuser, which thanks to its shape is capable of visualising the spread of the light.”

The LED technology is the second key factor in the design. The shape of the diffuser, made out of aluminium, prevents overheating, thus ensuring maximum duration of the light source. The outcome is a compact and efficient diffuser that couldn’t be possible with an incandescent lamp.

Including two suspension lamps, a floor lamp, a wall lamp and a ceiling lamp, Orchid comes in white or sand finish. It is so sculpturesque that it takes centre stage in the space even when turned off and stands out the most especially when a number of lamps are used in combination. Precisely thanks to its versatility, it works both in residential settings and in contract projects of a larger scope.
Fine gold or silver aluminum leaves growing out of a 2mm thick aluminum shade. Very fresh.

Inspired by the spokes of a bicycle wheel, this pendant lamp has a light yet solid structure resembling that of a birdcage or a lantern. A LED light is delicately placed inside the base of the cage, enabling light to direct upwards, reflecting through the metal rods while simultaneously casting intriguing shadow shapes to surrounding surfaces.

The unique shade consists of a series of softly curved steel wires that are powder coated, forming an oversized round shape, making it a durable yet a lightweight lamp that delivers impeccable design details.

The cleverly concealed LED points both downward, to directly illuminate surfaces, and upward, casting a moody interplay of light and shadow onto the walls.

New for 2017, Graphite and Copper are added to the existing colorways, bringing a metallic flare to the lamp that accommodates an array of residential and contract projects.

The Lotus Pendant’s white, curved forms, arrayed in suspension, direct bright light up, down, and through the spaces between its lotus-like petals, producing soft luminous reflections and a radiant glow. “Driven to discover new insight and to test boundaries, our creative process achieved a new wave of sculptural expression. In our pursuit of technology-driven design, we took functional decorative to a fresh aesthetic with new forms and materials,” says designer Robert Sonneman.

Like the subatomic particle it was named for, Electron is an elegant and modern light fixture radiating attractive energy into its environment. Demonstrating resourceful engineering without compromising beauty or functionality, the double-sided lighting maximizes illumination while the LED technology maximizes energy efficiency. The single pendant has a pleasing colour temperature of 3000K and no electrical wires.

Part of a lighting series that has been in development since December 2015, the Electron pendant design is deceptively simple. On the front surface there are no visible fasteners, allowing for a clean and refined finish. Suspended from a co-axial cable, the Electron offers a clean suspended appearance.

This modern pendant is refined and futuristic. Each Electron was designed, developed, and manufactured by Karice Enterprises Ltd.

Project specs: Outside diameter 9 7/8”, inside diameter 6 1/8”, 1” thick, 856 lumens, 12 volt, dimmable LED.

Finishes available: Brasslike light gold, silver or black.

Light is ubiquitous. It affects us from the moment we wake up, to the moment we go to bed. It helps shape our everyday experiences. Yet, many people give light little thought beyond flipping their existing switch for basic on/off illumination.

With the Philips Hue connected lighting system, consumers can do so much more with light. They can personalize their lighting to match their mood, support their activity or create their desired ambiance – at any moment of the day.

Over the last five years, the Philips Hue family of products has rapidly expanded; it includes bulbs, strips, spots, fixtures, lamps and controls. And the latest addition – the Philips Hue White Ambiance Cher Suspension fixture – continues to deliver the smart lighting system’s unprecedented versatility and promises to make homes smarter and lives easier.

With powerful light output (3000 lumens), the Cher pendant gives the perfect functional and mood lighting from a single source. The single LED panel is integrated with the Philips Hue White Ambiance technology, allowing you to select from among 50,000 shades of white light – from warm (2200K) white to cool (6500K) daylight. Change the light to:
• Shape your space whatever your style
• Make rooms feel spacious and comfortable
• Set the mood and atmosphere for any occasion
• Support different activities throughout the day, helping you wake up and energize, concentrate, read, relax and go to sleep naturally

The Cher pendant was designed around the light source so the light fully caters to people’s needs and lifestyles. For example, with the Cher pendant above your kitchen island or over a dining table, you can select a cool daylight scene for your morning coffee to energize for the day ahead, help your child focus on their homework with a bright white light and create a cozy ambiance for dinner under a warm light.

What also sets the fixture apart:
• It can easily fit anywhere in the home and work with any interior style.
• The black color represents the presence/absence of light and shows off each of those 50,000 white tones beautifully.
• Consumers can control the light in a way that suits them best – via a smartphone or tablet app, a Hue wireless switch, a wearable device or hands-free with a voice platform (Amazon Alexa, Apple Siri or Google Home) or the Hue motion sensor.

Lighting is changing. Smart lighting that adapts to our every need is vital to pushing everyday interactions with and appreciation of light further. With the Philips Hue White Ambiance Cher pendant, consumers can enjoy the richest lighting experience and live their best lives at home.
Product > lighting: pendant (single bulb.product_name: Philips Hue White Ambiance Cher Suspension Light

Product > lighting: pendant (single bulb.description_html:
Taking inspiration from the water ripples, this lamp does not only capture the beauty and peacefulness of the natural phenomenon when a droplet is dropped into the water, but it is also shaped to bring out the spirit of the ripple effect, when one thing leads to another and a long term influence is created out of a very small event.
The idea is materialized when a person gives a helping hand to someone in need, the act will motivate the beneficiary to help others and create a ripple effect to spread the good deeds.
Through this lamp, designer want to encourage people to take the lead, be the first one to start the ripple effect and ultimately create a friendlier environment.
This lamp is collaborated with a leading Italian lighting manufacturer, Viabizzuno, which handcrafted by an experienced glass artisan from Venice.

The parasol light.

Designed by Yonoh, the Banga pendant exemplifies the Valencia-based creative design studio’s quest to bring an understandability and functionality, a freshness and uniqueness, to its creations. Available in two sizes, Banga is crafted using a series of individual sheets of veneer, each one connected via a lustrous metallic strip.

The Banga light’s combined veneer pieces and metal frame bear a resemblance to a plush brolly or indeed, to a well dressed parasol. Banga enjoys an expressive Eastern world-like quality, together with a nod to neoclassicism and its principles of simplicity and symmetry.

Inspired by mid-century modern design, BRIGGS is a stylish LED fixture that is both stunning and practical. Its geometric lines and angular design pays homage to the Cubist Brutalism movement, yet its soft bronze finish brings warmth and lightness to the space it occupies.
Geometric. Effortless. Stylish. 
Plated metal finish in champagne
Frosted white opal glass diffuser
Four unique geometric sizes available
Available in two standard clusters with four or seven pendants
Custom clusters available
Dimming options available
Custom finishes available
LED option available
Hairline Bronze finish available for custom orders only.

NORTH, design by Arik Levy, is inspired by the balance of elegant, dynamic and adaptable. Composed of traditional shades suspended from either one or two slim carbon fiber rods, the structures are arranged to precariously overlap. NORTH pendants use LED as a source of illumination, providing a uniform light that becomes concentrated with the smaller shade options for a more intense beam that can be moved to balance and focus where its needed most. North comes in four finishes: matte graphite lacquer, matte blue lacquer, matte cream lacquer and matte white lacquer.

In creating the Belmont pendant, designer Brad Ascalon re-envisions the traditional fabric shade lamp with the warmth and preciousness of hand crafted furniture. Belmont's striking, yet reductive form creates a natural canvas for displaying an array of textiles from premium wool to colourful woven fabrics that can be paired with a crafted solid wood armature in white ash, walnut or black-stained ash. Belmont can be hung individually or in clusters. Available in 22" and 26” models.

Two tiers of textured origami-like folds make up the Axel Chandelier. Inspired by Brutalist architecture, this imposing piece creates magical shadows. The rugged, white dimpled surface is paired with smooth matte brushed brass architecture, to create a complex fusion of textures.

JUNE, designed by Ana Mir + Emili Padros, draws inspiration from the crescent moon's soft reflection of indirect light. This hanging lamp provide a smooth and comfortable illumination through the latest generation of LED technology. They can be supported off walls, a tree or any other vertical surface, perfect for the outdoors. Four models are available, shaded or non, with either 3 or 5 light shapes.

Céline celebrates the pleasure of gesture and let herself be guided by her desires. Drawing her creative energy from the heart of the material, she takes her inspiration from nature and bases her approach on detailed observation.

For Grok, Céline has imagined a spectacular and aerial installation. “Voiles” (Sails) is an
invitation to travel. The movement of the sails in underlined by the layering of Washi paper,
which radiates out from the central axis. The collaboration with Grok perfectly combines
a first-class LED Technology with the lightness and poetry of paper.

In collaboration with Rich Brilliant Willing, Meyer Davis designed a new lighting collection including the two pieces: Hoist and Pilot, pendant and sconce collections that combine cutting-edge technology with casual sophistication. With a shared taste for simplicity and “intelligent subtraction,” the two studios developed timeless fixtures suited to a wide range of indoor and outdoor environments, uniquely solving common interior design problems.
The Hoist, a pendant, sconce, and flush mount, was designed as an elegant solution for a routine problem; hospitality renovations often lack electrical access to hang a pendant light where it is desired. The question became, how to make the electrical cord part of a larger gesture? Having identified the out-of-reach electrical outlet as a routine problem, the studios adapted the standard electrical cord as an integral, stylish component of Hoist’s overall design. Swagged and offered with generous cable length, the cord allows greater opportunities for where a pendant light can be installed. A knurled cord grip gives infinite freedom to locate a light source. The shade is available in a variety of colors and diameters, with a sconce version as well. Waterproof, the highly durable exterior is also suitable for outdoor installation, creating the possibility for a cohesive interior and exterior.
We developed tools for designers to create their own atmosphere. Thoughtfully considered and meticulously executed, the pieces elevate practical features like accent finishes and durable materials with a relaxed elegance, adding endless possibilities for installation.

Buoyant NYC is pleased to introduce the first of a series of cast glass fixtures that offer the signature sensibility already existing in our current collection. Inspired by our ancient history and objects often unearthed in the pursuit of understanding our past, this fixture collection aims to meld era's into a contemporary work.
The HEIRLOOM / SLING cast glass series has a 6"x6" glass “X” shape with a
hand-worked surface that hangs from leather slings. The casting process leaves natural inclusions within the glass giving these custom pieces a natural, found object quality. These pendants are illuminated by a 12v LED spot light available in different color temperatures.
The brass or aluminum stem comes any length up to 4 ft. and can be finished
in a clear satin, powder coat or Cerikote finish and is suspended from black power cord. The “belt weight” leather slings can be dyed and finished in any color suitable for your project.
July 13, 2017
Some more information:
- Cast glass can have either a sandblasted, kiln or polished finish. It's overall dimensions 6" x 6" wide and
5”-6” tall. Sizes vary slightly and can also be made to suit the projects needs.
- Leather slings can be dyed in any color available for leather. Leather is "belt" weight and thickness.
- Stem comes in Brass or Aluminum, with many finishing options.
- LED installed is 12V Low Voltage. Options include Cool white, 6000k or Warm white 2700K. Both deliver
50 lumens of light.

Award winning light designer Davide Groppi introduces a new kind of suspension lamp with a rechargeable battery.

The light source is applied magnetically to a metal dish that hangs for the ceiling using a very thin steel wire. The effect is delicately elegant.

QuiQuoQua allows light to be taken where it is needed, without the limitation of electric wires.

QuiQuoQua: the light where you want it.

RECHARGEABLE LITHIUM BATTERY – BATTERY LIFE 12 HOURS – MINI USB

LED 5 W – 640 lm

Simpilicity, weightlessness, emotion and creative invention are the fundamental components of each lamp or lighting project designed by Davide Groppi. A recipient of several prestigious awards, including two prizes at the 23rd edition of ADI Compasso d’oro, he started his company om a small laboratoru in the center of Italian town of Piacenza in the late 1980’s. Creative independence, passion and unconventional management have allowed him, over time, to learn and develop his own brand of original and unique products, sold worldwide.

Available in the US at Dom Interiors - dominteriors.com

FLIEGENBEIN PL PENDANT LAMP
Mirroring the silhouette of the Fliegenbein SL standing lamp, Fliegenbein PL produces overhead ambient light that filters through a pleated silken shade and a frosted glass diffuser. Its elongated shade injects modern personality into a space. Single and double tubes—in light grey, dark grey, or brown matte lacquers—harmonize with the Fliegenbein series’ signature splayed leg. A wheat-coloured electrical cord embraces the fixture’s braided-steel suspension wire.

Metal_Matt Lacquered Brown, Dark Grey, Light Grey

Shade_Silken Pleated, Satinated Glass Diffuser

Cable_Wheat Color Textile

Electrical Specifications_4 x E14 40W / 4 x E12 40W

Weight_4.5 kg / 9 lb.

Bola is a uniquely expressive LED Pendant. Its elegant globe diffusor is made of blown opal glass and is available in 4 sizes of Bola Disc: 12” (30cm); 18” (46cm); 22”(56cm); 32”(81cm). The Bola Felt is available in 24”(61cm) and 32”(81cm). Bola can be paired with a variety of polished chrome finial stems and reflector options from exquisite pol- ished chrome discs to rich undulating wool felt hats to provide unparalleled illumination with multiple personalities. Bola casts between 1200-1800 lumens of warm ambient light depending on size, is fully dimmable, and offers limitless configurations to choose from. Bola can be suspended individually, in series, or as stunning groupings for both residen- tial and hospitality settings alike.
Designers: Pablo Pardo + Pablo Studio 2017.

When a guest walks through the doors of Ion City, a boutique Icelandic hotel, the Nest fixture is the first thing there to greet them. The interwoven fixture, perched above the reception desk, welcomes guests with the universal symbol of home. Diffused light radiates through the freely intertwined reeds made of steel. The delicate weaving motion juxtaposes the rock solid material, steel – there to protects all who dwells within. Like the migrating bird, the Nest makes Ion City every traveler’s home-away-from home.

The Waveforms Bell LED Pendant features a luminous interior surface, peeking through a rhythm of undulations, revealing the light from within these dramatic LED pendants. Shaped in a deep bell, this sculptural form is available in Satin White with an Apricot Interior, Satin White with a Satin White Interior, Dove Gray with a Satin White Interior, Satin Black with an Apricot Interior, and Satin Black with a Satin White Interior. Dimensions: 25”H X 23 ¼”DIA; Shade: Aluminum; LED: 21w, 1900 Lumens, Warm White (3000k), 90 CRI.

“Driven to discover new insight and to test boundaries, our creative process achieved a new wave of sculptural expression. In our pursuit of technology-driven design, we took functional decorative to a fresh aesthetic with new forms and materials,” says designer Robert Sonneman.

The Hoopla Pendant, built of a scant, 7/8” powder coated aluminum channel, comes in two sizes – 16” and 24” diameters – and is lit by dimmable LEDs. The performance of the Hoopla, which emits up to 36 watts of power at 2700 K and 90 CRI, makes it perfect for any office environment. One sinuous stem that starts at the canopy and drops to form a lit “hoop” can be customized up to a 54” HOA. It is available in two power coat finishes that have been selected to compliment any interior – a warm black called “Coffee Bean” and a soft white called “Milk.” Light weight and stunning in its simplicity the Hoopla is the perfect “un-statement statement” in a room.

CURTAIN, designed by Arik Levy, consists of suspended lamps that combine direct and diffused vertical light within one fixture. The LED light emitted combines with the reflective elements of the fabric materials, creating a cascading waterfall effect of light. This collection comes in a myriad of cluster or single versions with two finish options of a white or mink screen.

Ringz is a lighting fixture which fuses simplicity with versatility. The simple geometry of the metal structure is embellished with hand applied faceting and tinted by a technique specially developed by Fire Farm’s in-house inventors. The result is a dazzling glittery effect which shimmers as you move around the fixture. Ringz is available in 6 sparkling rainbow colors.

The LED-powered Ringz are available in five different individual diameters from 36 inches to 84 inches, with custom diameters available by request. Grouping different diameters of Ringz together offers scalability to any environment, large or small. Ringz can be suspended in a variety of configurations to create your own distinctive chandelier, the only limits are your imagination!

Designed by Sas Adriaenssens for BuzziSpace, BuzziChandelier fuses stunning visuals with sound-absorptive materials.

It is a reimagined take on the classic Moorish lantern creates a bold focal point while adding acoustic softness to any space. The fixture’s shade, constructed out of two layers of BuzziFelt -- the brand’s signature acoustic felt, made of 100% upcycled plastic bottle waste -- dampens noise, making BuzziChandelier an ideal acoustic solution for large, open plan environments.

This is not limited to just contract settings, but extends to restaurant and hospitality spaces as well – with its shade’s arabesque design, inspired by Adriaenssen’s travels in Granada, Spain, and new marble-like finishes, BuzziChandelier also provides ambiance and sophistication by casting artful light and shadows. Hang just one pendant for a singular design statement, or group them in multiples for added romance.

BuzziChandelier is available with a plain or perforated shade, and comes in a variety of colors, including two new marble-inspired printed finishes, Emperador and Carrara.

Since their introduction of the original BuzziLight in 2008, BuzziSpace has been a pioneer in the acoustic lighting field – central to the brand’s core mission, acoustics and lighting have been found to greatly influence well-being and productivity in the workplace. The re-launch of BuzziChandelier not only represents BuzziSpace’s commitment to reimagining and refining their designs so as to provide the best acoustic lighting products on the market, but also represents the company’s evolution beyond the modern office. By fusing exceptional acoustic performance – a hallmark of the brand– with a dual-function form that serves both as a lighting fixture and provider of ambiance, BuzziChandelier addresses today’s growing demand for versatile, dynamic, multi-functional designs that can fit into a wide range of environments – commercial, contract, or residential.

And with its sustainable, eco-felt shade, BuzziChandelier also represents BuzziSpace’s continued commitment to sustainable design. From the company’s beginnings in 2007 to today, their team follows the philosophy of “cradle to cradle,” which stands for recycling and environmentally friendly processing of materials and the conscious use of raw materials and energy. Ecology, acoustics, and flexibility – these are three principles that guide BuzziSpace’s approach to every product they produce, as illustrated by BuzziChandelier’s multi-faceted design.

Dead City Pendant

“Dead City” refers to the ruins of antiquity that we are sublimely fascinated with as a culture. Inspired by the patina of the effects that time has on a material, we sought to create a light fixture that expresses simplicity, patina, and the passage of time by taking a slow, hand-made, artisanal approach.

The Dead City Pendant is made of micarta (a material traditionally used for hunting knife handles) in an innovative way.
Linen, the classic beginning of a painting, and epoxy resin is used to form a composite. The cylindrical shape is crafted from multiple layers of fabric hand-rolled onto an aluminum formwork. Once hardened and removed from its mold, the rough piece is then spun on a lathe and machined to its final shape revealing its layered construction. The shade armature is milled from solid brass hex rod and then assembled.

The Dead City Pendant is beguiling in the way light interacts with its materiality. The magical translucency of the revealed layers of lathed linen offers an ethereal, timeless glow once illuminated. Whether turned on or off, the surfaces multifaceted strata conjure a landscape or ruin. Each hand-made piece is unique and we relish in the nuances of the way light permeates the shade. When illuminated from within, the darkest parts of the fixture transform into a warm amber glow and reveal the subtle patterns of the fabric and its layered construction.

We seek to create complex connections through our design work, weaving history, process, and aesthetics to achieve subtle and nuanced results.

Product > lighting: sconce.description_html:
The SkLO Hold Sconce is a beautiful expression of hand blown glass. A wall-mounted armature of solid brass construction, a simple arm projects from the wall, ending in a circular hook. From this hook hangs the diffuser, an oblong hand blown glass vessel with an integral handle at the top, appearing to drip from the hook, evoking its molten origins as a work of hand blown glass. The arm and hook conceal the electrical wiring - a length of fabric-wrapped electrical cord exits the end of the brass arm, just above the hook. The cord ends in a brass socket, which hangs freely within the glass "Hold" diffuser. Each piece of "Hold" glass is hand blown in the Czech Republic, without the use of moulds, in the true European artisan glassblowing tradition. No two are exactly alike.

Available in 8 different opaque and transparent glass colors (including clear), and in 2 different metal finishes (brushed brass and dark oxidized brass).

The product submitted is the hard-wired version of the SkLO "Hold" Sconce. A plug-in version is also available.

Specs:
120V E26 socket
Dimensions 23"Hx8"Wx5"D

The SkLO Hold Sconce is also available in a UL listed version sized to comply with ADA Accessibility Guidelines and Code Requirements, ready for commercial use in public spaces.

ONE ILLUMINATES™ART: Our picture lights marry elegant design with flawless functionality and ease of installation.

“The inspiration for designing this collection came after years of struggling to find quality lighting fixtures that met my clients’ needs. I constantly searched for options that offered seamless light quality, beam control and perfect color temperature, as well as the level of aesthetic and craft my clients and I expect.” Nathan Orsman, founder One Illuminates.

Fixtures are offered in three series: HELD, CHAMFER and GRASP. Features include 110-volt driverless operation, 0 to 100% dimming, consistent color temperature and a unique 40° beam angle. Further control of the light coverage comes via our proprietary internally articulating LED unit. Our products are fully UL and CE compliant.

Fixtures are offered in three standard sizes and a variety of finishes on a 4 - 6 week lead time, as well as made-to-order with custom sizes and finishes.

These versatile fixtures can be seamlessly incorporated into new construction and existing spaces.
Named after its designer, our Bao Sconce’s vertical bronze frame captures its onyx stone block, which is internally lit by an LED bulb.

Kaneka OLED, a division of the Japanese chemical manufacturer Kaneka, launches their newest OLED lighting fixture, KUMIKO, designed by lighting designer MICHIRU TANAKA.
KUMIKO, named in reference to the traditional patterned woodwork found in Japanese screens, is a hightech
decorative update utilizing Kaneka OLED’s revolutionary lighting technology, enabling TANAKA to create a fully-customizable modular tile system that can be vertically-mounted on a surface or built into complex architectural designs in infinite mix-and-match combinations. KUMIKO produces a brilliant diffused light that recalls stained-glass windows when illuminated and transforms into a reflective mirror surface when powered down; a first for the design industry, the line of decorative OLEDs has applications across interiors, retail, hospitality, residential and commercial spaces. As part of the domestic launch of KUMIKO.

TANAKA, known for her work at the Freer and Sackler galleries at The Smithsonian Institute, as well as Grand Central Terminal Centennial Holiday Light Show in New York and Disney World’s Epcot Japan Pavilion Renovation, is committed to using sustainable energy-efficient lighting solutions in all her projects.
Her work exemplifies her goal of creating a unique symbiotic relationship between architecture and lighting
experience. As a native Japanese designer living and practicing in New York, Tanaka wanted to channel both cultural identities into this product.

“Kumiko” is a Japanese term for a traditional, highly crafted piece of functional art made from wood. “I
wanted to bring the spirit of this tradition into contemporary products and technology such as OLED light.”
TANAKA states. “I was able to use the thinness of Kaneka's OLED magnetic module (0.33”) to achieve a
product that can be hung like artwork on a wall. I also imagined my product as a solution for areas where
there is limited access for natural light. I wanted to be able to add KUMIKO like adding back-lit shoji
screens into any space. I carried the KUMIKO pattern through to texture the mirror when the light is off, so
it’s a beautiful design element on or off.”

Dark Moon is a wall-mounted metal and stone light fixture that mimics a form popular in Arts & Crafts jewelry. The sconce’s half-moon is crafted from solid brass that has undergone an aging process of hand-applied jade patina, creating subtle coloration ranging from deep blue-green to carbon black. Below, twelve stone segments dangle from cast brass hardware, forming a freely moving fringe. Each segment is cut from Serpentine marble, whose hues echo the patina of the jade finish above. Light emits from the silhouette of the half moon, diffusing through the stone fringe and highlighting the resonant textures of this illuminated sculpture.

NORTH design by Arik Levy, is the evolution of solution based lighting design. Inspired by the balance of a trapeze artists, it is elegant, dynamic and adaptable. Composed of traditional shades suspended from a slim carbon fiber rod structure which attaches to the wall, NORTH extends outward from the wall at various heights and angles to take the place of a traditional floor lamp or pendant application. The sconce uses LED as a source of illumination, providing a uniform light that becomes concentrated with the smaller shade options for a more intense beam. North comes in four finishes: matte graphite lacquer, matte blue lacquer, matte cream lacquer and matte white lacquer.

Three partners have come together to develop a series of lights that offer intelligence and simplicity—Richard Meier, the Pritzker-Prize winning architect, Ana Meier, a product designer with a strong modernist voice, and Hervé Descottes, a lighting master. The timeless yet forward thinking collection represents a shared ideology from all three designers.

Developed using primarily Corian and a range of materials including aluminum, steel, and hand blown Venetian glass, the collection consists of sculptural sconces as well a variety of product types including globe pendants, floor lamps, and table lamps.

“With this collection, we aim to bring the power of architecture to a smaller-scale. I was moved to take recurring themes and forms in Richard’s work, and translate them into sculptural objects that are interacted with everyday.” -Ana Meier

“These pieces provide a new experience of space, where the user carefully controls the interplay of form and shadow. The designs reveal a dialogue between geometries at different scales, while retaining the precision so distinctive of Richard’s cannon of work.“ -Hervé Descottes

“Architecture has the power to inspire, to elevate the spirit, to feed both the mind and the body. With this collection, we have distilled this feeling into objects...” –Richard Meier

Presenting a fresh alternative for biophilic design, Abstract Panels is a new collection of sculpturally artistic sconces that features LED illumination emitted through the layered voids of abstract-shaped panels. These river stone shapes infuse the surface mounted panels with a natural essence. Used individually or set in composition with others, Abstract Panels brings an intriguing tone of sculptured art to a surface, wall or ceiling. This collection of sconces comes in textured white, and is available in a Small 2-Plate LED Sconce, Large 2-Plate LED Sconce, or a 4-Plate LED Sconce.

“Driven to discover new insight and to test boundaries, our creative process achieved a new wave of sculptural expression. In our pursuit of technology-driven design, we took functional decorative to a fresh aesthetic with new forms and materials,” says designer Robert Sonneman.

The BG Sconce [RC 24] from CL Sterling is composed of nuggets of recycled lead crystal that have been tumbled to remove sharp edges and then individually hand tied to a nickel plated brass frame using jeweler’s wire. 15.7” H x 9.5” W x 5” Projection. Accepts (4) 40W incandescent bulbs or equivalent. Approximately 22 lbs.
