With all the same powerful qualities of its ceiling light counterparts, the Phoenix Wall Light resembles something almost prehistoric, like the spine of a Stegosaurus. This generous fitting will bring drama to any interior and emits a superb glow which enhances the tri-colour finish; rusted steel, polished steel and copper.

The Stacks Sconce’s beauty borne of simplicity and elegance. It features an LED light source encased in machined solid brass and layered with exquisite hand-poured clear glass blocks created by renowned glassmaker, Simon Pearce. A brass outcrop projects from the back plate. Two cables hang from the projection threading through the strata of brass and glass below. These low-voltage cables power the dimmable LED source housed within the center brass layer. Its up- and down-light, creates a soft glow that emerges from the center of the cast glass blocks. The Stacks Sconce is available in an exquisite hand-rubbed finish, in a choice of Waxed Brass or Blackened Brass. Adjustable hanging height from 10” to 60”. ADA Compliant.

Available exclusively to the trade, ART + ALCHEMY designs are both sculptural and distinctive. Our curation is an eclectic gathering of unique pieces, grounded in a reverence for the art of good design. In creating our lighting designs, ART + ALCHEMY draws from a rich palette of materials—brass, steel, stone, wood, cast metals, artisanal glass, and more. Alchemy is a tradition practiced throughout Europe, Egypt and Asia for centuries. It is aimed to purify and perfect; to transform something in a mysterious way. It is what our designers do each day in the Workroom.

Designers: David Kitts + Andy Morter
An extroverted introvert, David Kitts strives to solve more problems than he creates. His education and experience in both design and engineering have taught him to never let your ego get in the way of a good, solid design. His passion for seeing an idea come to life is only surpassed by being able to do so successfully, here, in Vermont. A quiet collaborator, David pulls inspiration from the designers, engineers and the artisans he works with every day.

As the son of two entrepreneurs in the decorative lighting business, Art + Alchemy Design Developer Andy Morter learned the importance of craftsmanship early, balancing engineering with beauty. Andy’s passion for all things mechanical was derived from watching his father build and restore hot rods and motorcycles – his version of moving works of art. This informs his view on everything he builds today. Andy might envision an LED platform as the “chassis” where the beauty of the piece is defined by its purpose. Constantly pushing himself to explore both the oldest and newest materials available, Andy works to blend and push the limits of what’s possible.

Engineered to the finest detail for unsurpassed performance and design sophistication, Modern Forms was established as a future forward manufacturer and innovative brand of unique upscale all-LED luminaires. Founded as an independent subsidiary of WAC Lighting, Modern Forms took North America by storm in the last five years with avant-garde designs that leverage LED technology developed exclusively by WAC engineering.
Modern Forms is designed to complement a diverse array of architectural interiors and exteriors while delivering high quality, functional illumination for luxury homes, hotels and commercial spaces. Each design is lovingly developed by our in-house designers to showcase innovative applications of upscale materials and painstakingly engineered for the tangible details that convey quality and years of robust performance.
Modern Forms offers a vast presentation that achieves superior illumination from clean upscale forms only made possible with proprietary LED technology. Premium powder coat and plated finishes, marine grade stainless steel constructed designs, gold and silver leafing, and exclusively developed glass and crystal techniques are just a few of the features that speak to discriminating specifiers.
Modern Forms can be reached at 1.800.526.2588 or by visiting www.modernforms.com.

Axo Light presents the new wall lamps collection Lik, designed by Serge and Robert Cornelissen.

The combination between the technical-functional aspects and esthetical ones is Lik’s main feature: the collection is an example of how the best design can be at the service of function. In fact the form, minimal and essential, makes it possible to install a small but intense lighting source that creates a light beam reflecting itself on the ceiling.

Lik is a small but powerful mark, capable to characterize every space, because it defines the place without changing it. The lamp can be used in an artistic and versatile way, installing single or multiple devices, in order to satifly the different lighting design needs.

Lik is available in white, bronze and matt nickel finishing and in the following sizes: L 3 7/8” - W 3 7/8” - H 7 1/4” cm.

The CHESTNUT is the perfect amalgamation of form and function. Inspired by mid-century modern design, the light’s sophistication and organic beauty make it the ideal installation for any interior space.

Organic. Transformative. Iconic.
Metal light fixture with champagne finish
Fixture can be installed on the ceiling, as a wall sconce or used as decorative art
Available in four standard clusters with four, six, nine or eleven metal plates attached to a singular j-box
The angle of each plate can be adjusted individually
Includes a white diffuser
Custom clusters available
Dimming options available
Custom finishes available
LED option available

Deeply rooted in the philosophy that argues for the inextricability of good design and extraordinary workmanship, Skram Furniture’s newest fixture, the Torpedo Sconce, is the latest of their products to earn recognition for its singular marriage of austerity, timelessness, and uncompromising technical mastery. The inspiration for the product came from antique levels that sit on the desk of Skram’s founder and lead product designer, Jacob Marks. One in particular, called a 'torpedo' level because of its shape, caught his eye and thus inspired the development of this wall sconce.

Torpedo is an LED driven wall-mounted fixture developed by Marks. The main body features a bronze composition while the end cap and hang bar–with joinery that references the traditional woodworking that defines Skram’s products–are gunmetal steel. Light emanates from slots on the front and sides, and the rear is fully machined-out and diffused, resulting in a soft illumination of the wall.

Float is a capsule collection of refined lighting informed by glamorous design cues of a bygone era and defined by its soaring cylindrical form. The collection continues Articolo’s exploration of the richly storied nature of artisanship.

As creative director Nicci Green observes, “Nothing compares to the spirited detail of handcrafted production. It’s this nuanced skill that ensures each piece is uniquely individual, and uniquely Articolo.”

Product > lighting: table.description_html:
Uninspired by some of the modern open plan workplaces where encouragement of spontaneous interaction often translates into lots of interruptions - hence the quip that 'headphones are the new wall'. - McCoy and Stathis set about designing a new system that brings privacy, and cleverly avoids the use of those high-sided cubicles. The result is Corner Office; a simple solution that helps define personal space and incorporates wellness and visual privacy.
Working closely with the designers, Pablo Pardo from Pablo Designs explains “ Corner Office is a result of a great collaboration between Peter, Michael and myself. Our challenge was to create a new breed of product to respond to the demands of today's new type of productivity, while offering surprise and delight.” The result is a dynamic and flexible system that combines the efficiencies of mass production, the flexibility of custom materials and configurations for expressing personal preferences, and the carbon-reducing sustainability of flat shipping and local assembly for international markets.
The system includes three elements: a glare-free, fully dimmable LED corner task light that incorporates three powerful USB ports featured in its armature (to charge phone and laptop devices); a set of optional acoustic deterrent fabric panels; and an optional pocket accessory that provides a place to rest a phone or tablet keeping the desk clutter-free. Elements are made up of aluminum and recycled fabric, that offer a familiar softness to the touch. The LED light is designed to provide up 50K hours of energy-efficient and maintenance-free illumination and is 97% recyclable.
Corner Office addresses multiple combinations and creative expressions in the office, home and hospitality environments. It is dynamic in visual expression, structural shape and detail and requires no tools to install it. While its overall aesthetic is simple, it reveals subtle intricacy in the places where elements come together. The sculptural origami-like shape of the panels outline a distinctive profile that is identifiable at a distance, while a refined magnetic connectors system provide highly flexible desktop planning for individuals, effortlessly and within minutes.
Lightweight but grounded, the system imparts a sense of personal space in a group environment. “Corner Office comes to life in open plan working spaces,” explains designer Peter Stathis. “The geometry is visually interesting but not overpowering and complements the landscape and surrounding interiors. It provides an ergonomic upgrade to existing tables and desks.” The fully dimmable LED task lamp provides focused and shaped lighting. Aluminum parts contain recycled content and are fully recyclable. “For me, a product needs to offer a solution to a problem while responding to a certain ethos of a time,” Pablo says. “It’s about how it helps us to adapt our tools to the new ways in which we operate . We designed Corner office to respond with emotional intelligence, as well as functional intelligence, to the spaces we inhabit today.

Hook is the first ecological and solidary lamp on the market.
Ecological since it's manufactured with recycled plastic and toxic-free materials. Moreover, it is a design that helps others: each light fixture sold will feed one child for an entire school year thanks to a collaboration with the NGO Mary’s Meals.

HOOK is a portable lamp with a hook. It's free, it needs no installation. You can move it anywhere you would like given that it comes with a 5-meter cable so it can follow you to wherever you need it without having to worry about wall outlets. If, on the contrary, what you need is to have it near you, its geometry allows for a perfect roll-up of the cable so that it does not become a mess and using it feels comfortable and nice.
Regarding functionality, it is a lamp and several lamps at the same time: it can work as a table lamp, as a ceiling lamp, as a wall lamp and even as a lantern. Its portability is helped by its size, which is completely adapted to the hand of the user, its long cable and its hook. It can be placed on any surface; it is designed to work perfectly on a bar, a shelf or a flat surface. In addition, Hook comes with a variety of accessories that turn it into a nightstand, a magazine rack and even a shelf. Lighting and maximum functionality from an elemental design filled with emotions.

Hook is revolutionary because of how it implements environmental aspects and the reduction of the toxic elements in the design and manufacturing stages of the product. It is one of the first interior design products made from recycled plastics and, at the same time, one of the first lamps with PVC-free wiring. In addition, since it is not enough to simply state it is eco-friendly; we prove it including a complete environmental product declaration. This lamp is made by a two-part recycled injected polypropylene housing and a translucent virgin-polypropylene diffuser. The cable is coated with silicone: an innocuous material both during its use and at the end of its lifecycle. For its design and its materials, CO2 emission reducing strategies have been implemented, as well as the highest standards to make it recyclable. Hook is ecological given that for its manufacturing process, only recycled plastics and materials free of toxic substances are used, avoiding the PVC for covering the wires, which makes it one of the most eco-innovative lamps on the market. In addition, this is a lamp made 100% in Spain.

Reminiscent of a floating, luminous full moon in the night sky, Satellight’s poetic design is minimalistic yet full of personality. The orb-shaped diffuser is made of hand-blown glass in milk-white color and lodged into a transparent, wide blown glass body. The diffuser’s smooth satin finish brings to mind celestial imagery of planets hovering in space. When turned on, the dimmable LED source transmits a warm, gentle light reflecting across the glossy transparent base.

The product design Eugeni Quitllet often describes himself as a “Disoñador”, which can be interpreted as “a mixture between a designer and a dreamer”. When talking about his inspiration for Satellight, Quitllet articulated:” I dreamed I was taking a piece of the sun to share it with the world, holding a ball of light in my hands.  I captured the light under a glass bell so it couldn't escape and I kept it for you.” The form and concept of the lamp represents light's pressure to escape and return to the sun. Satellight is a piece of light that is never trapped and continues to travel.
Satellight is available in two sizes for the table version: a large and a compact one, making it easy for its design to integrate into any space for different uses. Additionally, Satellight is available in a suspension version.

The past and future come together in the present to create new advancements with the MAYFAIR. The original inspiration for these luminaries was derived from the French Bouillotte lamps of the 19th century, a sophisticated piece of design comprising f one or more candlesticks with a flameproof adjustable metal shade painted reflective white on the inside. These traditional fixtures have been revamped with a highly contemporary style featuring innovative materials, an elegant silhouette and a refined LED light.

The Bicoca is born with the optimism of brightening life and accompanying the good times, wherever you go. This new colorful, lightweight portable lamp projects an intimate light that adds warmth to all your personal spaces.

Made of polycarbonate, Bicoca begins with an overlay of basic geometric figures,with a tiltable shade to direct the light. Three separate accessories increase the applicability and versatility of the lamp. A powerful magnet can be a affixed to the bottom of the fixture, allowing you to place it on metal surfaces—even vertical walls—defying gravity. An armchair accessory drapes over armrests, sofa backs, or headboards, so that you can bring your Bicoca to all your personal reading spaces. And a metallic disc accessory hides discreetly beneath the tablecloth, securing your Bicoca to the table.

The wide range of shade colors provide an option for any taste and any space. Bicoca is small, manageable, versatile and autonomous.

Celebrating Louis Poulsen’s philosophy of designing to shape light and inspired by the classic virtues of Danish design, Stine Gam and Enrico Fratesi, who make up the design duo GamFratesi, have designed a lamp dubbed Yuh.

One of the essential features of Yuh is that it is personal. The lamp is flexible and takes up very little space. The shade rotates, rises and drops, and pivots, illuminating and creating ambience in the required area. A lamp created just around you. Yuh includes a table lamp, floor lamp, and wall lamp, which are all available in white or black.

This contemporary table lamp manages to be the perfect blend of dark and light, round and slender, simple and artistic. The wide double shade design features an inner white fabric shade surrounded by a black metal band. The slim base and dual pull-chains come in an elegant chrome finish.

• 26" high.
• Fabric inner shade is 14" across top and bottom x 5" high.
• Metal outer shade 16" wide x 3" high.
• Uses two maximum 60 watt or equivalent bulbs (not included).
• Dual on-off pull-chain switches.
• Chrome and black chrome finish base and accents.
• Metal construction.
• White fabric shade.
Product > lighting: table.product_name: Geordi Double Shade Table Lamp by Possini Euro Design

Product > lighting: table.description_html:
GLOBE LAMP
NITZAN HOME COLLECTION
BRONZE MEDAILLE
MADE IN FRANCE

Ed Ng and Terence Ngan of AB Concept’s collection with Lasvit unveils FLUX, where glass meets metal as light meets water. The FLUX collection is an extension to the mood of light reflecting off of waves in different angles.

With the Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong as the backdrop to Mr. Ng and Mr. Ngan’s youth, the inspiration for this collection comes from the beaming light reflections emitted by the waves. The convergence of opposing elements on the FLUX light fixtures allow light to delicately illuminate a space, interacting with each other in different spatial environments.

FLUX is not meant to illuminate a room entirely, as it is intended to set a tone to one’s visual and learning experience. It is bright enough for one to be able to navigate through a space, but dim enough to discover other senses beyond the eyes. While the wavy appearance on the glass evokes ambiguity, the double-sided metal base adds sophistication. The symphony of light that is transmitted from the contrasting materials creates a pleasurable experience.

In celebration of Mr. Ng and Mr. Ngan’s adolescence illuminated by the glistening light reflections from Victoria Harbour’s waves, the FLUX collection epitomises warmth and memories.

Corner Office is a systemic and flexible task light that is also a power provision and personal privacy system for today’s new variety of workplaces. The system is comprised of three elements: a glare-free, fully dimmable LED task light that incorporates power ports featured in its armature; a set of optional acoustic deterrent fabric panels; and an optional pocket accessory, that provides a place to store a phone or tablet, keeping things clutter-free.

With today’s portable wireless technologies and cloud-based computing, many workers are in team environments or places other than the office. Privacy, power and quality lighting are necessary everywhere, as everyplace is a workplace. By providing these elements all in an easy to set up unit, Corner Office brings heightened efficiency and well-being to any desk. When used singly, Corner Office provides a quiet alcove or touchdown space for one. When arranged in multiples, it provides individual privacy within larger, open shared spaces.


Corner Office represents a new typology of workplace productivity tool. Equal parts task light, power charging station and acoustic/privacy panel system, Corner Office is a simple solution that helps define personal space by incorporating productive elements to support wellness and user-controlled privacy. Density in open-plan offices will only continue to rise and, while this sort of clustering of people is essential for employees to communicate, share knowledge and innovate, many workers are finding themselves suffering from distractions and lack of privacy. This often impedes the collaborative mission these layouts are designed to foster. Corner Office provides the attributes of a fully composed workstation with immediacy and ease.

While its overall aesthetic is simple, Corner Office reveals subtle intricacy in the places where elements come together. The sculptural origami-like shape of the panels outline a distinctive profile that is identifiable at a distance while refined, machined aluminum connectors provide self-evident, effortless reconfigurability for individuals or teams.

Corner Office Light is offered in a neutral white color and the panels are available in various felt colors. This allows it to quietly recede into the background, blending into the interior envelope, or enliven a space by adding a shot of accent color to any desk or tabletop. In addition to felt, forthcoming panel finishes and material options will include various wood veneers, perforated leathers and translucent plastics, as well as COM fabrics.

Designed for the modern, active workstation, Infinity is a new LED task light from Humanscale that responds to evolving tasks and needs. This 2017 Red Dot Product Design winner offers exceptional flexibility and high quality, energy-efficient light. Its constant torque ‘Forever Hinge’ allows for seamless adjustment, so the user
can easily re-position the light to accommodate varying needs and comfort levels throughout the day. These innovative new hinges promise to withstand frequent use and maintain their secure positioning over time.

Infinity uses large-array, multi chip LEDs to achieve 1500 lux illumination that casts just a single shadow. It is composed of 90% highly recyclable aluminum, and because the light’s exterior color is created by color films (rather than paint) the manufacturing process to create unique colors remains streamlined, and
therefore more energy efficient. Rated for 50,000 hours and featuring cool chip performance, Infinity provides the ideal task light output that’s powerful yet eco-friendly. Additional user-friendly features include a nightlight mode and a PIR sensor to conserve energy. User control indicator lights fade after adjustment to reduce visual
clutter. Offering an infinite number of adjustments and the latest LED technology, Infinity is designed for long-term performance.

Splitty boasts a unique joint design that makes it one of the most flexible lights in the Koncept collection. Koncept designers perfected a diffused light source with hidden LEDs, allowing the lamp to perform as a radiant ambient light as well as a functional task light. A USB output port is discreetly positioned, presenting convenient phone or tablet charging options. Splitty Pro features an occupancy sensor to maximize energy efficiency.

Splitty's thoughtful, minimalist design coupled with heightened functionality make for a piece highly desired by consumers and designers alike.

The artisanal weave of the Arteriors Elis Bench is refashioned as a table lamp, interlacing gray suede over a minimal solid brass frame. A combination of equestrian-inspired handwork and pure geometry, its juxtaposition of materials layer warmth and texture over modern polish. Topped with a rectangular ivory microfiber shade that is lined in gold foil. Designed by Windsor Smith as part of her Windsor Smith for Arteriors collection.

The simple design of the Milli Lamp packs a big punch. The contrast between the pewter shade and the base, available in either polished brass or polished nickel, makes a bold statement. Exposed hardware lends a chic industrial touch. Designed by Jay Jeffers as part of the Jay Jeffers for Arteriors collection.

As the name implies, our Radiant lighting glows from within for a magical effect, using a cord that can be plugged into any standard outlet. Made from sandstone, these lamps are a perfect way to introduce the element of warmth into a room indoors or intimate space outdoors.

We believe that how light makes you feel, helps you see, and empowers you to perform is an integral part of a lamp’s design.

Our new, proprietary OttLite WorkWell LED™ brings you illumination like no other. Closer to the spectral output of the sun than any other light available. That means balanced, low glare, high contrast illumination with no harsh blue spikes or big dips where you lose color fidelity or visual responsiveness. In fact, OttLite WorkWell LEDs are proven to reduce eyestrain 51% more effectively than the best-selling LED lights. And, everybody knows – and studies show – that people who work under natural daylight are more productive and even happier.

Additionally, the OttLite WorkWell LED offers a CRI (color rendering index) of over 95 – the best available in the market today.

Mid-century modern meets next generation LED technology with the Amplify Desk Lamp. Finished in chrome, this metal lamp is easy to adjust at base, arm and shade so you can position the light exactly where you need it. And, with just the touch of a finger, you can adjust the brightness. Plus, you can quickly and thoroughly charge devices with the 5V, 2.1A USB port to keep the productivity flowing.

The WorkWell by OttLite Series is a health-focused LED technology line that is a continuation of the work of OttLite founder, photobiologist and pioneer in natural light research Dr. John Nash Ott. OttLite was founded in 1989.

Superlight is a task light reduced to its essence. A gestural line in space resulting in a precise yet playful structure defying gravity with an appearance of near weightlessness. Designed under the axiom “form follows phenomena” the design introduces a new level of precision and control in providing flexible positioning and glare-free light within to- day’s open plan, screen-dominated workspaces. Its unique aesthetics achieves fluid, sweeping movement in every direction with a full 3-axis range of motion providing warm glare-free LED light exactly where you need it. Available as a desk, floor, wall, clamp or
grommet mounted fixture.
Designers: Peter Stathis & Matthew Boyko, 2017.

The Firefly Collection is entirely made of porcelain, which is something unique in the world of lighting. In addition, they are portable and self-sufficient energy-wise. These models are even unique within the Lladró Lighting catalog, because they respond to two challenges. Firstly, to create a lamp with a lithophane shade and with a more intense light than emitted by out lithophane. Secondly, for the lamp to work without having to plug it in.

The plant patterns update the classic tabletop lamp in the language of porcelain and with a wide variety of colors from the Lladró palette.
The magical ability of fireflies to cast light on their own is the inspiration behind the name of this collection of portable, battery operated table lamps. The decor on these lamps features vegetation motifs that bring to mind the shape of such plants as palm trees, cactus and lotus flowers.

With these creations, Lladró explores new forms to deploy its full artistic and functional potential. Here the brand applies its control of porcelain techniques in its line of lighting products, combining unique range of colors with porcelain. Everything comes together to achieve a novel, modern collection.

Northern Lights, an intriguing kinetic sculptural lamp, was designed by interior designer, architect and artist Sherry Williamson. As a floor or table lamp, the fixture transforms the mood and environment in the space it occupies.

Williamson has designed custom lighting for over 20 years, and was inspired to create Northern Lights as an off-shoot of her ongoing series of whimsical wood, wire and ceramic sculptures.

The design for Northern Lights balances a minimalist machined aesthetic with hand-crafted elegance.

Williamson chose a small team including Phoenix Day Lighting, the venerable family-owned San Francisco manufacturer, to fabricate the unusual fixture. Phoenix Day’s skilled team of artisans calibrated and machined the refined components of Northern Lights, bringing the design to life.

The poetic lamp features a hand-thrown and glazed ceramic cylinder base topped by a polished nickel disk with an array of 240 gently waving stainless steel rods. A powerful custom LED light source spills an ever-changing array of luminous hues up through the wires and onto the walls and ceiling above, reaching 15 feet or more.

The fixture measures 45” in height, is 10" in diameter and is compliant with UL 2108 Low Voltage and 8750 LED standards.

http://bit.ly/2y0kcdq

In our everyday existence, light serves us by enhancing everything around it, while it itself is often neglected. Here, the attention is given back to the source of light, treating it as an invaluably precious, albeit fragile, element. With its delicate wiring and bulb exposed, it requires the additional armature and structural support of the leather strap and brass hooks, while the glass bulb cocoons around and protects its gentle glow.

We believe that how light makes you feel, helps you see, and empowers you to perform is an integral part of a lamp’s design.

Our new, proprietary OttLite WorkWell LED™ brings you illumination like no other. Closer to the spectral output of the sun than any other light available. That means balanced, low glare, high contrast illumination with no harsh blue spikes or big dips where you lose color fidelity or visual responsiveness. In fact, OttLite WorkWell LEDs are proven to reduce eyestrain 51% more effectively than the best-selling LED lights. And, everybody knows – and studies show – that people who work under natural daylight are more productive and even happier.

Additionally, the OttLite WorkWell LED offers a CRI (color rendering index) of over 95 – the best available in the market today.

With chrome accents and fabric tension cord, the stylish OttLite WorkWell Series Reach Lamp makes a statement and offers complete control over the workspace with multiple brightness settings and choice of a base, grommet or clamp. Quickly and thoroughly charge devices with the 5V, 2.1A USB port (base and grommet only) and easily change the height, angle and position of this versatile lamp with the touch of a hand.

The WorkWell by OttLite Series is a health-focused LED technology line that is a continuation of the work of OttLite founder, photobiologist and pioneer in natural light research Dr. John Nash Ott. OttLite was founded in 1989.
Product > lighting: table.product_name: OttLite WorkWell Series - The Reach Clamp Lamp

Product > lighting: table.description_html: Our onyx lamps are merely beautiful. The hardness of granite and the translucent of marble create a soft glow that reflects off any surface the lamp is on. The Triangle Trio Lamp series marries an organic material with modern geometric form for an unexpected, yet elegant look. Stand alone, or mix and match, the three styles of triangle work well together or alone. Available with white or black shade.

LunarRock Table Lamp Collection
Illuminated hand-blown glass sculptural objects designed by Abby Modell are inspired by the surface of the moon.

Hand-blown glass in translucent mirror finish, sandblasted, with or without DiamondDust™ in gold, silver or titanium.
LED light.
Nickel hardware.
Approximately 14" W x 21"H

Terrazzo, wood and resin substrates punctuated with light pillars form this uniquely experiential material that transfers light, shadow, movement and colors beyond its surface to make a floating secondary surface come to life with a dynamic visual output that can be actively controlled or allowed to be affected by prevailing ambient conditions. A secondary surface created by light pillars is the hallmark of PIXA™ Dimensional. 3-dimensional forms and patterns can be achieved by varying the height of pillars. This combined with LEDs creates a unique cube shaped light that adds something special to any space.

During his creative process for Filo, designer Andrea Anastasio became inspired by the idea of deconstructing the traditional lamp form. By separating individual pieces that comprise it - the light source, the base, decoration elements and electrical wiring – Anastasio brought out each part’s own structural and aesthetic characteristics. Filo’s essential character is the result of playing with the fundamentals of decorative objects, elevating elements that are not traditionally considered decorative, alongside the adornments.

The colorful electrical wire is wrapped in fabric. Varying shapes of Murano glass spheres contrast with the minimal ceramic diffuser in a rhythmic dialog. These elements give Filo the resemblance to a delicate necklace with colorful glass beads.

The lamp comes in eight color combinations, from light watercolor tones to transparent hues of Murano glass, to bright, bold accents of the fluorescent cord, each with distinct personalities. The diversity of options makes it possible for Filo to work in a variety of residential and contract settings. Users also have the ability to string Filo’s wire in whichever way they desire.
A tall, serene lamp, mold-blown to create its charming drop shape, and made in beautiful bubbled milk glass. Its subtly glamorous, hand-painted latticed gold collar adds a dash of chic shine.

The Iris is a fluid and organic expression of glass and bronze. With its sculptural body and floating cast-glass core that glows from within, the Iris takes full advantage of designer Paul Mathieu’s attention to beguiling detail.

The Drip is born of conversations and reflections, of drawings on terraces of restaurants and of being carried away by the idea that "one thing leads to another". That's how a design with more than ten references is reached that satisfies both residential and contract sector needs. A family of lamps that speak the same language but in which each one has its own personality.


With the Drip, the goal was clear from the beginning: make a cascade pendant lamp. One of the most outstanding features of the Drip is its diversity of sizes. We find versions of 1, 6, 7, 12, 24, 36 and 48 lights only in suspension. The biggest has a diameter of 1 meter, which gives it a great visual impact. Any of them, although they are drawn from standard measures, can be customized at the request of the client. And so, starting from this initial premise, ideas of new typologies began to emerge: several wall lamps, two table lamps, a floor version with a support tray and USB connection, and also a specific solution for libraries.


Drip's small screen is made of borosilicate glass, finer and more delicate than blown glass. "I wanted the material to be very tasteful, almost like a candy," says Christophe. The choice of glass is intimately related to the light that creates the Drip. In the words of its creator: "I was looking for a very bright light, and the translucent glass and its shape contribute to it. The light source is an LED that is hidden so that light is the only protagonist. Then, when the light is projected and reflected in the materials that are found along the way, it creates a set of sparkles and shadows. All of which enriches the object. " Its light is intimate, but it also has a practical utility for those who are nearby. "I always bear in mind the space where a lamp is going to be located because that is where it becomes meaningful" explains Christophe. The Drip is intended for application in both residential and contract projects. Thanks to its multiple applications it works very well in all hotel spaces, in public areas as well as in rooms.


The relationship with the Drip, as Christophe says, goes in crescendo. First, it seduces you from a distance, enough for you to want to get closer to it. Once you are by its side you like its design, and that motivates you to take the last step and turn it on. Then, the magic reaches its maximum splendor

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
The Acrovyn by Design® pattern collection will transform the way you look at wall protection. Created by professional designers to bring a new feel to CS Acrovyn® wall protection, these patterns coordinate with our standard colors and can be specified for permanent adhesive panels or demountable wall panels. The collection consists of 13 brand new patterns in a variety of colorways and six new Chameleon™ simulated woodgrain patterns. Inspiration was taken from textiles and organic elements, and customizable options are available.

Unlike current wall covering products on the market promising protection, Acrovyn by Design patterns are embedded behind a .040" thick rigid sheet, making it the ultimate option in strength and durability. When specified as a wall panel, Acrovyn by Design is installed using our demountable Sure Snap® System, an innovative mounting concept that cuts installation time in half and makes it easy to clean and maintain your wall protection.

Acrovyn by Design is PVC-free and has been tested in accordance with ASTM E84 Class A/1 fire characteristics. Supplied in 4'x8' or 4'x10' rigid sheets, this wall protection option installs with a heavy-duty, water-based mastic adhesive and utilizes minimal sheet spacing, caulk or trims to allow for proper expansion and contraction of the material. We provide up-to-date product data, installation and maintenance instructions, sustainability records, testing information and other documentation for your peace of mind.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
A game changer in wall surfacing materials, Swick™ Natural Wall Coverings are thin, lightweight and flexible
veneers with a two-part polymer-mineral powder system fixed to a fiber weave backing which creates an elevated
industrial aesthetic. Handcrafted, Low VOC, Class A Fire Rated (upon request), and easy to install on curved or straight walls, millwork and more... this innovative material allows for an expanded vision of limitless possibilities for contract environments.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html: Breathe new life into your space with TRANSFORM by Caesarstone, the first 13MM quartz overlay surface solution from Caesarstone that allows homeowners to upgrade kitchens, bathrooms and other home surfaces with no demolition and limited disruption to their busy life. Homeowners can add elegance to their homes by resurfacing their countertops with the premium look and long lasting quality of Caesarstone in a matter of hours. Eat breakfast on your old surface and dinner on the new! TRANSFORM is simply applied over existing countertops, giving a luxurious update without the time, tear-out and cost of a full remodel. TRANSFORM delivers the same quality, durability and beauty that homeowners expect from Caesarstone. As with all Caesarstone surfaces, TRANSFORM is low maintenance, scratch, stain, heat and crack resistant and is covered by a lifetime warranty. TRANSFORM overlays most surfaces, including tile, laminate, stainless steel, granite, concrete, and butcher-block, and is now available in select colors.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
The Laser Cut collection from Móz Designs redefines architectural metal solutions by expanding the possibilities of the dynamic aluminum material using cutting-edge tooling and technology. The new collection of Laser Cut patterns strike the perfect balance of texture and transparency, providing a unique design solution for both interior and exterior applications.

With the Laser Cut collection, designers can seamlessly divide spaces with a reflective natural
metal or a bold colorful pattern using a durable and cost effective material solution. The versatile
collection has many uses — from an interior partition or feature wall to a structural column cover or stunning exterior facade — the Laser Cut collection offers designers the ability to create their own unique applications for retail, corporate, healthcare, or hospitality projects.

The twelve standard patterns are laser cut out of solid-core 3/16” aluminum material in 4’ x 8’ standard sheet sizes with the ability to customize the size and shape of the metal cuts to control the amount of light and flow through the space. Designers can select from Móz’s extensive collection of colors and grains including gradients, metallics, neutrals and standard powder coatings to achieve their unique design goal.

All Móz metals and architectural products are 100% designed, sourced, and manufactured in the United States with LEED points available for recycled content. Optional add-ons include custom thicknesses, custom sizes, trims and framing for seams, corners, and edges in a color to match.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
This custom finished 'blue' version of our Grandma's Attic Reclaimed Mixed Softwoods is part of our Thoughtful Sophistication Collection. Thoughtful Sophistication goes beyond the barn with options that are sleek and modern with a soul, giving designers, architects, builders, and homeowners the freedom to innovate with sheen, color, and texture. Be bold, bright, lustrous, subtle, smooth, textured, patterned, or radiant with the other side of reclaimed wood. There are options for flooring, paneling, and fixtures–all with the eco-loving and LEED benefits that make your projects sustainable.

Grandma's Attic Reclaimed Mixed Softwoods are quite versatile in that they can be left as rugged as the original planks, or smoothed out to replicate a footworn old floor, or custom finished in any color. Character includes deep coffee to lighter brown tones with a variety of knots, original patina, and some saw marks.

We developed this 'blue' product selection for IA (Interior Architects) in Washington, DC. The antique planks found new life as paneling at Applied Predictive Technologies, a subsidiary of a major credit card company.

We do well when we do good. Based on the simple belief that people, planet, and profit work together to ensure a better future, Pioneer Millworks operates on the Triple Bottom Line. We strive to keep our carbon footprint small; our roofs house 100kW solar arrays and our wood scraps keep us warm. One percent of our reclaimed teak sales are donated to conservation causes on the island of Borneo. Our American Prairie sales support domestic barn and historic preservation. Our products are FSC-certified, LEED point eligible, and in many cases diverted from landfills. Your purchases are what makes this crazy ride possible.
Product > materials, treatments and surf.product_name: Thoughtful Sophistication, Grandma's Attic Reclaimed Mixed Softwoods, Custom Finish

Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html: Keleen Leathers’ KLAD™ Luxury Leather Walls offers designers an exciting new design dimension to create leather walls. Designs of all shapes and sizes can be precision cut to specified dimensions using any of Keleen’s exceptional leathers as the surface material. Designers also have a range of options using hair on hides, which are cut using steel rule dies.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
A custom designed I-MESH curtain, during the last four years has been the leit-motive at Walter Knoll in their booths and shops. In 2017 Ippolito Fleitz for Walter Knoll approach is more conceptual than before. They utilized I-MESH to create legendas on walls, useful to visualize how the energy flows around the booth. The end result is a piece of impressive graphic art.
Experimentation, Art and Sensoriality combines together in one single element.
Ippolito Fleitz utilizes our production flexibility and technique to create series of wall mesh.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
Archoterra is an eco-friendly surface solution made from a proprietary blend of recycled papers and bonding agents formed into durable, lightweight 4'x8' sheets. The product can be used as an architectural panel, veneer or laminate suitable for walls, ceilings, cabinetry, furniture and more. Archoterra's great innovation lies in the fact that it is not only made from a recycled material but that it also has a unique aesthetic evoking a combination of paper, stone & concrete and is lightweight and easy to install with minimal seams. Archoterra is made in the USA from 90% post-consumer recycled materials sourced locally with a hands-on manufacturing process.

Archoterra's product line is organized into FLAT and DIMENSIONAL 4'x8' sheets, and offers 38 colors and 12 Dimensional patterns in both smooth or textured surfaces. Thickness ranges from 1/16" for Flat sheets to 1/2" for the deeper Dimensionals.

FLAT sheets come in 38 varieties:
12 SOLIDS such as "White Pages", "Ledger", and "Newsprint"
20 MIXES - LIQUID & PUREE such as "Crumpled Concepts", "Passport" and "Calendar"
6 METALLICS such as "Wedding Invite", "Carbon Copy" and "Chocolate Wrapper"

DIMENSIONAL sheets come in 12 standard patterns with articulated surfaces that create a three-dimensional shadowed effect. Each pattern is available in any solid, mix or metallic color. Patterns include linear options such as "V-Groove", "Wide Wale" and "Curtain" and geometric options such as "Weave", "Bad Tile Job and "Origami".

All products are available with 5 different finish levels: unfinished, matte, satin, semi-gloss and gloss.

Archoterra is completely customizable with respect to color, additives and patterns. Almost any custom color can be achieved with a variation in blends of raw materials and by adding natural pigments. Unique aesthetics can be achieved with additives such as mica-chip, natural fibers, and other organic materials. Any custom Dimensional pattern can be created, giving the designer or end-user creative freedom.

In contrast to other architectural surfaces on the market, Archoterra is lightweight, easy to cut and install with basic tools and does not require extensive backing and/or substrate as would other panels (MDF, gypsum, metal, resin), tile or stone. Shipping, handling and installation are therefore easier and more affordable. Sheets can be adhered to many different substrates or wall surfaces using wallpaper adhesive. When installed over type-X gyp board, Archoterra has a Class A fire rating. Seams are extremely minimal between sheets and the Dimensionals are designed for a continuous pattern both vertically and horizontally.

As an alternative to the 4'x8' sheets, Archoterra offers a wet mix that can be directly applied onto a surface in the field for a monolithic and seamless installation. The Archoterra wet mix can form to compound curves, angled surfaces and other irregular and unusual conditions.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
Chemetal’s new Glowing Metals collection showcases the company’s commitment to beautiful and innovative metal designs and laminates. From warmer, richer metals to textured patterns and patinas, these 36 new designs are Chemetal’s largest product introduction ever. Some new additions include Polished and Brushed Bronzes, a light Champagne Brass, Antiqued Copper, Rose Gold and Blue Brushed Aluminum. Also anodized aluminums, HPL metals, printed metals, and patinas on aged copper and brass.

Chemetal “Glowing Metals” collection by product groups:
 
New Classic Metals
Chemetal has added 11 new Classic Metals, Chemetal’s most popular materials. New additions include Polished and Brushed Bronzes, a lighter Champagne Brass, Antiqued Copper, Rose Gold, Blue Brushed Aluminum, and embossed designs on mirror-like anodized aluminum with cool reflections. Classic Metals emulate the look of more expensive metals, in more affordable and easier to fabricate HPL and anodized aluminums. Quality is excellent, HPL metals are European quality- sourced from Germany, and anodized aluminums are made in the USA and contribute to LEED with up to 75% recycled content. Available in 4’ x 8’ and some 4’ x 10’ sheets, plus custom.
 
Printed Metals
Chemetal has added 8 new designs to its popular Printed Metals. These layered designs create great moods like aged brass and steel. Newer more modern patterned designs include modern whites and designer grid patterns. 4’ x 8’ sheets. Aluminum. Some designs are exterior rated.
 
Chemetal Metal Patinas
Chemetal makes many metal designs in house, brushing, aging and adding patina to metals. This includes aged coppers and brass and glowing oxidations on solid brass. Contributes to LEED. 2’ x 8’, 2’ x 10’ sheets, plus custom.
 
HPL Metals
HPL Metals from Chemetal offer embossed, textured metal designs with the installation ease of a laminate backer. New designs in copper, slate and vintage mesh are a great interior design choice. 4’ x 8’ sheets.
 
Made in the USA
Chemetal’s in house production has been on a tear the past few years, constantly producing aged aluminums and aged brass metal “moods.” Last year, the company doubled the size of its Easthampton, Massachusetts headquarters and plant, to over 64,000 square feet.
 
LEED
Aluminum is one of the most recycled materials on the planet. Many Chemetal designs contribute to LEED with up to 75% recycled content for aluminum, 85% for brass, and
varying percentages for other materials. Learn more about Chemetal and LEED at chemetal.com.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
National’s Stitch It program allows customers to express their creativity and enhance existing products with stitched designs, creating a quilted aesthetic. This unique process is available on select wood side seating and lounge pieces, along with Whimsy impromptu seating and Toss pillows and cushions. With a variety of standard designs and sizes, the customer can add intricate or simple stitched patterns.

National implemented this unique process to allow customers to further customize products and offer a service that is unparalleled in the industry. National’s broad offering of patterns and sizes makes it an ideal solution to add a tailored design to standard products.

From grand scale to delicate, this unique capability creates a distinguished look and adds artistry. Choose from linear patterns or intersecting angles to add tailored design to standard products. Single and double stitch options allow for even more style versatility.

Stitch-it also offers a contrasting thread option that adds the illusion of additional depth with a splash of color. Complementary thread colors can be used to create monochromatic style. Stitch-it offers a variety of colors, patterns, and sizes to create a dramatic look or a subdued style.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html: The Hybrid Collection Mesh Pattern on Glass by Mac Stopa for Casali combines the mastery of transparency on glass with Mac Stopa’s 3D Mesh pattern and Casali’s new ink technology, creating a spherical 3D effect on glass with an illusion of morphed movement and a futuristic vibe. When illuminated, the Mesh pattern is projected on adjacent surfaces creating stunning artistic expressions. In addition to bright contrasting colors such as lime green and fuchsia, the Mesh pattern also comes in more subtle nature-inspired earth tones such as sunset orange, olive green, wood bark and sand. Made in Italy.

KLAD™ Stitched Leather Walls is a new innovative, and often requested component to Keleen's KLAD™ offering. The stitch detailing is an element designers have been asking of us in all of our leather tile programs for decades. This sophisticated element greatly enhances the appearance of these already stunning tiles. Many options exist for the stitch details such as color of thread, length of stitch and denier of this stitch element. These options not only offer design elements of hue and contrast, but also a texture created by the stitching. We feel the stitch option now takes Keleen Leathers KLAD™ offering to an extremely higher level of demand and interior wall adornment.

Keleen's KLAD™ luxury leather wall system is known for being the most economical leather wall system on the market. Also a huge feature of KLAD™ is the ease of installation; merely roll the adhesive on the wall and apply the tiles. Truly this is a DYI "Do It Yourself" ease of installation, and if you damage a tile, simply peel it off and replace with a new one.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
Create a stunning space for your brand with character, texture, and quality. A real stone masonry alternative that is lightweight, durable and easy to install.

Arterra is a high-quality masonry alternative wall panel made with a real stone surface. With Arterra, you get the look, feel, and durability of masonry, while reducing installation time, labor, and material costs. Choose from five beautiful collections crafted with care and designed with precision, each with their own unique design 
and unmistakable character. 

SURFACES MADE FROM REAL STONE 
A crushed stone surface made from natural minerals is molded and laid over a layer of high-density foam to create a lightweight stone panel 

ARTISTIC FOCUS ON DETAIL & AUTHENTICITY 
Inspired by the built environment and manufactured by artisans. Our process allows for the consistent reproduction of traditional stone & brick as well as other architectural designs. 

NATURAL FEEL & COLD TO THE TOUCH 
The real stone surface has an authentic feel that is cold to the touch, just like natural stone, but without the weight and complexity of installation 

Arterra’s light weight and interlocking edge enable any contractor to perform a fast, accurate, and ultimately high quality installation. The durable real stone surface composition means that it can be installed in interior and exterior applications, with the added benefit of incredible dimensional stability. 

TOUGH IN ANY ENVIRONMENT 
Arterra is resistant to rain, snow, UV damage, heat, freeze, and defrost. Arterra has a zero percent water absorption rate, ensuring protection against moisture and humidity, all with Class B fire ratings. 

LOW MAINTENANCE, UPKEEP, & REPAIRS 
Save time and money throughout the product lifecycle with Arterra’s extremely durable surface that is easy to clean and maintain. 

QUICK & EASY INSTALLATION 
Our lightweight and easy to install panels are ideal for keeping budgets low while shortening the installation timeline

Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html: Rugged Concrete offers a medium grey base camouflaged by billows of white with a masculine energy that exudes confidence, competence and fortitude. Appealing to men and women, this Caesarstone color is well-suited for a chic, urban loft for a modern, unfinished edge. Or, it can mix with softer décor motifs to add a warm rustic charm. Rugged Concrete is a new finish from Caesarstone offering a clean, industrial look, perfect for modern spaces.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
FUZION glass architectual elements and surfaces are crafted one at a time. The process we use to fuse glass to glass yield a surface of uncommon depth and illusionary definition. Natural inclusions and bubbles that are created in the process enhance the artisanal beauty of our glass. Glass, like stone, is one of the most durable and resilient natural surfaces. Our carefully defined heating and cooling processes increase the inherent hardness of our glass. The ultra-thick fused glass products are available to the trade for commercial and residential applications. The FUZION glass can be manipulated to be edged, or have glacier, lakeside, minimal, or wave textures.

Andrew Pearson has developed fused glass technologies to create our line of thick glass architectural elements and surfaces in a production environment. With fine tuned processes in place, we launched our ultra-thick fused glass products for commercial and residential applications under the name FUZION.

We use custom-built kilns to fuse glass to glass, producing an extra hard and durable surface for daily use in any residential, commercial or hospitality application. Our exacting process yields consistently beautiful thick glass available in a variety of patterns and thicknesses to create unique artistic looks.

Andrew Pearson specializes in luxury commercial and residential custom glass applications and installations for commercial and residential use. They offer specialized and unique glass products in a variety of techniques. All of their custom glass products are fabricated in North Carolina from raw glass produced in the United States. One-of-a-kind artisan glass products are produced by Andrew Pearson’s skilled craftsmen one at a time and are ensured to be both beautiful and durable. Andrew Pearson has pioneered several of the techniques that have become the hallmark of excellence in glass work for furniture and architectural glass design.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
When it comes to designing a flawless laminate, innovative technology needs to be infused from the very start of the manufacturing process, making it part of the product, not just an add-on. From pesky handprints to unsightly smudges, troublesome fingerprint marks have been the enemy of super-matte, silky-soft laminates in commercial installations, until now. New Wilsonart Traceless™ Laminates infuse fingerprint-resistant technology into its super matte, velvety, soft surface making smudges of all shapes and sizes seem to disappear.

For a space to be truly practical, a surface should not require extra maintenance, which is why Traceless Laminates not only require less wiping down to get rid of smudges, but they hold the durability of Wilsonart Laminates. Meaning heat, impact and scratch resistance, and UL GREENGUARD Gold certification for low-chemical emissions comes standard.

Studioart, specialist in the production of highly textured leather wall coverings and leathers for
upholstery for interior decoration, represents the cutting edge of the creative flair in leather that
has made the Dalle Mese family stand out in the international industrial tanning district for over 50
years. The extensive craftsmanship experience fused together with creativity, the ongoing

success factors of the long family business. Founded in 2006, Studioart has a thoroughly made in
Italy production, where leather goes beyond the frontiers of the fashion world to become the

production in respect of the environment.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
Following the celebrated launch of Dekton Trilium in 2016, Cosentino added three new colors to its Dekton Industrial Collection. Drawing inspiration from the award-winning Dekton Trilium, leading architect and designer Daniel Germani envisioned three new designs that capture the organic texture and essenese of weather-worn stone and aged metals. The industrial Collection is intended to be both relaxed and modern through its rough, expressive aesthetic, reestablishing concrete, metal and brick as material protagonists in modern design. To create a rich design with varied subtle effects, the Industrial collection has a never before seen matte-gloss finish.

Unlike the materials that sparked the Industrial Collection’s design, Dekton is incredibly smooth to the touch and impervious to the elements, including scratches, stains, UV rays and temperature shock. Its ultra-durable performance makes it ideal solution for an array of indoor and outdoor applications, including countertops, facades, cladding, flooring, stairs and more. It is available in large format, which allows for seamless creative possibilities for architects and designers for both residential and commercial projects.

“The Industrial Collection celebrates the beauty of metals and cement as they transform over time,” Germani says. “Imperfections caused by oxidation and natural degradation create unique colors that capture the richness and depth of organic processes. It was only through the incomparable technology of Dekton that we were able to explore these processes and subsequently create these designs.”

In the spirit of Cosentino’s continued commitment to sustainability, 80 percent of the materials used in
two of the collection’s four colors (Trilium and Radium) come from excess materials from the Dekton manufacturing process. Sustainability is an integral part of the Cosentino brand; a portion of all R+D funds are allocated to the creation of environmentally friendly products to help Cosentino achieve zero emissions in an effort to maintain clean air, support energy efficiency, manage water effectively and dispose of waste correctly.

The Dekton Industrial Collection includes the following four colors:
• Orix mimics the industrial appearance of eroded cement: steely, cold and broken. Its multi-tonal color palette of greys, blues and greens creates contrast between old and new.
• Nilium subtly blends hues of silver and white, offering a minimal approach. It simultaneously conveys the delicate elegance and inherent strength of metal.
• Radium resembles acid-washed steel, juxtaposing warm earth tones against cold blue and green hues. Similarly to Trilium, it is manufactured using the same sustainable production methods, using up to 80 percent recycled materials.
• Trilium, the first of the collection, captures the visual texture and color variation of aged and oxidized stainless steel with hues ranging from deep grays and blacks to rusty undertones, giving it an incredibly genuine appearance.

Striata Fusion Communal Tabletop

This innovative communal tabletop design using TorZo Striata Fusion is ideal for bringing small groups together in hotels, restaurants, bars, and multi-family residential community spaces. Featuring a geometric motif and available in a variety of color options and finishes, this unique TorZo communal tabletop demonstrates what is possible with TorZo.

Infusion with a durable and colorful acrylic resin takes the linear pattern to a new level of style. The proven durability and performance of Striata Fusion make this surface ideal for any tabletop.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html: Designers can achieve the look they're going for on any surface with Elements Gravitas' variety of colors, textures, and patterns in ways they didn't think was possible to install. The new collection is innovative, light-weight materials that come from the automotive industry and which, in combination with MI decorative surfaces, can be used as wall panelling. Elements is extremely light and compact, which means that it can be cut and further processed using standard tools. Moreover, processing is even joint-free. Elements can be bonded edge to edge and therefore does not require expansion joints. As a result, revolutionary design options can be implemented on large surface areas. Irrespective of whether leather, wood or stone patterning is involved, the Elements products are extremely light, but nonetheless dimensionally stable. These products are easy to handle and offer flexible applications. Professional processing of the material is straight forward and takes place on the patterned side. Readjustment on any surface is no problem when bonding with silicon is employed. Elements Gravitas takes the beauty and design of the old collection but is an improvement on the manufacturing, processing, and installation. All in all, the new collection is a reissue based on the advancement of technology.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
BermanGlass Levels Kiln Cast Glass unites the best of two worlds: cast and laminated glass. The line draws on Forms+Surfaces’ expertise in two arenas – artistic cast glass design and sophisticated glass lamination technologies – to create a line of architectural glass with unrivaled visual potential.

By definition, Levels glass is architectural kiln cast glass laminated with color, graphic or image interlayers. Each design pairs an artisanal texture, cast on a handcrafted mold and fired in a kiln, with an interlayer optimized specifically for that texture.

The Levels collection consists of twelve standard designs: three textures, each with one of four different color, graphic or image interlayers optimized specifically for that texture.

TEXTURES shape the surface appearance of Levels glass designs. Each texture has distinctive visual characteristics, tactile qualities, and ways of reflecting or refracting light. The glass itself is inherently clear.

INTERLAYERS add color and enrich the optical experience of each design. Three types of interlayers produce varied visual effects: Color interlayers feature solid color and offer the most subtle end results. Graphic interlayers expand the design complexity by introducing graphics in a single color. Image interlayers incorporate multiple continuous tone colors and have the most dramatic impact.

Aesthetically, the sculpted surfaces of Levels glass capture light on and through the glass; the interlayers add a sense of depth and dimension and accentuate plays of light, texture, color, and motion. Viewed up close or at a distance and as light and viewing angles change, each design is as captivating as it is dynamic.

From an applications standpoint, Levels glass gives designers new ways to bring the handcrafted beauty of textured cast glass into spaces of all kinds – including elevator interiors – and makes it easy to move cohesively across a project, from design concept to installed reality.

Levels Kiln Cast Glass can be fabricated in any size up to 53” x 108” (1346mm x 2746mm). Standard glass thickness is a nominal 6mm. End use determines finished glass dimensions.

BermanGlass Levels Kiln Cast glass is available exclusively in Forms+Surfaces’ LEVELe Wall Cladding and Column Systems, LEVELe Elevator Interiors, and LightPlane LED Panels. Each system is designed to address mechanical details like trim pieces and mounting assemblies, so designers don’t have to worry about resolving these aspects; they can simply focus on the creative process.

Levels Kiln Cast Glass can be easily cleaned and maintained using a mild soap or glass cleaning solution. With the decorative interlayer behind the glass, rather than surface-applied, the glass surfaces are easy to clean.

The use of UV-resistant inks in the printing process helps ensure that Levels interlayer colors and designs retain their integrity over time. The laminated structure also protects the interlayer artwork from surface damage and fading.

Levels Kiln Cast architectural glass complies with major building codes as laminated safety glass and meets numerous U.S. and Canadian industry standards.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
ICE OF GENESIS
ICE OF GENESIS is the beginning of everything, the origin of nature, and of matter. The origin of an idea, a creative process, that seeks to change the status quo of surface coverings. It is the most ambitious collection from COMPAC, offering a series of surfaces in which technology, design and art come together to create something that has never been seen before.
For such an inspiring endeavour, we collaborated with a truly disruptive and transgressive mind: the designer and artist Arik Levy.
ICE OF GENESIS is the result of the huge challenge of creating a material that has depth but is also flat and resistant. Imitating the feeling of walking on ice, exquisitely balanced between fragility and stability.
Inspired by the great ice lakes that can be found in the Arctic, ICE OF GENESIS reveals on its surface visual fragments similar to those produced by natural stone, causing the eye to delve into ethereal qualities and surprising material transparency.
The goal was to create warmth, coolness and abstraction. The black pieces are abstract; the red ones represent the warmth of the earth, whereas white speaks of coldness. Whatever they say, they all produce a sense of depth, responding to parameters that seem unknown in the visual sense, but are closely connected to the collective memory of our very natures.
Available designs: Ice Black and Ice White in polished and glacé finishes, size 128”x63”, thicknesses ¾” and 1 ¼”.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.category: Product > materials, treatments and surfaces (including paneling)
Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
Workshop/APD by Desiron marks New York-based architecture and design firm Workshop/APD’s first commercially available furniture collection and is largely inspired by American Craftsmanship and the power of man and machine. It highlights the strength and raw beauty of natural materials as exposed to the elements overtime with blackened steel, hand-charred woods and textured basalt stones and combines those natural pieces with modern black delrin and glass.

In bringing the collection to life, Desiron leveraged the skills and abilities of the artisans at its 30,000 square foot New Jersey factory experimenting with the ancient Japanese art of Shou Sugi Ban to create blackened wood while also developing a raw, gradient metal finish called “oil quenched steel” that creates an amber in both color and texture.

“In designing this collection, we were particularly inspired by the use of materials and how they tell the story of the artisans who manipulate them,” said Matt Berman, Co-Founder and Principal of Workshop/APD. “We were drawn to the idea of the craftsperson and chose to use textured stones, metals that show a natural patina and wood that was charred by hand using Desiron’s expert techniques.”

The five-piece collection consists of a Bench, Console, Wall Hooks, Bar Cart and Floor Mirror. The pieces are representative of Workshop/APD’s crafted modern approach to architecture and interiors with a streamlined, dark elegance that has been brought to life by the master wood workers, metal fabricators and professional finishers at Desiron, led by President and Creative Director, Frank Carfaro.

Product > materials, treatments and surf.description_html:
Kamakura Collection, customizable laser cut metal wall coverings or architectural panels, is offered in two harmonizing patterns.

Named for the seaside Japanese city famed for its serene lotus ponds, “Kamakura” captures the fluidity of waterborne lotus leaves.

Available in a broad range of metals, finishes and powder-coat colors. With options for customizing dimensions, repeat scale and palette, the gently floating aquatic leaves can add warmth and tranquility to any space, from home to spa, healthcare, hotel, office, restaurant or public area. Finish may be customized as well for outdoor use.
Product > materials, treatments and surf.product_name: Kamakura Collection: Metal Wall Coverings, Architectural Panels and Room Dividers
