Zenzero Bench has issued a new edition in hand carved solid American Black Walnut planks supported by Polished Nickel Brass Legs.
Inspired in the wake of Hurricane Sandy to make furniture from downed trees, the process has evolved to become a strong residential accent piece. Walnut planks are glued to form a large volume that is then hand carved to shape a long seat with a partial backrest. The body is supported by water jet cut steel legs that are finished in Polished Nickel Brass. The organic form floats above a series of legs and is capped on each side with a unique leg shape that sits flush with the wood.

Designed by Jonathan Glatt and Sara Ossana of O&G Studio, the Wayland Continuous Snake Armchair fuses traditional stylistic influences – a hallmark of the brand – with exquisite detailing and artisan hand-craftsmanship. Taking approximately 40 hours to complete from start to finish, the result in a one-of-a-kind accent chair built to last for generations.

An homage to the wisdom and inventiveness of traditional American design, the Wayland Snake Armchair is inspired by the form and silhouette of the classic early American-Windsor chair. This style, which originated in the 18th century, emerged as a simplified and visually lighter interpretation of the British Windsor chair – American craftsmen eliminated its extraneous details, and slenderized the splats and legs for a more delicate, airy appearance.

O&G’s Wayland Snake Armchair shares the same characteristics -- featuring a spindled back uninterrupted by a central splat, slim proportions, and a streamlined silhouette, the piece can be described as a continuation of the American-Windsor’s legacy. It also features a “continuous arm,” in which a chair’s arms and back rim are made of a single, bent piece of wood. This development also arose with the birth of the American-Windsor, strengthening the chair while also giving it a lighter, more balanced look. In addition, O&G’s Wayland Snake Armchair also draws from the American-Windsor’s legacy of hand-craftsmanship, with continuous, hand-carved arms and a hand-shaped saddle seat.

Meanwhile, the snake motif of O&G’s chair pays tribute to another part of traditional American design, American folk art. Animals were a favorite subject for naturalistic and allegorical carvings during the 18th and 19th centuries, and were frequently incorporated into walking sticks and sculpture. This was in part due to the prevalence of nature in day-to-day life during this time, but also the influence of Native American design traditions and their frequent incorporation of animal motifs. Consequently, the hand-carved snake motif of O&G’s Wayland chair is not only a preservation of this rich legacy, but also modernizes the piece with exquisite detailing that would have been viewed as too time-consuming and therefore, unnecessary, by early American-Windsor craftsmen.

O&G’s Wayland Snake Armchair is made by local artisans at the studio’s headquarters in Warren, Rhode Island, and is available in their Ebony, Beet, or Azimuth stained finishes.

The Wayland Snake Armchair is a synthesis of two incredibly important and influential American design traditions – when fused together, the result is distinctly contemporary, without sacrificing either’s historical significance or defining characteristics. From a larger perspective, this idea of keeping the traditions American design alive by updating them for modern day is a hallmark O&G Studio’s approach towards design as a whole, and why their pieces are not just aesthetically beautiful, but historically and culturally significant as well.

Jeff Andrews adds three architecturally inspired lounge chairs to his collection for A. Rudin. This is the first addition to the 20-piece array since the collaboration debuted in spring 2015.
Each piece is unique, defined more by their sturdy, architectural frames than upholstery. The three chairs share a mid-century influence, resulting in pieces equally handsome, subtle and cozy. Chair 861 appears to float on a reclined frame, while 862 features an Andrews-signature structural back, and blends subtle curves and angles artfully.
Andrews says, “I started sketching pieces to add to my furniture collection with A. Rudin with an architectural intent. I love to put a pencil to paper and experiment with shape, scale and proportion. The trial and error of the creative process is key to designing pieces that feel original and relevant but are also versatile and comfortable.”
Andrews built his relationship with the A. Rudin family over many years of specifying and customizing their broad range of furniture for his design clients. Because of their mutual respect and shared vision, the Jeff Andrews Collection for A. Rudin was born. The creative journey between designer and manufacturer has been intimate, exploratory and fulfilling, resulting in the perfect expression of the designer’s own personal aesthetic.

The shapes of Eddy draw their inspiration from the logic and styling of the cycling world, but also from the minimal and elemental graphic design of the fixie. "If you think about it, many of the first prototypes in the history of design were made in cycling workshops", explains Alain Gilles, "because that's where the masters of tubular metal manufacturing were, and they had the expertise required to make those objects with such essential style". The Eddy armchair is built using the same logic as bicycle construction, around a tubular metal frame, while the seat is designed to be comfortable and ergonomic. The way in which the various parts of the frame are connected - using “quick release” fittings - is an obvious reference to the cycling world.
The use of separate elements to make up the frame of the armchair makes it possible to play with the graphics and thus create multiple combinations of different colours and finishes. The armrests can be embellished with side pockets which are useful for storing books and magazines or to keep remote controls within easy reach. Eddy is available with or without a headrest.
Frame in metal, painted in a variety of colours
Upholstery in leather or eco-leather
Dimensions: L. 78 cm, D. 86 cm, H. 101 cm

The Catia bench brings refinement and sophistication to a category of product that is often monotonous in a space. Catia incorporates a sleek, yet substantial cushion, which creates a streamlined silhouette. Light and airy in appearance, the bench features an elliptical fin base combined with a gently curved top. The upholstered seat is accented with a welt around the perimeter and a saddle stitch through the center of the seat on leather and non-railroaded fabrics. The seat is seamless when fabrics are railroaded. Catia can be selected with a frame in solid American walnut or solid American maple and is available in any fabric or leather from Bernhardt Textiles or the customer’s own material.

In keeping with the exceptional resources of Bernhardt Design, Catia meets all BIFMA standards for use in contract spaces. Pieces are crafted from materials including: American walnut, maple, Corian, aluminum, and fabric or leather from Bernhardt Textiles or COM.


Catia speaks the language of simplicity and graceful lines while maintaining universal forms, allowing to be paired comfortably with different styles of furniture and setting.

Catia is GREENGUARD certified. Bernhardt Design and Bernhardt Textiles is an EPA Climate Leading Partner, and facilities are certified and level audited. Made in the USA.

The Euclid Collection features coopered sculptural furniture. Utilizing the traditional barrel making technique each faceted piece creates a gradual and solid curved surface with grain wrapping details.

Made in solid white oak or ash the Euclid Bench features gently faceted grain matched legs. Each seat is hand woven with solid braid cotton cord which delicately pierces the curved base. The patterning is unique and designed to suit the geometry of each piece. The woven seat is a contemporary take on a traditional practice pulling from danish cord and shaker rush weaving as well as Peruvian and American Indian tapestry weaving.

The " Giza " chair was created for a charity event that benefited The Illumination Foundation in Orange County, California. When I was asked by Lux Magazine if I would create a seat to end homelessness, I immediately accepted the offer. The Giza chair is inspired by the Illumination foundation's logo, which is a triangle. The chair is a symbol of illumination, enlightenment and unity with the brass detailing representing ray of sunlight. The triangle being the foundation's commitment and strength to help our community and the brass is the ray of light in all those families and children's faces.
I named it 'Giza', as it also reminds me of the pyramids due to it's triangular nature.

The material of the chair is American Beech stained and lacquered brass. The upholstery is 100% Linen.

The Frank chair balances geometrically purity, plush comfort and robust engineering. Two perfectly round cushions float uncannily above the frame for ideal support and maximum visual impact. The draftsman's hand can be felt in the delicate, linear structure that envelopes the softly upholstered seat and back. Both Modern and Moderne the Frank chair owes a debt to early 20th-century design experiments in mathematical clarity. At once delicate and daring this three-legged chair stands out on its own.

Luxurious yet durable mohair fabric. Meticulously crafted, brushed brass frame with hand-worked finish. Molded polyurethane foam fill for maximum support and comfort.

BLACKBARN lifestyle brand by Mark and Kristen Zeff teamed up with Spanish furniture brand, ARXE, to bring an exclusive line of pieces to the US market for the first time. ARXE products, which are inspired by nature, are fabricated from both organic and reclaimed materials. Mark Zeff, a designer whose own rustic yet refined aesthetic has set him apart, will make these seating options available at BLACKBARN Chelsea Market shop, cafe & bar this fall.

Sossego is the exclusive US distributor of Brazilian designer Aristeu Pires. Following a long and eminently successful career in computer engineering, Aristeu discovered his passion and exceptional talent for creating modern furnishings from warm Brazilian woods. For 15 years his designs have brought everyday comfort to the finest hotels, restaurants and workspaces across South America where contemporaries in the A+D community have dubbed him “King of Chairs.” It’s all about exceptional styling: comfort for the body and beauty to the eye.

Olivia armchair
Visually striking, the Olivia armchair’s seemingly delicate, branch-like legs belie her inner strength. The wide seat ensures an easy and comfortable hours-long sit. A trend-setter, her caned back is an exquisite touch.

Individually hand finished, her arms are carved like a supple fold of a palm leaf falling over. 5 axis CNC machining paired with old world craftsmanship create Olivia's seamless joinery and tactile appeal. Crafted from sustainably harvested jequitibá and louro freijó hardwoods, and upholstered in natural Brazilian leather, COM/COL, or over 100 fabric options. Jequitibá is a sustainably harvested Brazilian hardwood (akin to fine maple or royal mahogany) that features a natural luster and clear grain structure. Louro freijó is referred to as “Brazilian walnut” for its rich grain and is sustainably harvested with strict oversight by Brazil’s Ministry of Environment.
Available in 14 wood finishes to grace the home, office, boutique hotels or lobbies.

"I love the Olivia. For her design, I was inspired by the intertwining branches of an olive tree and incorporated a hint of Art Nouveau,” said Aristeu Pires.

ALCHEMY – the philosophy and practice of purifying, maturing and perfecting elements – is the inspiration behind Donghia’s 2017 Furniture and Lighting Collection.
For more than 40 years, Donghia has been synonymous with visionary American design and exquisite craftsmanship. Designed in Manhattan and made from the world’s finest materials, the 2017 Alchemy collection advances Donghia’s legacy of urban, contemporary design, legendary comfort, grounded in old-world artistry.
Wood, metal and glass have been worked upon by hand, tradition and time. Imagination becomes reality and beauty takes functional shape as wood suggests movement, metal energizes line, glass appears liquid.
Through the power of ALCHEMY, the 2017 Donghia Furniture and Lighting collection seamlessly integrates materials and transforms it into artwork. We invite you to experience The Art of Donghia with the 2017 ALCHEMY Collection.

Neri&Hu’s design for the Mandarin series pays homage to the Art Deco influence on Shanghai in the 1930s, whose architectural legacy is still found in many parts of the city today. Inspired by the unique confluence of Western and Eastern ideologies during that time, the structure of the pieces takes cues from the expressed joinery and hierarchy of Chinese carpentry, but at the same time, breaks the rigidity of traditional imperial furniture with upright stiff backs and flat seats. The leather elements in the Mandarin series are shaped in gentle curving lines; they can be said to have roots in the mid-century experimentations with molded plywood that are a cornerstone of Modern furniture. As a result, the pieces have an unmistakably contemporary look and feel, while harkening a sense of connection to history and culture.

Bravo Chair

The crowd leaps to its feet…and then looks for our fabulous Bravo chair to sit down in again. From its tapered legs to its sensational silhouette, every element of the Bravo was designed together for comfort, style, and a great, big WOW. The Mickey Mouse fabric, which is available only on Bravo, was developed specifically for it, making the most of the size and shape of this sweeping wing chair. A true showstopper you won't see anywhere else.
A tight back and seat offer the perfect combination of structure and softness
We designed the "Mr. Mouse" fabric exclusively for the curves and lines of this chair
Chic, mid-century modern-style legs are stained in a water-based finish
Mr. Mouse in Mickey's Ears Black (D2955) comes with Black (946) finish on legs; Lucky Denim White (D1230) fabric comes with Umber (934) finish on legs

An engineered hardwood frame provides superior strength and durability

Ethan Allen | Disney Collection

Designed by Ethan Allen and inspired by Disney’s iconic characters, Mickey Mouse and Minnie Mouse, the impressive collection includes over 500 fun, yet sophisticated, styles for the modern family. Combining Ethan Allen's core strengths of craftsmanship, style, and quality with Disney’s rich storytelling, we’ve created an experience that kids and parents will truly love and appreciate. The collection is designed for every room in the home—and everyone who lives there.

It includes a range of whimsical, fashionable, functional looks for nurseries, kids’ rooms, playrooms, and family living spaces. Consumers will also find an array of accessories such as art and wall décor, rugs, lighting, bedding, and chic, clever storage pieces. Many styles feature cool nods to retro Disney designs, playful shapes, and signature Mickey and Minnie details. Many styles are available in a selection of fabrics and finishes and handcrafted in the company’s own North American workshops.

Sossego is the exclusive US distributor of Brazilian designer Aristeu Pires. Following a long and eminently successful career in computer engineering, Aristeu discovered his passion and exceptional talent for creating modern furnishings from warm Brazilian woods. For 15 years his designs have brought everyday comfort to the finest hotels, restaurants and workspaces across South America where contemporaries in the A+D community have dubbed him “King of Chairs.” It’s all about exceptional styling: comfort for the body and beauty to the eye.

Pitu collection: 
The Pitu collection by Aristeu Pires extends the incredible culture of Brazil to North America: relaxed, warm, and welcoming, but always with a purpose. Aristeu observed how happy and comfortable his baby daughter was in her infant swing or perch seat that hooks to a tabletop. She played in it happily for hours. He thought, “there has to be a chair for adults that brings such comfort!” “Pitu” is the sweet Portuguese nickname for Aristeu’s youngest daughter. The collection is intended to spark joy as it comfortably envelops the guest who has the pleasure of using it.

Hand finished of rich Brazilian hardwood, plush down, and supple leather, the Pitu is engineered with a swing reminiscent of a suspended rope bridge or hammock. Cushion available upholstered in natural Brazilian leather or over 100 fabric options and is supported by a canvas swing. 

5 axis CNC machining paired with old world craftsmanship, create Pitu’s seamless joinery and tactile appeal of Brazilian jequitibá and louro freijó hardwoods. Jequitibá is a sustainably harvested Brazilian hardwood (akin to fine maple or royal mahogany) that features a natural luster and clear grain structure. Louro freijó is referred to as “Brazilian walnut” for its rich grain and is sustainably harvested with strict oversight by Brazil’s Ministry of Environment. Available in 14 wood finishes to grace the home, office, boutique hotels or lobbies.

Pitu lounge chair
Pitu is the lounge chair you’ll never want to leave. With generous width, the Pitu lounge chair facilitates ease and relaxation in lobbies, collaborative offices, and community areas. 

Pitu armchair
Comfortable as a hug, it offers just a slight bit of swing to the body, adjusting as the sitter moves within it. The Pitu armchair creates unrushed human interactions at dining tables, restaurants, and ancillary workspaces.
 
Pitu chaise lounge chair
The Pitu chaise lounge chair is excellent for alone time after a long day's work. It offers deep comfort and was inspired by the hammock that some Brazilian families will hang in every room of their house including their outdoor space. Ergonomically designed for reclining and dreaming of a soothing Brazilian rainforest or faraway beach, this chaise lounge chair calls for a living room, break room, or getaway space.

LINK’s Daybreak Lounge Chair embodies the alluring modernism of the mid-century, defined by thin flowing teak slats, an airy stainless steel frame and luxurious made-to-order upholstery. The Daybreak Lounge Chair offers the highest comfort with modern materials and style infused with clean lines and a calm aesthetic. The Daybreak Lounge Chair is available in abundance of fresh finish combinations.

TORU is a young craft and design company that produce beautiful, simple design furniture with exquisite materials.
We are interested in telling stories through objects, by looking for new functions and exploring ma¬terial qualities. All the products are handmade by local artisans, and are either unique or produced in small series.

Our products are made in quality leather, produced locally with the highest standards of craftsmanship and using vegeta¬ble-tanned leather only.
Founded in 2015 by Jordi Ribaudí, the company is based in Igualada, Barcelona, a town with deep roots in the leather industry. The headquarters is located in a restored nineteenth century tannery.
Toru’s passion is to make the most of leather in furniture design. We work the material and look for new purposes to create innovative shapes and feels. Our unique and exciting designs will last for years to come.

BABU
Babu is a nomadic chair. You can fly on a carpet or chill on the sand while sitting in it.
Its design is inspired by the great journeys of the desert tribes, during which men feel close to the earth, rest on it and merge with the landscape.
Babu is a spot for relaxation and meditation; a place to rest, a shelter.

Babu is born straight from Jordi Ribaudí’s soul, in Igualada, Barcelona. The town has strong roots in the local leather industry, and the company’s headquarters is to be found in a restored nineteenth century tannery.
His work is inspired by his passion for leather works. He looks for new purposes of the material in order to create innovative -and exciting- shapes and feels.

Materials
Babu takes shape from a single 6mm-thick leather piece, which folds back on itself to create the backrest. Some small brass feet keep the structure together.
The leather, vegetable-tanned and wax-finished, is available in four different aniline colours: na¬tural, brown, hazelnut, and black.
The seat cushion is available in cotton velvet and leather.

One of the most celebrated interior architects in the world today, Lauren Rottet has designed stylish offices for Goldman Sachs, Disney, GE and a host of other companies; interiors for such renowned hospitality brands as St. Regis, Marriott and the Four Seasons Hotels and numerous residential projects, including the Central Park Tower in New York City, which is slated to be the tallest, most exclusive residential building in the U.S. when it is completed.

Her new furniture offerings incorporate Rottet’s penchant for luxurious materials, including glossy acrylic, fur, leather, marble, metal, rattan and fine wood veneer.

The Rattan Settee is a unique piece within the Rottet Collection. Inspired by vintage seating designs of the early 20th century, the settee features a cerused oak wood seat frame with classic rattan inserts and a minimal stainless steel base as well as a cowhide upholstered seat cushion. It is very durable, lightweight and a great addition to any space. Dimensions: 29.5"L x 60"W
x 31.5"H.

A Verellen essential, the Terrence Club Chair is bench-crafted in our North Carolina atelier with a sustainably harvested hardwood frame and 8-way hand-tied seat construction. It comes standard with a spring/ down seat cushion, boxed back pillows, split-flange toss, heavy double needle stitch detail, and metal legs. Upholstered only.

The Kickstand Lounge Chair is a lounge chair where upholstery sits atop powder coated metal bases. Each piece is accentuated with a deliberate solid brass bar detail, and a contrasting head rest. As with all of our existing collections, these pieces are made locally in Southern California.

The Lily Chair takes its cue from the sinuous form of the Lilypad. It features a continuous unbroken line that traces the exterior of the chair which encases a soft circular cushion much like the center of a blooming flower. The chair subtly converges from an open bloom at the top, to a perfect circle at the base.”

The Lily chair is available on a stationary base or a base with a self-returning swivel mechanism. Lily is a fully upholstered lounge chair that may be specified in Bernhardt Textiles leather and fabrics or the customer’s own material. Topstitching is employed around the perimeter to highlight the continuous loop of the chair’s design.

In keeping with the exceptional resources of Bernhardt Design, each design in the Terry Crews collection meet all BIFMA standards for use in contract spaces.

Lily is GREENGUARD certified. Bernhardt Design and Bernhardt Textiles is an EPA Climate Leading Partner, and facilities are certified and level audited. Made in the USA.

To suspend a solid slab of stone within the transparent planes of glass was the minimalist idea for the “how fragile this love” lounge chair that drove the design development of the whole project. While the use of stone represents strength and permanence it was important to retain the sense of delicateness and fragility of the overall look.
To create the appearance of a solid slab, a sheet of tempered glass was laminated between two layers of onyx marble and then capped on all sides with miter joints and hand polished. Any form of hardware or visible connection would detract from the simplicity. The stone is glued directly to the glass using a UV bond.
The end result is a chair that challenges our preconceived notions and expectations of what furniture should be. An object that surprises you with its unexpected comfort, with its unapparent strength; a piece that embraces tension to enhance and transform the commonplace into something meaningful.

This tête-à-tête is sure to be the centerpiece of any room. The unique angular base of this all-original design sets off the angular form vocabulary seen throughout. But don't let the hard angles fool you, sitting inside is like floating on a cloud. Starting with a solid maple and walnut frame of 6/4 and 8/4 wood, it features mortise and tenon joinery throughout. The deck is 8-way hand tied coil springs with a hand stitched horse hair edge. Padding throughout is horse hair and cotton. The seat and back cushions are 50/50 down envelopes with high density fire rated foam cores. Shown with walnut base in hand rubbed oil finish.

Elegant design doesn’t need to mean a lack of welcome. In Rowen, designer Brian Graham took inspiration from architecture and landscapes to create a graceful, inviting form that evokes a sense of beauty and peace without sacrificing warmth. People need environments that calm and inspire, and Rowen helps create those spaces. The thin, faceted legs create a sense of lightness and poise, while the softer shapes of the cushions provide comfort.

With the 2757 sectional sofa we wanted to address the modular and easily adaptable nature of both residential and office projects we see as a staple in contemporary design. The solid handmade stainless steel legs support a clean lined blind-tufted seat cushion. A walnut table with a touch-latch seamlessly integrated drawer caps one end, adding elegant contrast as well as storage and versatility. To A. Rudin this piece personifies modern living: clean lines, comfortable, highly detailed, and easily customizable.

Compound curves and luxurious finishes describe the J9 Lounge Chair. Inspired by inimitable taste maker Coco Chanel and 1930’s Paris, this eye-catching piece features the curved lines and camel suede often found in Chanel’s interiors. The Lounge Chair connects to the floor with four polished brass accents.
Product > seating: residential/lounge.product_name: Juniper by Eric Brand -J9 Lounge Chair

Product > seating: residential/lounge.description_html:
The fluffiest, comfiest “wow this IS soft” collection we’ve made. Neva’s effortless, minimal style will turn any room into a relaxing oasis thanks to its pouffy, dream-inducing feather fill. Finally—the coziness all afternoon-nappers and Netflix-snoozers have been searching for.

How It Is Made
Kiln-dried hardwood and plywood reinforcement forms an indestructible frame.
Frames are reinforced with corner blocking for increased stability.
Seam edges constructed using a seam-welting technique.
High-tenacity webbing and spring suspension system
Pillowy seat cushions built around highly resilient foam core and wrapped with 80% feather + down, 20% fiber blend.
Plush back cushions filled with 70% feather + down, 30% fiber blend.
Cushions secured to the seat frame using a hook and grommet system, which can be removed for cleaning and care.

Looking to Hollywood, which has entertained, engaged and inspired the world from the silver screen to the comfort of home since the 19th Century, McGuire Furniture sought to make big dreams a reality for the Spring 2017 collection with pieces steeped in glamour and refinement with an eye towards what’s ahead. McGuire’s designers used the core materials that have come to define the company over the past 70 years, along with the specialized craftsmanship that brings those materials to life in truly innovative ways. New shapes carved in rattan, bamboo seating, caning with a twist, brass bands, and shapely concrete make bold statements and create a cast of characters that are McGuire’s future.

The Haybine Sling Lounge is a distinguished, masculine shape that mirrors the quadratic shapes and strong characters found in baling raw, natural substances. The geometric Blonde Brass frame is complete with a rich, sturdy leather sling and attached head pillow. A character in its own right, the Haybine Sling Lounge provides luxurious comfort and gallant strength. Comes standard in solid Blonde Brass frame and leather sling, backrest
pillow, and arm covers available in Saddle, Rustic or Bison.

Building on a longstanding relationship between acclaimed designer Steven Volpe and McGuire Furniture, the brand's Fall 2016 collection included seating and occasional pieces by the San Francisco designer. Volpe, who grew up with the McGuire family and describes his designs as grounded in the original McGuire aesthetic, introduced bold products crafted using some of the brand’s signature materials and techniques including rattan, rawhide and caning.

Years in the making, the Rumchunder Lounge Chair by Steven Volpe made a dramatic debut. A web of angles create a multi-faceted figure high on style and comfort. Carved oak is enhanced by a cascading back of tightly woven herringbone caning, then topped with a plush seven channel back and seat inspired by pleats of fine Indian silk, as its namesake signifies. Each angle and curve exacting in technique, creates a form that carries interest from every perspective. At 43" tall, the Rumchunder Lounge is supportive, luxurious and crafted with care. Comes standard in Chestnut finish. Tight upholstery; COM or COL.

Pilot is an innovative swivel lounge chair that marries visual and material lightness with exceptional comfort. The cantilevered seat, which features a unique upholstery substructure for greater flexibility, appears to float in the air, giving the chair a refined silhouette and an essential, timeless appeal.

Drum Teen is a new version reduced in size for the acclaimed armchair designed by Mac Stopa for Cappellini introduced last year. Drum Teen is the newest addition to the collection, which already comprises the large Drum armchair, a modular table and modular pouf available in two different sizes. Stating a strong personality of its geometric lines, each piece in the collection can be used individually or combined in modular combinations of multiple shapes for various space configurations. In the living room, bedroom, study or home office, Drum Teen adjusts to the functionality and size of any residential space. Among the several upholstery available in the collection, the rock-and-roll colors such as turquoise, orange, yellow, lime, red, white, black and brown are a perfect fit for the Drum Teen armchair. Made in Italy.
Product > seating: residential/lounge.product_name: Drum Teen by Mac Stopa for Cappellini / Drum collection

Product > seating: residential/lounge.description_html:
GARDEN LAYERS, GAN’s first Outdoor Space, is an innovative proposal conceived by designer Patricia Urquiola that brings style and comfort to terraces, pools, beaches and other outdoor or indoor spaces. The result is an incredible integration of tones, textures and patterns, traditionally found in indoor products, designed to be used out in the open.

The inspiration for such idea came about when Patricia Urquiola travelled to India. There, she became captivated by the delicacy and harmony of Mughal architecture. Gardens, terraces and miniatures found their way into her restless imagination inspiring a new collection, which from the very first moment she wanted to be ambivalent, suitable for outdoor and indoor.

On sand, or lawns, carpeting over a deck or just bringing an element of comfort to low benches, GARDEN LAYERS adds an extra touch of well-being and refinement, inspired by the long Eastern tradition of lounging in open air spaces. The collection can be used for relaxation or sun bathing beside a pool, at the beach or at home. Also perfect to use under shade, GARDEN LAYERS is a space of relaxation, of conversation in porches or under pergolas, given its adaptability to warm environments as well as other more moderate climates. It is made with particularly resistant high-tech fabric and quick-dry foam fillings, so it doesn’t require any additional maintenance.

GARDEN LAYERS is based on a modular system that allows users to create infinite compositions according to the needs and the layout of their spaces. Rugs, mattresses, roll pillows and cushions, all available in different sizes and three colour groups, can be arranged in an infinite number of ways: extensive compositions or more intimate arrangements, rectangular or asymmetrical. The mattresses can be laid over one or more rugs, the cushions are supported on the roll pillows, in this way spaces can be constructed for the purpose of reclining and relaxing, to create socialising areas or define separate zones.

Patricia Urquiola’s imagination and her masterly creativity is illustrated in these warm and welcoming spaces. The collection is available in three colour options: Terracotta, Green and Blue.

The Katachi Collection is named for the Japanese concept that combines “kata,” meaning form, and “chi,” meaning magic. “Katachi is for lovers of craftsmanship. The meticulous construction yields graceful designs that are magical, ergonomic masterpieces," says Janice Feldman, JANUS et Cie founder and collection designer. Made from powder coated aluminum and hand woven JANUSfiber, Katachi features four new, variegated hues for an enchanting effect.
Crafted in solid walnut and a custom brass finish, our Caden Lounge Chair is sleek and stunning.

THE BOLD, TRANQUIL OKSEN™ MAKES A COMEBACK

Republic of Fritz Hansen™ is pleased to announce the relaunch of the distinctive Oksen™ lounge chair by Arne Jacobsen. Known for the organic, soft lines that characterise such iconic works as the Swan™ and the Ant™ chairs, Arne Jacobsen surprised design connoisseurs all over the world with his 1966 unveiling of the Oksen. Reflecting its name - which means 'the bull' in Danish - the Oksen was big, bold and powerful.
Product > seating: residential/lounge.product_name: Oksen Lounge Chair by Arne Jacobsen

Product > seating: residential/lounge.description_html: Casual elegance and inviting comfort: Healey Soft boasts the best characteristics of a modern lounge chair. The upholstery of the inner shell is subtly understated with neat drawn-in sections showing great precision and masterly craft. The armrest is plush and soft. Whether solo or paired with a sofa, for an informal get-together or cocktail party, for work or a moment of privacy in the office, this armchair will let you unplug and relax.

Bench-crafted in our North Carolina atelier with a sustainably harvested hardwood frame and 8-way hand-tied seat construction, the Clemence Sofa comes standard with tight seat and back, double needle stitch detail, detached arm pillows. Quilted detail available in leather, upholstered available only in fabric. Sits on glides.

Held by an exquisitely textured cast bronze frame, Tristan Auer’s Armora Lounge Chair is aesthetically balanced and gorgeously constructed. The seat construction includes a separate outside back panel, inviting creative fabric and leather combinations.

An armchair in the range of the same name, Domino Chair was conceived by the young Milan designers Nava + Nava Design Studio to coordinate with the Domino Sofas. Like the sofa, the armchair also combines design and function, brings together tradition and modernity and plays with soft, geometric lines to add greater movement to the seat. With fabric or leather covers, the armchair is ﬁnished with metal legs and upholstered with differentiated density polyurethane foam.

Product > seating: residential/side.description_html:
Looking to Hollywood, which has entertained, engaged and inspired the world from the silver screen to the comfort of home since the 19th Century, McGuire Furniture sought to make big dreams a reality for the Spring 2017 collection with pieces steeped in glamour and refinement with an eye towards what’s ahead. McGuire’s designers used the core materials that have come to define the company over the past 70 years, along with the specialized craftsmanship that brings those materials to life in truly innovative ways. New shapes carved in rattan, bamboo seating, caning with a twist, brass bands, and shapely concrete make bold statements and create a cast of characters that are McGuire’s future.

The Manau Nomad Chair pushes the boundaries of form and function, using McGuire's legacy material to create a timeless, yet timely piece that will stand out in any room. Named for the Indonesian word for rattan, the Nomad Chair's unique shape is emphasized by its herringbone caning and bold star-shaped base in Blonde Brass finish. The pronounced circular arm, wrapped in signature rawhide, evokes a classic mid-century modern aesthetic, which invites luxurious comfort and style into any home. Fully customizable in Type I-V finishes. Tight seat in COM/COL. Brass plated stainless steel base with Blonde Brass finish; 5 brass casters with rubber.

Designer Kim Tyler’s Chas Chair has turned the slipper chair into a sculptural and inspirational nod to mid-century design, with felted knitted wool fabric, that beckons one to stay seated and bask in the softness of natural fiber.

The colors of the fabric are bold and hot in hues; the design organic and fluid. The solid maple frame effortlessly suspends the upholstered seat; the back of the chair, an abstracted human form. The craftsmanship of Bespoke by Luigi Gentile brought forth the vision of Kim Tyler’s design.

The designer, the manufacturer, and textile mill are all located in the tri-state area supporting the Made in America movement. The chair can be made in other solid woods and adaptable in COM/COL creating different moods while never loosing the essence of the sculptural design or it’s inherent whimsy.

Dimensions: 24”w x 28”d x 32”h; seat height 17”.
Product > seating: residential/side.product_name: Chas Chair by Kim Tyler Designs

Product > seating: residential/side.description_html: The aluminum-framed Trig Armchair, named for the relationships of angles, lengths, and triangles explored in trigonometry, is available in four finish combinations offering a broad range of looks from subtle, earthy tones to zippy, seaside blue and white. Suitable for outdoor or indoor use, the seat and back of every piece are made from a strong yet soft mesh fabric sling. The armchairs stack in threes for easy storage in tight spaces.

SIXINCH presents a unique line of chairs and tables called Tauko. Designed by Mac Stopa, the Tauko collection is inspired by designs from the 1950s and 1960s. The collection is characterized by soft, aesthetically pleasing organic shapes and high-quality wooden elements.

The collection is characterized by soft, aesthetically pleasing organic shapes and high-quality wooden elements. The wide palette of finishes, including natural wood, laminate and range of upholsteries envelope color concepts that harmonize with the new color trends - making the Tauko Stool an ideal solution for residential spaces.

The stool has a unique seat that consists of two halves fastened together at the bottom, producing an interesting visual effect. Full seating comfort is ensured by the well-contoured line of the chair bucket. The Tauko Chair is well-suited for a variety of residential spaces, including the living room, dining room and home office.

The PK1 dining chair, designed by Poul Kjærholm in 1955, is an early example of Kjærholm's unique ability to combine steel with organic materials. The design has an understated look which requires expert craftsmanship and an in-depth understanding of the inherent nature of the materials.

Kjærholm's first dining chair, the PK1 marked the beginning of an impressive career. Despite its clean, minimal expression, the PK1 is a complex chair requiring highly skilled craftsmanship, not least in the weaving of the flag halyard. Kjærholm strove to create harmony between form and material, and sought to express the authenticity of materials and perfect crafting process.

Kjærholm's PK1 chair comprises a steel frame and a combined flag halyard seat and backrest, which ensures a high degree of comfort and visual lightness suited for a variety of interiors. Available in several different steel variants combined with natural or black flag halyard, the PK1 stack up to five chairs at a time, proving to be both versatile and practical.

The PK1 is also available as an outdoor version with a stainless steel frame and weather-resistant flag halyard.

Fyrn is a San Francisco company that believes in creating connections between people, places, and materials. With an obsession for perfection and a lot of love, we promise to continue the tradition of craft by making high-end objects more accessible and useful for people's everyday life. The Stemn Series is Fyrn's debut line and the foundation for a broader furniture system that aims to change the way people relate to and value the objects they choose for their homes, hopefully, inspiring a move away from disposable culture.

Stemn emphasizes the strength of metal and the warmth of wood. In designing the line and the manufacturing process Fyrn's founder, Ros Broughton, relied upon his family's rich history of craftsmanship and his own 25+ years of building and furniture making expertise to develop proprietary hardware and manufacturing equipment that would make production feasible and scalable in San Francisco.

The secret to the Stemn Series is courtesy of the sculptural Stemn bracket (patented and made by Fyrn). Sturdy, replaceable and uncomplicated, it is a truly beautiful piece of exposed hardware that enables strong, high-end furniture that can ship flat and assemble at home without sacrificing an iota of grace or durability. All chairs and stools are also available fully assembled and are customizable by the wood finish, bracket color, and upholstery making them versatile enough to fit a multitude of design environments.

Fyrn developed the entire Stemn package experience in-house, with a focus on making home assembly as intuitive and satisfying as the product itself. Talented San Francisco artists Mik Gaspay and Chris McNally created the art on the exterior and interior of the shipper boxes and screen printed many of the internal materials by hand. Fyrn's own design and engineering of the 3 packaging trays break the assembly experience into simple stages that allow for the elimination of an instruction pamphlet or booklet. The internal toolkit includes a phone stand constructed from scrap material salvaged during the Stemn production process, a "Fyrn tool" or torque wrench that clicks when each screw is properly tightened, and extra screws if needed. The toolkit is constructed to be retained and will fit nicely on a bookshelf if ever needed for future maintenance.

Stemn focuses on sustainable choices from design through delivery. Responsibly harvested lumber, minimizing transit, and using recyclable packaging is a given. But, Fyrn believes the most sustainable path is to produce a product that will last a lifetime. Durability combined with an easily repairable system is the true strength of Stemn and what will make these chairs and stools future heirlooms.

The CH23 dining chair was one of the first four chairs Hans J. Wegner designed specifically for Carl Hansen & Søn in 1950, heralding a long and fruitful collaboration between the two. An early example of Hans J. Wegner's unique style and insightful craftsmanship, the CH23 renders sophisticated, complex designs simple and elegant.

Despite the CH23's richness in unique detail, its appearance is ultimately light and simple. Wegner's superbly refined woodwork is evident in the cruciform cover caps, which he used to mark the junction between the form-pressed veneer backrest and the chair's frame. The chair has no armrests, which makes it practical for fitting around the table, even in small rooms. Thanks to its ingenious design and organic form, it is also unsurpassed for comfort: the shape of the elegant cover caps in the backrest, the special double-woven paper cord seat, and the arched shape of the rear legs ensure optimal stability.

The CH23 is made of solid oak or walnut, or a combination of these in a variety of finishes. The elegant cover caps on the backrest are available in either oak or walnut, and the special double-woven seat in either natural or black paper cord.

Product > seating: residential/sofa.description_html:
Curve Sofa: Upholstered sofa with tight back and loose non-reversible bench cushion on a plinth base. Comes standard with welt along the back, down the front arms, on the seat cushion, and at the seam details on the inside back. Available in all standard and premium maple finishes, a satin smoke stainless steel finish, or a brushed gold stainless steel finish

ALCHEMY – the philosophy and practice of purifying, maturing and perfecting elements – is the inspiration behind Donghia’s 2017 Furniture and Lighting Collection.
For more than 40 years, Donghia has been synonymous with visionary American design and exquisite craftsmanship. Designed in Manhattan and made from the world’s finest materials, the 2017 Alchemy collection advances Donghia’s legacy of urban, contemporary design, legendary comfort, grounded in old-world artistry.
Wood, metal and glass have been worked upon by hand, tradition and time. Imagination becomes reality and beauty takes functional shape as wood suggests movement, metal energizes line, glass appears liquid.
The sensuous lines of the Curve Sofa—constructed by hand of maple, steel, and down, wrapped by an antique satin stainless steel belt, welcomes you to sit and cradles when you do.
Through the power of ALCHEMY, the 2017 Donghia Furniture and Lighting collection seamlessly integrates materials and transforms it into artwork. We invite you to experience The Art of Donghia with the 2017 ALCHEMY Collection.

The Wood Float Sofa offers a solid wood frame with an acrylic back and upholstered seat cushions optional. It explores the marriage between structural walnut wood and clear acrylic plastic. With a floating back plane, the piece feels both light and grounded with its modern curving profile. Dimensions: 29"L X 84"W X 29"H; SH 15.25; SD 18.75" with cushions. There is also a Wood Float Chair.

"Using my understanding of the manufacturing process in metals, woods, glass and acrylic, I was able to fully detail the product for ease of construction and durability. Many of the commercial manufacturers will not work in acrylic and most who are familiar with acrylic do not know how to work in metals and wood to the high-end degree required by this product. I introduced the best manufacturers of each of the materials and helped them work through any concerns or issues. They now know not to be afraid of acrylic and how amazing it can be.

I have used acrylic for many years and can speak to its durability and strength. It is also innovative in the way it allows customization and fits into smaller spaces as well as a multitude of stylistic environments," said acclaimed interior architect Lauren Rottet.

No endangered wood species are used in the collection and there are no infill materials, such as substrates. All the finishes are integral with the composition of the product.

Collection Story
Bosley gets its symbolic character in large part from a smooth-running, wrap-around frame that traces the collection’s slick outline. The quality is unmistakable—sit down for even a moment and you’ll fall in love with the way your skin grazes the solid wood arms of this swanky and faithful tribute to the past.

How It Is Made
High-end, solid wood build with modern design lines.
Solid mahogany frame and legs finished in our vintage Cordovan finish.
Upholstered in durable 100% Olefin basketweave fabric.

Details & Dimensions
DIMENSIONS

Overall Dimensions: 33.5"H x 84"W x 31.5"D
Seat Cushion: 6"H x 25.75"W x 29"D
Interior Seating: 77.25"W x 19"D
Arm Height: 26.25"
Leg Height: 8.25"
Diagonal Clearance: 34"
Seats up to: 3
CUSHIONS

Cushion filling is 30% Feather Down / 70% Polyfiber wrapped around a foam core.
Foam Type: Polyethylene
Seats up to: 3

Refined and well-bred enough for the poshest of interiors, the Sunday Collection is designed to look good, but still be all about the comfort. A simple recessed leg eliminates distraction and lets the cozy cushions and thin frame levitate.

A linear component sofa and armchair with a clean, contemporary look. The light structure welcomes generously padded goosedown cushions bordered by thick relief stitching. The base in metal tubing is covered in leather or fabric, raised off the floor by metal feet. The soft armrest and back cushions slide over the structure, and are crossed by original lengthwise stitching that produces a gentle hollow on the surface (in fabric or leather): an interesting graphic sign that becomes the distinctive feature of the sofa. The horizontal stitching on the armrest and back cushions follows and accentuates the natural folds creating by the act of sitting.

Floe Insel emerged from Patricia Urquiola’s desire to create an unforgettable, versatile modular system, inspired by icebergs, whose sculptural, monolithic bulk floats weightlessly on water. A soft mass, made up of different geometries provided by a play of angles recalls formless blocks of ice. A family of dynamic elements which – through its generous volumes – evokes a classical element, comfort, deriving from in-depth research aimed at achieving the best possible balance between cushion thickness and softness; the careful study of the ratio between elastic belts and the inner gaps in the foam give the seat and backrest cushions the optimum flexibility, without sacrificing their asymmetrical features. The system comprises a three-seater sofa and a footrest, which can be used independently. The two end pieces and chaise longue, in two different sizes, can be combined together. Each of the modular elements has an original 25° asymmetrical cut, making it unique and different. The seat and backrest cushions have horizontal ribbed stitching that emphasise their shape. The backrest and armrest cushions are embellished with a padded trim that runs around the edges. Every element is equipped with a foot, which emerges where the backrest meets the armrest. There is also a series of optional cushions in two different sizes (40x50 cm and 50x60 cm) with down padding and upholstery with a special band whose padded trim matches the motif around the edges of the armrest and backrest cushions.

Cover 1 and Cover 2, designed by Marie Christine Dorner for Ligne Roset, utilize an automated sewing robot to create intricate stitching and tufting patterns. The upholstery freely floats atop an all-foam base. Cover 1 is a modern take on a chesterfield. Cover 2 offers a ‘lighter’ version with a very different geometric, more contemporary design. Lines intersect effortlessly to create squares, diamonds, and stripes. Both are available in sofa and loveseat styles.

Poltrona Frau's latest collaboration with the creative genius of Ludovica and Roberto Palomba. Released for Salone in April of 2017, the Let It Be Sectional Sofa is as comfortable as it is chic and practical.

REGATTA is sociable, comfortable and designed for smooth sailing.
Suitable for residential, hospitality and commercial applications alike.

REGATTA is Ted’s self-imposed design assignment to explore the core ideas of ‘the sectional’...bringing people together in comfort.
The resulting curvaceous forms of REGATTA come together to create infinite, scalable configurations. Most pieces are designed to be used individually but are best linked together into a flotilla of comfort.

Each of the thirteen pieces has a gentle arc along its back that aligns with others to create a grand embracing arc and a continuous flow of comfort at every turn. The winged backs align to form apertures while keeping the group open and dynamic from all perspectives.

The fluffiest, comfiest “wow this IS soft” sofa we’ve made. Neva’s effortless, minimal style will turn any room into a relaxing oasis thanks to its pouffy, dream-inducing feather fill. Finally—the coziness all afternoon-nappers and Netflix-snoozers have been searching for.

How It Is Made
Kiln-dried hardwood and plywood reinforcement forms an indestructible frame.
Frames are reinforced with corner blocking for increased stability.
Seam edges constructed using a seam-welting technique.
High-tenacity webbing and spring suspension system
Pillowy seat cushions built around highly resilient foam core and wrapped with 80% feather + down, 20% fiber blend.
Plush back cushions filled with 70% feather + down, 30% fiber blend.
Cushions secured to the seat frame using a hook and grommet system, which can be removed for cleaning and care.

Details & Dimensions
DIMENSIONS

Overall Dimensions: 34.5"H x 84"W x 41"D
Seat Height: 18.25"
Seat Depth: 26"
Arm Height: 25.25"
Leg Height: 1.5"
CONSTRUCTION

Frame Material: Rubberwood and P2 Plywood
Leg Material: Rubberwood
Suspension: Webbing and Sinuous Spring

Feather Down: Cushion filling is 70% Feather Down / 30% Polyfiber wrapped around a foam core
