Overshadow, by Enduratex, is the first entry in a revolutionary new category. Because Overshadow is a TPO fabric with a Polyurethane topskin, it has a lovely hand and is very easy to fabricate. It is further fortified by the proprietary topcoat, Produratect™C, ensuring it remains a top performer!
Overshadow meets strenuous requirements including Motor Vehicle Safety Standard 302, California Technical Bulletin 117-2013, Section 1, BIFMA Class A, UFAC Class 1 and NFPA 260, Class 1. All of that plus it will go 100,000 double rubs on the Wyzenbeek.

Featuring Caviar, Limousine and Faberge, the Putting On The Ritz Collection offers premium fabrics for upscale style in any hospitality setting. Uses include pillows, light furniture upholstery and luxurious window treatments. Dress your hospitality guestroom from top to bottom.

Drawing upon diverse textile techniques from around the world, the Stinson Studio combines them to spark something new -Fusion- a bold and complex collection of new performance fabrics that will make modern interiors dynamic.

Fusion brings together a diverse mix of product surfaces that designers crave for their interiors- oversized graphic taffeta, varying pattern scale, intricate details, cut pile plush velvet, aggressive boucle texture and lustrous metallics.

Fusion is at once both modern and timeless.

All patterns exceed 100,000 rubs – heavy duty

9 textiles / 85 colors

Leading the industry in material innovation, Concertex introduces a unified assortment of pioneering polyurethanes with the Modern Geometry collection. In a methodical rhythm of lines, intersections and dimensional angles, the collection interprets the fundamentals of geometry into uniquely modern textiles.

Created to coordinate, the collection includes two new silicone hybrids Axiom and Pascal. Axiom’s small-scale, abstract motif effortlessly balances Pascal’s large-scale plaid pattern. In addition, Quadrant – a three dimensional, metallic faux leather with graffiti free qualities – joins the assortment of strong, statement making designs. In a mod-interpretation of geometry, the innovative, stylish polyurethanes are created for the rigorous demands of the workplace.

Patterns Amaya and Tacana are a result of Pollack’s design collaboration with acclaimed London design firm A Rum Fellow, which promotes the vibrant hand-woven textile heritage of the Maya of Central America. The Pollack + A Rum Fellow collection celebrates these intricate geometric motifs and joyful colors, and imbues the fabrics with the durability and versatility—via Sunbrella® construction—that befits today’s lifestyle. Both patterns are made up of 73% Sunbrella solution-dyed acrylic and 27% Sunbrella solution-dyed polyester, and have a stain-resistant finish. Due to spun fill yarn, Sunbrella Contract fabrics have a soft hand while remaining bleach cleanable. Featuring exceptional UV performance and ultimate cleanability, the fabric is woven in the USA with Sunbrella solution-dyed fibers. All fabrics exceed ACT heavy-duty standards.

Product > textiles: outdoor.description_html:
Fortress Indoor/Outdoor product represents the ultimate in performance indoor/outdoor fabrics. This 100% solution-dyed acrylic offering has superior durability, wear-ability and clean-ability while maintaining an exceptionally soft hand. Manufactured in the USA, these fabrics are fade resistant, breathable and the perfect product to use in both indoor and outdoor spaces.

Fortress Indoor/Outdoor Performance characteristics give the fabric water and stain resistant properties while boasting extreme durability. These fabrics are easy to maintain and are bleach cleanable.

LINK’s 2017 fabric collection is highlighted by Morning Glory, a multi-dimensional stripe offered in seven vibrant colors. Along with ten additional fabric designs in dozens of color options, including Montauk Velvet, Serengeti Blue Steel and Tick Tack Sterling. Link Outdoor continues to lead the industry in luxury outdoor and performance fabrics.

Astor: Blurring the line between indoor and outdoor qualities, this design features new yarns which look and feel absolutely “indoor” yet – surprise! – are suitable for outdoor use as well. The festive dot pattern can be used in living rooms or poolside thanks to next-generation solution dyed acrylic. Chenille yarns are used to accentuate the motifs, while adding height and softness. Upholstery weight. 100% Solution Dyed Acrylic construction. In 9 colors.

Hinson’s collection for Fall 2017 takes inspiration from City Island, the charming waterside village located just minutes from Manhattan. Boats bob in the harbor as waves lap gently on the shore; all while visitors crowd the promenades, beach, shingled shops and restaurants. CITY ISLAND Collection combines coastal ease, urban sophistication and year-round style, as would suit the remarkable enclave which enjoys both marine and skyline views. Colorful weaves, captivating embroideries, and a single dramatic print readily mix and match; a signature of the Hinson brand. Outdoor product makes its debut, all of which has been carefully designed to look and feel soft and comfortable for performance/indoor usage as well. Taken all together, the collection offers a virtual day trip to this unique and beautiful spot. Designers are sure to delight in exploring CITY ISLAND Collection, just as New Yorkers have always enjoyed visiting the breezy haven for which it’s named.

Product > textiles: outdoor.company_name: Glen Raven Custom Fabrics and Thibaut
Product > textiles: outdoor.description_html:
Bring the outdoors in with Oasis, a collection of Thibaut’s coordinated Sunbrella® indoor/outdoor soft and luxurious fabrics. The high-performance fabrics in this vibrant collection are lightfast and stain resistant, offering long-lasting beauty and durability.

Boardwalk is a simple and dimensional nautical stripe, with an almost rope-like yarn and a woven textured ground.

Better than a basic plain, Lido is a textured chenille with a contemporary/retro vibe.

West Palm Woven is a densely woven natural palm leaf pattern that is big in scale and makes a bold statement. The ground is woven with a special bouclé yarn, updating this classic motif. The pattern is non-directional which makes it versatile anywhere.

Named for an exotic animal preserve, Shambala is an upbeat and playful take on a leopard pattern that is easy on the eyes. The mix of colorful weaves is softened by textures.

Soft and luxurious Talisman is an allover diamond pattern that can be used anywhere. It is simple enough for large upholstery and special enough for a dining room chair. The tone-on-tone chenille yarn gives this fabric a nice, supple hand.

Windsong is a multi-colored texture with a visible weave effect that offers just the right amount of interest and dimension. The heathered yarn is reminiscent of a handwoven raffia.

Inspired by our Danube Ikat wallpaper, Danube Ikat Stripe is a soft woven fabric that pairs nicely with other patterns in the Oasis collection. Vertical breaks in the ikat give it a handmade look.

Delray Diamond is a simple, large-scale 3-color pattern that emulates a dyed textile. The perfectly sized layout is ideal for pillows or cushions.

Linea Chevron is a mid-size chevron pattern which mixes varying shades of one color and white to give a softened graphic effect.

Trinidad makes use of a new Sunbrella yarn that is evocative of a natural fiber. The detailed concentric diamonds make for an especially beautiful interior upholstery fabric.

An impressionistic moire or woodgrain pattern, Soundwave has been softened to give the fabric that luxurious hand. Although it has a large repeat, it makes a subtle statement with its tone-on-tone coloring.

Like finding a treasure on a beach, Beachcomber is a simple chenille with a horizontal texture. This densely woven plain was designed for use on a whole outdoor setting or as a basecloth for interior sofas and sectionals.

Parquet is a graphic geometric that brings to mind decorative wooden floors or unique tiling patterns. Look closely and you will see this pattern creates a vertical stripe effect. This fabric has an interesting mix of raised bouclé yarn with a flat weave.

An addition to Thibaut’s other Sunbrella sheer offerings, Windswept is a simple variegated vertical stripe. It can be used inside or outside to soften light.

Fabrics in the Oasis collection can withstand intense light, so while they are great for poolsides and terraces, they can also be used in indoor spaces like sun-filled porches and window seats. Thibaut’s Sunbrella fabrics can be cleaned with all types of detergents, including bleach.
Product > textiles: outdoor.product_name: Sunbrella® Oasis Collection exclusive to Thibaut

Product > textiles: outdoor.description_html: This beautifully modulated ombré has been rendered in an abstract scale pattern that suggests a handsome fish swimming through clear water. Each of the textile’s seven colors captures the subtle beauty of a brook trout and shimmers in the light. The fabric is made of 100% solution dyed polyolefin and is fade, stain, UV, and mildew resistant. At 50,000 double rubs, this durable, woven fabric can be utilized for residential, hospitality or commercial applications indoors or out.

Architects and designers are looking for new ways to create built environments in harmony with nature's forces, and shade structures are increasingly beginning the design conversation rather than being an afterthought or accessory.

Jacquard shade fabrics Avenues and Cirrus emphasize the growing desire for shade that is equally matched in design and in performance.

Avenues is a Mondrian-inspired design featuring a large-scale color block. With a contemporary aesthetic, this asymmetrical block stripe is ideal for a modern home or commercial setting. Avenues is 54” wide and available in colors Daylight (neutral tones white, flax and gravel) and Midnight (darker tones black, blue and charcoal).

Named for the thin, wispy cloud formation, Cirrus portrays an allover cloud look. Multiple weaves give this fabric the illusion of layering or clouds floating. Suited for both traditional shade applications and more unique cabanas and other shade structures, Cirrus is 54” wide and available in colors Dove (cool gray tone) and Sand (warm linen tone).

Avenues and Cirrus utilize a traditional fabric construction, ideal for upscale, highly decorative applications. Because the color is embedded deep inside each and every fiber, both fabrics are easy to care for, fade proof, and bleach cleanable.

Silver State presents High Society, an exclusive collection of indoor/outdoor Sunbrella fabrics. Fresh patterns and colors distinguish it from all the mass market and retail looks we are flooded with. High Society will endure both stylistically and practically for years.
Product > textiles: outdoor.product_name: Silver State Fabrics High Society Collection

Product > textiles: outdoor.company_name: Glen Raven Custom Fabrics and Pindler
Product > textiles: outdoor.description_html:
The Seaside collection of Sunbrella® fabrics, by internationally acclaimed furniture and textile designer Richard Frinier, is named for the many iconic coastal resort destinations and locales around the world that served as inspiration for these distinctive and exceptionally executed performance textiles.

“As a native Southern Californian, I have lived in and around a coastal region my entire life and am naturally drawn to seaside destinations and lifestyles,” Frinier said. “There is an inherent allure to seaside cities and resort villages that compels us to come closer and linger, leaving a lasting mark on our memories and spirits long after we have returned home.”

The Seaside Collection is comprised of: two base cloths – Stonebrook and Bayshore; two stripes – Coastview and Fairharbor; and, three patterns – Palma, Freeport and Southpoint.

Stonebrook is a lightweight, textured plain weave made from ratiné yarns with the appearance of beach sand. Bayshore is a box weave construction woven on a common warp allowing for a beautiful range of coastal hues.

Coastview is woven using the Stonebrook construction, illustrating a classic and spirited espadrille stripe. Fairharbor is a cabana stripe in soft, sun-washed pastels which complements the Bayshore construction.

Palma is a banana leaf pattern on a jacquard construction inspired by the botanical gardens and landscapes of seaside retreats. Freeport is a woven jacquard with an oversized, open basketweave pattern enhanced by a slightly distressed and hand-woven appearance. Southpoint, with its softly distressed jacquard diamond pattern, evokes imagery of more nostalgic and classic seaside resort architecture in a stylized reference to decorative tiles.

The Seaside collection by Richard Frinier for Sunbrella is available exclusively through Pindler.
Product > textiles: outdoor.product_name: Seaside from the Richard Frinier Collection for Sunbrella® exclusive to Pindler

Product > textiles: outdoor.description_html: GREAT OUTDOORS plays with pattern, scale, and a daring assortment of opposites in black and white. Fresh and fashion-forward.

The crisp clean tailoring of Savile Row meets 100% solution dyed acrylic. Stain resistant, fade resistant & bleach cleanable. Perfect for OUTDOOR or INDOOR applications. Bart Halpern signature pleating takes it to the next level with the abstraction of the fine tailored lines.

Moroccan Rose is an uber-sophisticated interpretation of a textile that could be found in a souk or market in Marrakech. It is a delicate ethnic textile design featuring rich hues of Moroccan spices, the Mediterranean Sea and North African sky. Rich, raised, saturated colors are woven atop earthy ground colors in a finely designed pattern fashioned after the natural bounty and found objects associated with Africanate tribal cultures. Your projects will enjoy years of worry-free performance with Nomi’s durable, UV and stain resistant, bleach- cleanable, anti-microbial textiles. Available through to-the-trade showrooms and directly through Nomi’s design studio in Northern California.

Colors: Indigo, Coral, Celadon
Width: 54” Repeat: 7”V 7”H
100% Solution Dyed Polyolefin
Passes: NFPA#260 / CA#117
Abrasion: 70,000

Representing innovation, precision and heritage, the new Sunbrella® Makers Collection by Glen Raven Custom Fabrics is centered around the principles shared between time-honored handweaving and modern manufacturing, bringing the character of traditional artisan techniques to the industry. The collection tells the story of what lies beneath the product to connect consumers to the fabric, from the yarn to the finished piece.

Fabrics in Makers incorporate the performance qualities of Sunbrella with authentic designs tied to generations of makers. The collection portrays the importance of preserving the conventional element of craft while advancing technologically. By combining new, experimental techniques with traditional style, the artisan fabrics are perfectly suited for both indoor and outdoor upholstery.

Exemplifying Sunbrella design innovation and technological advancements, jacquard pattern Adaption juxtaposes matte and shiny with PVC yarn. The pattern is reminiscent of hand-forged metal designs with a simple geometric pattern in tonal colors.

Midori is inspired by traditional Japanese Shibori dyeing. A process which involves folding, twisting or bunching fabric, binding it and then dyeing it, Shibori dyeing creates one-of-a-kind pieces, in which no pattern is the same. The Sunbrella design team recreated this look with modern weaving equipment, making the fabric look more primitive and handmade, while preserving Sunbrellla’s legendary performance.

A traditional menswear-inspired pattern, Paradigm pairs well with the contemporary patterns throughout the collection. Makers nurtures an inclusive community of makers, challenging them to create extraordinary spaces with the fabrics.

In addition to jacquard patterns, the collection adds new stripes and expands colorways for some of the company’s most trusted solids. A standout among the new stripe patterns is Artistry. Inspired by Mayan backstrap weaving, this fabric represents the custom woven pattern of vintage textiles. A new texture, Blend, is made of a heavier yarn for a soft, textured hand in a wide range of colors.

With dedication to the smallest details, the collection is rooted in a deep connection to a community of makers, like those on the Sunbrella design team. With a combined 145 years of experience in textile design, these makers live and breathe design. They collect inspiration from many different sources including travel, personal experiences, art and other forms of craft, weaving these inspirations into their textile designs.

The Makers Collection of Sunbrella fabrics is currently available to the manufacturing trade and will be at retail this fall. Like all Sunbrella fabrics, the textiles in Makers are easy to care for, fade proof and bleach cleanable.

Alaxi is proud to submit our newest Sunbrella for the 2017 Best Of Year. Using new methods to mélange colors RA has the dry look and feel of cotton or linen. Newport has a rich sophistication and plush texture accents that Alaxi is known for as a stand out for Sunbrella fabrics.

The Arc-Com Design Studio channels the spirit of two of the world’s most beautiful islands to create patterns Bali and Fiji.

Engineered using Sunbrella solution-dyed fibers, both patterns were designed specifically for indoor and outdoor use.
The twelve colorways that are offered for pattern Bali utilize a common sand colored ground that anchors both bold and bright accents as well as sophisticated colored neutrals.
Pattern Fiji is a simple textured plain that supports the gorgeous color story found in pattern Bali. The twenty-four colorways coordinate directly with the accent colors found in pattern Bali.
Both patterns are Greenguard Gold certified for indoor air quality and FACTs Silver certified.
Bali’s turquoise and green waters, soft pink sands, dark volcanic mountains, and dramatic fiery sunsets inspired the dynamic color combinations found in pattern Bali’s simple intertwined geometry. The twelve colorways that are offered for pattern Bali utilize a common sand colored ground that anchors both bold and bright accents as well as sophisticated colored neutrals.

Pattern Fiji is a simple textured plain that supports the gorgeous color story found in pattern Bali. The twenty four colorways offered in pattern Fiji coordinate directly with the different accent colors found in pattern Bali. Pattern Fiji will also act as a versatile coordinate plain as Arc-Com continues to add patterns to this important product category.

Both patterns Bali and Fiji are manufactured using Sunbrella solution dyed fibers. The performance feature that sets Sunbrella fibers apart from regular polyesters or acrylics and makes them appropriate for outdoor use is their incredible lightfastness rating.

Both patterns Bali and Fiji are Greengaurd Gold certified for indoor air quality.
These patterns are also FACTs Silver certified. FACTs is a multi-attribute environmental standard that takes into consideration not only the products composition but how it is manufactured as well.

Some of the additional attributes that are assessed include fiber sourcing, safety of materials, water conservation, water quality, energy usage, air quality, recycling practices and social accountability. Products that are FACTs certified conform to the rigors of the NSF/ANSI 336 standard and are third party certified. A FACTs sustainability rating means that the product has been evaluated for environmental, economic and social aspects across its life cycle.
Environmentally sound, performance driven and aesthetically superior, patterns Bali and Fiji will undoubtedly be used to beautify spaces both inside and out!

Product > textiles: residential.description_html: The Namaste Collection was created to be soft in touch and color, inspired by the quiet beauty of nature our and our connection to it through the practice of yoga and to encourage a sense of calm and balance through interior designs. This collection is offered in four qualities of leather, Prana; a natural grain cowhide that has very light and subtle matte finish which highlights the smooth grain, Shanti; a soft and subtle pearlescent finish that highlights the smooth, natural grain of this selected hide, Karma; an embossed pattern, Mini Cobble, highlighted by a soft and subtle pearlescent effect, and Raja; an embossed imprint of a fluid and continuous wave pattern, Geowave, highlighted by a soft and subtle pearlescent effect. All products are available in 8 relaxing and calming colors that each have exceptional durability and cutting yield. Available in custom colors and patterns that all meet industry standards, with lead times of only four weeks.

Brook Perdigon's new textile collection, NEW LANDS, celebrates the voyage of the creative traveler. With 5 new designs in a myriad of color ways, the grouping is striking, fresh, and eye catching.

The NEW LANDS Collection is available in showrooms across the United States, Australia, and Canada. The collection was released in May 2017 and to date has been featured in The World of Interiors, The New York Times, House and Home, LA Home, Beach Magazine and Modern Luxury.

Each print is adapted from Perdigon’s own original artwork whether it is block prints, paintings, or travel sketches. With inspirations ranging from Indian miniature paintings to African Kente cloths, the global influence is apparent.

An adamant supporter of the age old craft of silk screen, Perdigon works closely with a team of skilled artisans who hand screen the production of each textile. All designs are printed on luxurious Belgian linen in Los Angeles, California. The textiles are suitable for drapery, upholstery, and soft furnishings for residential design applications.

Perennials has a new collection in collaboration with renowned designer Martyn Lawrence Bullard. Just in time for fall, the new collection of 29 bold fabrics boasts striking patterns and vibrant colors. Martyn Lawrence Bullard for Perennials® introduces eight new designs, inspired by Martyn's worldly design aesthetic. Featuring rich reds, vintage blues, tea-stained tans and nuanced greys, the collection debuts four new colorways: Red Dawn, Spring Fling, Black & Tan and Madder.

As a consummate designer and tastemaker, Martyn has been widely acclaimed for his trademark glamour and flair for the exotic when curating sophisticated and inviting interiors. The collection blends ethnic moments with Martyn's contemporary point of view. Think Palm Springs mid-century vibe with African and Indian influences. Martyn’s impressive mastery of a broad range of styles, paired with his unrivaled attention to detail and quality, makes him the perfect collaborator for Perennials.

Martyn Lawrence Bullard for Perennials® seamlessly mixes mosaic-inspired patterns with classic textured elements. With a handwoven feel, Sultan Swing is a nod to traditional ikat textiles, perfect for indoor and outdoor upholstery; available in four colorways. With its woven stitched detailing, Bedouin Stripe simulates authentic pieced textiles; available in five colorways. Harem Shuffle draws inspiration from ikat techniques, typical of hand-made artisanal textiles; available in four colorways. Old-world nuances are apparent in Market Paisley, a structured arrangement of a traditional paisley motif; available in three colorways.

Star Power and Jali add versatility to the collection with their reversible constructions. Reminiscent of Eastern architectural accents, the lattice-inspired Jali adds structure to any environment; available in three colorways. Inspired by a traditional tile pattern, Star Power adds dimension with its heavily textured ruggedness; available in three colorways. The variegated color blending of Souk Stripe evokes the aged, well-loved appeal of a vintage textile; available in three colorways. Tribal Trellis conjures up the image of ancient mosaic walls with crumbling grout lines; available in four colorways.

Woven from fine 100% solution-dyed acrylic yarn, these fade-, mildew- and UV-resistant fabrics not only survive, but thrive in life's everyday environments. All Perennials fabrics are independently tested and certified in accordance with industry standards, including resistance to soil, water, UV radiation, tearing and abrasion. Perfectly suited for both indoor and outdoor environments, Perennials fabrics are also bleach cleanable and easily maintained. All of the fabrics in this collection feature Perennials' Nano Seal™ finish as well, which provides long-lasting protection even after repeated washings.

Majestic and magnificent, Pandora's sophisticated arrangement of color and pattern is as powerful as its mythical namesake. This densely woven, cotton velvet has a remarkable construction, featuring alternating stripes of color that shift in a rhythm of cut and uncut loops. Contemporary with a retro flair, Pandora's six color combinations include a multicolored array of artistic potential with colorways such as Phoenix, Griffin and Minotaur.

A 50" upholstery pattern with a large-scale (8-1/8" vertical and 12-1/2" horizontal) repeat and an abrasion resistance of over 75,000 double rubs (Wyzenbeek, Cotton Duck), Pandora offers residential luxury with contract level durability.

If you’ve slept in a hotel recently, chances are you’ve slept in our super soft bedding and have experienced first-hand just how comfortable our beyond organic duvet covers and pillow shams are. Our bedding is woven from botanical eucalyptus fibers harvested in FSC managed forests and have amazing hypoallergenic qualities for sensitive skin – no fabric softener required!
Originally designed for hotels and spas, our luxury duvets and shams are designed to get softer with every wash, naturally keep you cool, and reduce allergens like dustmites. Made with the silky soft eucalyptus fiber, Tencel+Plus™, Living Fresh duvets and shams are FKT tested and 100% toxic free. The duvets and shams are also beyond organic, carrying the highest designation within the USDA Biobased certification program for a product; a green certification you can understand and trust. The eucalyptus fiber provides natural medicinal and soothing qualities for a cleaner, healthier sleep experience – basically a natural sleep aid.
Duvet covers and pillow shams are more than just complimentary bed décor; they’re an extra layer of comfort, health, and hygiene, offering more natural benefits than any other brand for a healthier sleep.

Manuel, an exquisite Indian embroidered geometric, is named for one of our industry’s most colorful figures, Mr. Canovas. Embroidered on a cotton/linen ground, Manuel is a strikingly bold pattern, generously sized and rendered in four timeless colors.

Perennials has introduced a completely new breed of Perennials Luxury Performance Rugs. The new Drop Stitch construction combines the subtle blends of flatwovens with a low hand-knotted pile for a unique, textural experience, appearing in new Maze Craze, Off the Grid, and Smoke Screen. Three new Flatwoven patterns, inspired by the geometrics of classic Scandinavian designs, are Kaleidoscope, Pinwheel and Hopscotch.

As with all Perennials Luxury Performance Rugs, the Fall 2017 collection is handwoven with Perennials 100% solution-dyed acrylic so every dog can have his day without worrying about stains, mildew or fading.

Woven from fine 100% solution-dyed acrylic yarn, these fade-, mildew- and UV-resistant fabrics and rugs are able to brilliantly stand up to life's everyday adventures without sacrificing great design, making them uniquely suited to fit beautifully with any indoor or outdoor aesthetic. They are also bleach cleanable and easily maintained. Perennials fabrics are finished with Perennials' Nano Seal™ for extra protection against the elements. More than just a coating, Perennials' Nano Seal™ is molecularly bonded with the fibers providing long-lasting protection even after repeated washings. All Perennials fabrics are independently tested and certified in accordance with industry standards, measuring resistance to UV radiation, tearing and abrasion.

A passionate designer and traveler, Jiun Ho is spiritually and artistically inspired by the world’s incredible diversity of landscapes and cultures. Jiun Ho Textile captures the beauty of global terrains and peoples. Many of the designs are deft adaptations from the designer’s own photography.

This initial launch of the collection, titled Salar, numbers twenty unique designs and 132 SKU—many colors in each pattern. The first spark of inspiration for them arose during Jiun Ho’s travels in South America, specifically to the salt flats and deserts of Bolivia, Ecuador, Peru, and Chile, with their strikingly colored red lakes, flamingos, skies, and pampas.

The materials range from linen to cotton, velvet, chenille, and satin, using fibers of the highest quality, and can be used in a variety of applications, from window treatments to furniture upholstery. In the manufacturing, Jiun Ho is closely collaborating with leading mills in Italy and beyond.

The collection will soon grow to encompass many more unique designs, grouped into families based on the geographical region of their inspiration. It will include hundreds of distinct colorways, including many different neutrals, allowing for innumerable color combinations.

Paradiso is an ikat-inspired sumptuous, velvety fabric. The archetypal pattern has been stepped up a notch, utilizing saturated yarns in carefully calibrated hues. The result is a spectacular pattern that will make a statement wherever it is used. The fabric is made of 100% solution dyed polyolefin and is fade, stain, UV, and mildew resistant. At 50,000 double rubs, this durable, woven fabric can be utilized for residential, hospitality or commercial applications indoors or out.

Oberon is an exquisite collection of passementerie woven with the finest metal yarns. The collection houses a compendium of unique, documentary-inspired patterns and a series of 21st century designs employing innovative appliqué, velvet and hand-knotting techniques.

Oberon honors the aesthetic of traditional grandeur in the fine detailing of its borders, intricate gimp, various beaded fringes and tassel tiebacks. Offered in six hues of metal, the collection is composed of a 1.25” Oberon Beaded Fringe, a 2” Oberon Teardrop Beaded Fringe and an elaborate 4” Triple Beaded Fringe. In addition to the Oberon 2” Tassel Fringe, there are 4.75” and 8.25” Bullion Fringes. Complementing the fringes are both woven and twisted cords which transcend time and are suitable in both traditional and contemporary applications.

The Oberon Crete is an open weave created through a series of concentric circles of guiperes, while the Oberon Braid’s small cords form a geometric ogee pattern that glides across its finely woven ribbed ground. An intricate ½” Oberon Gimp and a lush 1” Oberon Brush Fringe complete this assortment.

The Oberon Double Tassel Tieback and Key Tassel have sleek bullion skirts and finely wrapped tapered molds with an overlay of hand-tied netting that have been loomed with the finest denier metal yarns. A complementary Oberon Rosette completes this ensemble. Among the signature pieces in the collection is the Oberon Double Quilles Tieback which features an ornate series of round and tapered molds with overlays of finely knotted netting.

The pattern of hand-tied satin knots in the Constellation Border is derived from an abstraction of star positions in the night sky. The Mercury and Eclipse Borders, though minimalist in character, have surfaces that appear to have been gilded in silver and gold. The Luna Border employs a sumptuous texture in its dense cut pile velvet which is then enhanced with fine metallic embroidery. The Solar Border is an abstract hand-blocked print with embroidered metallic silhouettes. The extraordinarily sculptural character of the Orbit Border is created through a series of laser cut, matte metallic oval foils with hollowed centers that are appliquéd to a finely woven twill border. The ovals create the illusion of something otherworldly as they seem to hover effortlessly above the border’s surface. Saturn’s rings are portrayed in its namesake Saturn Striped Border as individually-spun metal cords stripe across its ground.

The Oberon Collection exudes luxury in the realm of traditional grandeur and exquisite detailing while at the same time using the minimalist simplicity of fine metal thread to articulate the most innovative contemporary borders. The ethereal natural of the materials used in this collection and versatility in interpretation make this an exquisite part of any designer’s library.

In 1955, American visionary, Frank Lloyd Wright created a line of fabrics for Schumacher that took the world by storm. Today, we are bringing back many of the beloved original patterns as well as some new ones based on Mr. Wright’s sketches and drawings, in collaboration with The Frank Lloyd Wright Foundation. Perfect for modern spaces and still as exciting as they were when they were launched, they are available in various color stories so they can easily be used together. Applied Architecture, as it is aptly called, is a testament to the genius of Frank Lloyd Wright.

The Studio Collection designed by Richard Frinier in collaboration with Sunbrella® presents a refined yet approachable mix of graphic grid and linear patterns across uniquely layered textures. Architectural in structure with a soft hand, luxurious chenille yarns are woven into the mix creating a reflection of light and depth of texture seen only in the most compelling of textile designs.

Space, Studio, Urban, Graphic, City and Cityscape make up the collection to suggest easy-to-style textile design solutions that are subtly infused with the open, light-filled and balanced characteristics that draw us to modern urban living spaces. Use individually or as correlates to create experiential design that embraces the complex network that links all people and places together.

Sunbrella textiles minimize their environmental impacts based on solid and forward thinking business and sustainability practices, including: reduction in energy, water, material and waste consumption and further reduces waste through its unique take back program, Recycle My Sunbrella. They are Greenguard status and Greenguard Gold Certified. Superior performance textiles uniquely for interior and exterior residential projects. High-performance characteristics. UV- and fade resistant. Mold and mildew resistant.
Product > textiles: residential.product_name: Studio Collection from the Richard Frinier Collection for Sunbrella

Product > textiles: residential.description_html: We took the most luxurious fabric in the world and made it livable. Our silk velvet is supple, luminous, and water and stain resistant. It's another first for Schumacher and it's available nowhere else. We bring you luxury without limitations!

OVAL- 100% cotton Jacquard Duvet Covers & Shams a soft geometric 4 color weave.
This design is loosely inspired of Art Deco and works of Wiener Werkstätte.
Original made of pencil & watercolor sketches aiming for something both bold and quiet.
Its made in Portugal and was introduced in NY in August.

Escape to a dark and dreamy forest, where new colors such as Hunt Green, Earl Grey, and New Blue, intertwine with neutral HOLLY HUNT staples. These rich tones evoke a moody and romantic aesthetic with a range of diverse textures from nubby linens to flowing sheers. Welcoming digitally printed and silk screened velvets, while expanding upon popular categories such as double-wide sheers, embroideries, and best-selling leathers.

RANGER


From the grassy hillsides in Western Europe, an idyllic life lived. Ranger reminds us of when we first fell for leather. A material that is both rugged and refined; one that not only stands the test of time but responds to it.

With Ranger, life becomes art.

It is a full grain leather finished with only aniline dyes and wax. Tumbling the hides burnishes the natural grain structure, which provides great depth to the twelve standard colors, highlighting the true nature of the leather.

12 colors, aniline dyed, European bull hides, full grain, 1.3 - 1.5mm in thickness, 55 to 60 sq. ft. Avg., Greenguard certified.

Born from the idea of bringing two heritage brands together, the Pendleton by Sunbrella® collection combines Pendleton Woolen Mills’ distinct Native American-inspired aesthetic and the enduring performance qualities of Sunbrella fabrics –easy care, fade proof, and bleach cleanable.

The Pendleton brand is deeply rooted in American heritage and is synonymous with quality and craftsmanship. Those qualities are also at the core of the Sunbrella brand as a pioneer and leader in the textile industry.

The collection is comprised of 53 fabrics and is grounded by five hero patterns: Lahaina Wave, Eagle Rock, Canyon Lands, Zapotec and Mountain Majesty. The hero patterns are supported by a range of textural solids and coordinating patterns.

Lahaina Wave combines traditional tribal-influenced designs from the Hawaiian mainland with blue and turquoise representing the waves of the beaches near Lahaina, Maui. Outlined in a sawtooth design, the pattern evokes the power and challenges of the surf.

Named after a mountain summit in Apache County, Arizona, Eagle Rock incorporates Native American design elements and weaving traditions of the Southwest. The pattern features a defined center element highlighted against a solid background and reflected side motifs on a striped ground, exhibiting an artful sense of movement.

Inspired by Utah’s tall pinnacles of rock that form breathtaking vistas along the skyline, Canyon Lands uses a modern ombré weave to create rich layers that mimic the movement of sunlight dancing across the canyons.

Zapotec gets its name from the Zapotec Indians of Oaxaca, Mexico, who established a tradition of weaving colorful cloths using natural dyes from plants and animals. The pattern features classic geometric designs and elegant simplicity.

Symbols derived from Navajo Native Americans are complemented by quiet colors that evoke the evening light in Mountain Majesty. The pattern symbolizes the mountains of the western landscape and their significance to the Navajo tribe.

The collection – whose story unfolds across the plains of American history – is available to the trade through Pindler.

“Partnering with both Pendleton and Sunbrella is a designer’s dream,” said Elise Connor, director of design for Pindler. “We are very excited to present this collection to the design trade which combines two major design trends, the iconic designs from our American heritage and performance fabrics, both in high demand within the marketplace.”

Manhattan Muse: Flowing ribbons of paint have been captured and re-imagined in this artful and show-stopping embroidery. Appearing at first glance like brushstrokes on canvas, inspection reveals a complex rendering composed entirely of colorful yarns. Glowing viscose and matte polyester work together to keep the eye moving along each gestural, abstract motif. 100% linen ground. In 6 colorways.

Donghia captures the essence of New York City in its 2017 collection, MANHATTAN MUSE. Visionary designs, expressed through embroidered, woven, printed and hand-painted goods evoke the world’s great city of dreams. The nearly 200 offerings convey the energy, art, drama, music and unique lifestyles of this iconic locale; birthplace of the Donghia brand. With a focus on penthouse living, the collection takes inspiration from these dramatic urban homes at the top of the world. Skyline views, modern art, metals, stone, glass, glamorous parties, clothes and jewels have all inspired the featured palette, patterns and materials. “Manhattan Muse,” the collection’s signature statement design, looks like swirling ribbons of paint on canvas, artwork from a downtown gallery. In reality, it is an embroidered masterpiece. Taken all together, the collection’s myriad offerings and diverse range of qualities enable the designer to create the sophisticated, dazzling, yet livable “penthouse look” – in any space.

Kamakura Collection, customizable laser cut metal wall coverings or architectural panels, is offered in two harmonizing patterns.

Named for the seaside Japanese city famed for its serene lotus ponds, “Kamakura” captures the fluidity of waterborne lotus leaves.

Available in a broad range of metals, finishes and powder-coat colors. With options for customizing dimensions, repeat scale and palette, the gently floating aquatic leaves can add warmth and tranquility to any space, from home to spa, healthcare, hotel, office, restaurant or public area. Finish may be customized as well for outdoor use.

Gradient and Grade, by Source One Exclusive is a type II contemporary design combined with an architectural flair. It’s large-scale ombré effect is the perfect digital alternative in a standard 54” vinyl wallcovering. Create your own custom look by choosing from the 5 Gradient ombré colorways and their 10 Grade coordinating colors. Simply put, Gradient and Grade can be specified to be installed reverse hang, non-reverse hang or railroaded for endless desired effects.

The innovative and unusual wallpaper collection by architect and designer Mac Stopa for German wallpaper producer A.S. Creation Tapeten proves that geometry is anything but bleak. The ecstatic graphic decorations in pink, pastel green, orange and intense turquoise are the result of Mac Stopa’s interest in mathematics and geometric shapes – and perfectly express his “Think bold” motto. Futuristic and powerful contrasts as well as vibrant neon colors attract everyone’s attention. The honeycomb, mesh, and bubble patterns in 3-D optics set walls in motion. Boredom was yesterday. These wallpapers bring new energy and make a strong statement in every room. Made in Germany. Distributed in the USA by Sancar Wallcoverings.

Luxe Surfaces's and Patty Madden Digital Wallcovering have created a product that takes walls to an entirely new level. Through creativity, abstraction, and material exploration Astek's in-house design team used far ranging media such as paint, collage, sculpture, print-making, and photography to bring their ideas to life.

Without a frame, a³ CeramicSteel Sans features streamline and sealed precision-cut edges that serve as a point of collaboration and as an architectural application in a range of workplace and educational environments. Combined with the highest quality of porcelain and steel and a ceramic-glass finish, a³ CeramicSteel Sans is the optimal choice as an enduring writing surface, delivering a clean aesthetic and high durability year after year.

Unlike other wall coverings and writing surfaces, the natural strength of the porcelain and ceramic-glass in this product improves and sustains the overall functionality and durability. a³ CeramicSteel Sans is easy to clean, leaving the smooth, inert surface with no stains or marker residue. The product is colorfast and resistant to scratches, bacteria, chemicals and fire, no matter how demanding the environment. With such unique features, the a³ CeramicSteel Sans is the best choice for teaching, learning and collaborating.

Whether in a hospital, classroom or corporate setting, a³ CeramicSteel Sans enhances any demanding space with a sophisticated and sleek touch. Simple installation with concealed mounting offers a smooth finish in any environment. With superior digital imaging technology exclusive to PolyVision, masterful images, logos or designs can be added to the surface in addition to the four standard color options.

a³ CeramicSteel Sans is also environmentally-friendly. As a surface that is 99.9% recyclable and made from inorganic materials, this product is safe to use for all applications. Striving for optimal environmental stewardship, the CeramicSteel material is Cradle to Cradle Certified™ Bronze level certified, the only surface in the market that has achieved this global recognition. Additionally, the CeramicSteel material is certified by SCS Global Services as Indoor Advantage Gold™ , which is the global standard for products that support a healthy indoor environment.

All in all, a³ CeramicSteel Sans is the exceptional choice for any space as it is unmatched in all areas of durability, aesthetic and functionality.

Like weathered wood or stained concrete, Versa Wallcovering’s Alley Cat has time-worn, artisanal appeal. Visually striking variegated, irregular brush strokes add movement and dimensionality to the wall. Ten inventive color palettes project industrial chic, weathered nature and rhythmic watercolor effects. Go subtle with tone-on-tone stone-washed combos, conjure urban attitude with lustrous metallic like Greyfitti, or go hip and bold with gold and black Mylars and funky fusions of fuchsia and silver. Low-VOC Alley Cat is made of Type II vinyl and is certified to NSF 342. Visit www.versawallcovering.com or contact Versa, 2301 River Road, Suite 201, Louisville, KY 40206, (502) 458-1502.

Projectable Mag-Rite®
Walltalkers - Dry-Erase Wallcovering
Brainstorm, design, collaborate, create: Mag-Rite surfaces make it OK to express your design vision. The first product of its kind in the Walltalkers dry-erase family of brainstorming and collaboration surfaces, the new projectable Mag-Rite (M2PR) from Koroseal gives you three choices for sharing your ideas and surface-scaping your vision. If you can imagine it, a Mag-Rite surface is the simplest way to express it. In a classroom, a conference room, a workplace, an athletic facility, around a column, or wherever else you can imagine it, Mag-Rite makes it OK to express yourself—from floor to ceiling.

Movement and expressionism turn walls into canvases. A vibrant take on watercolor brushstrokes, BLUR leaves an impression with the look of abstract art. Our digital printing process allows for millions of hues to be captured in each stroke for hyper-detailing where artistry meets innovation. Available in 7 multi-tonal colorations, BLUR is a modern day masterpiece.

Spire
Type II, 54” wallcovering

Level is one of the 4 Walls Ltd brands and the entire collection was launched into the market-place in June of 2017. You are only seeing 3 designs of the 24 designs released in the collection. The collection consists of "Exclusive Designs" that are Rights-Ready and fully customizable with Scale, Color and Substrate. The "String Theory" showcases how we can utilize ink to print actual texture. Clients have stated that the "String Theory" design gives them the sense that they are touching an actual Copper Patina. With our R&D department hard at work, we expect many other new techniques that we'll launch to take our industry to a whole new "Level". (No pun intended)

Watercolor’s hyperfocus on brushstrokes, on the process of making art and the fluidity of materials, channels the waterfall paintings of Pat Steir. Like the contemporary artist, Innovations’ 52-inch Watercolor wallcovering explores the vertical movement of water and paint in eight colors inspired by spring, from a viridescent pastel to rich Raw Umber. A tremendous amount of color, digitally rendered, goes into each large-scale piece.

They express, without speech. They attract touch, without feeling. They provide experience, without movement. Walls are one of the largest elements of an interior. Inpro introduces a way to give them purpose and expand their longevity with Ricochet™ Flexible Wall Protection, wall protection that literally bends to the whim of any design.

Ricochet brings a whole new protection perspective by combining the look of wallcovering with the durability of rigid wall protection, so walls can make an impact while being able to take an impact. Unlike other products on the market, Ricochet™ Flexible Wall Protection offers the same durability and protective performance as traditional rigid wall protection, but is indistinguishable from wallcovering. It’s durable enough to handle the conditions of the harshest environments, yet literally flexible enough to become the showpiece or the backdrop of any interior. With seamless installation, Ricochet becomes an uninterrupted finish for any of 9 introductory patterns in a variety of colorways for each pattern.

While some protective wall products offer pattern, they’re in the form of rigid plastic. And others offer the look of wallcovering with protection characteristics, but lack the ultra-durable performance of rigid plastic. Ricochet is the perfect balance – the aesthetic of wallcovering with the function of traditional wall protection. It’s so resilient, it fends off stains and vandalism, simply by wiping away with standard cleaning agents.

As experts in wall protection, we didn’t stop at offering Ricochet in rolls. We also offer a dimensional design alternative with wall panels wrapped in Ricochet for another way to bring visual interest to interiors.

With Ricochet’s inviting textures, rich colors, alluring patterns and a seamless appearance, a wall isn’t just a surface, it’s a canvas.

New Mexico is known for its dramatic, wild and distressed beauty; Wolf-Gordon’s new Origins Woods collection, developed in collaboration with the Museum of New Mexico, attempts to capture the allure of the region by focusing on weathered wood structures. Consisting of four digital wallcoverings, Origins Woods is printed on earth-friendly and breathable Terralon, and will join the company’s Curated Collection.

The patterns in Origins Woods are photographically realistic, inspired by the barns, fences, and homes that are built of the material for siding, paneling and flooring. The wood is presented in different configurations as lengthwise cuts and cross sections. As these digital prints attest, wood is a canvas for diverse patinas and textures when exposed to the elements; its textural complexity makes it a sophisticated complement to a variety of interiors.

"Wolf-Gordon Design Studio had the privilege of exploring the New Mexico landscape with the Museum of New Mexico staff to draw inspiration for this collection. Wood was a large part of that experience; and its unique, rich appearance contributes to our initiative to offer interesting textural elements in the Curated Collection." – Michael Loughlin, Wolf-Gordon, Customs & Digital Director.

Catalpa, Pawpaw, Tamarack, and Tupelo add a warm, authentic touch to any space, whether positioned behind a headboard or a reception desk, or in a customer waiting area or retail environment. Each of the four patterns is available in three standard color options and can be printed in a custom hue upon request.

"Wolf-Gordon’s Origin Woods focuses on a material that makes New Mexico’s built environment compelling. We are excited to have provided the adventure that inspired this collection and are proud of the fresh perspective it offers on our distinct surroundings." – Pamela Kelly, MoNM Foundation, VP of Licensing & Brand.


Patterns:
Catalpa: Hand-sawn wood planks are arranged in a brick pattern for a cozy, geometric effect.

Pawpaw: Named for a fruit-bearing tree long popular among Native Americans, this checkered pattern is made of end grain blocks.

Tamarack: Vertical panels of reclaimed wood with characteristic grooves, flecks, and gouges provide an authentic look.

Tupelo: A farmhouse appeal is captured in this pattern’s horizontal planks of weathered wood. Tupelo is offered with natural coloring, a bleached wood effect, or stained with a deep espresso tone.

Wall Protection + Digital Lab
Fusion combines the unlimited possibilities of the Koroseal Digital Lab with the durability of Wall Protection, allowing you to create almost any image for your walls with the impact resistance needed for wall protection. This state-of-the-art product fuses together digital imagery and rigid wall protection sheets, and includes a protective top layer — giving your digital image unmatched clarity, cleanability and durability.

a³ CeramicSteel Flow is one of a kind. From feature walls that display brand messaging and graphics to seamless writing surfaces, this product transforms the aesthetics and functionality of any vertical wall space. With no vertical joint covers, a³ CeramicSteel Flow allows for uninterrupted design and worksurface.

What makes a³ CeramicSteel Flow distinct from other full-height wall coverings are its features. With concealed vertical joints and no made-to-order components, this product is easy to install. The user experience and overall aesthetic of a space is enhanced with this product’s ability to beautifully display its two standard color options as well as customizable images and designs due to PolyVision’s state-of-the-art digital imaging technology. Since the CeramicSteel surface is colorfast, the vibrant colors and designs are upheld for years. This product is also easy to clean and leaves minimal , thus improving its longevity. The durability of the a³ CeramicSteel Flow ensures the surface is resistant against scratches, bacteria, chemicals and fire.

In addition to these distinct characteristics, a³ CeramicSteel Flow is environmentally-friendly. As a surface that is 99.9% recyclable and made from inorganic materials, this product is safe to use for all applications. Striving for optimal environmental stewardship, the CeramicSteel material is Cradle to Certified™ Bronze level certified, the only surface in the market that has achieved this global recognition. Additionally, the CeramicSteel material is certified by SCS Global Services as Indoor Advantage Gold™ , which is the global standard for products that support a healthy indoor environment.

a³ CeramicSteel Flow truly is a wall covering suitable for all things collaboration and design.

Hashtag is a fun, extremely large-scaled and bold contemporary design, made up of crisscrossed lines, inspired by the “HashTag” symbol, hence the name…Hashtag! This is a three color design and incorporates both metallic and flat inks to bring dimension to the wall in a striking application.
The background linen texture is an extremely convincing replication of a crisp woven linen textile, reminiscent of a natural panel cloth.
HashTag is offered in a range of twelve colorations, spanning the gamut from light, understated neutral tones, to bold, deep, and rich accent colors. The color reference and inspiration is taken from some of the newest Arc|Com upholstery designs that are being released, reflecting these unique, modern, trend-setting color combinations. HashTag is a 20 ounce vinyl, on a Non-Woven eco-Backing.

Designed by Mac Stopa for Mosaico Digitale, Digital Universe is a 3D pattern on resin tile resembling a 3D map of the universe, whose structure is similar to that of neurons. On their perimeter, the 24 in. by 24 in. tiles have identical geometry ensuring modularity, while the center of each tile is artistically distorted following the organic geometry of the pattern creating randomness. The super light tiles are waterproof, easy to transport and easy to install. They can be used in a variety of both indoor and outdoor applications including office interiors, building lobbies, restaurants, cafeterias, building elevations and swimming pools, to name a few. Thanks to the flexibility of resin, the main component of the mosaic tile, Digital Universe can also be applied on curved walls. Made in Italy.

We are proud to introduce Botanicals, a new wallcovering collection from celebrated Norwegian creators of ConcreteWall, Art Director Lena Johnsen and Photographer Tom Haga. Both striking and serene, Botanicals captures the beauty of Mother Nature in 700 unbelievable Megapixels. Available in ten dramatic motifs, Botanicals offers infinite possibilities for residential and commercial spaces.

Botanicals is a one-of-a-kind wallcovering collection with the power to transform any space from blasé to extraordinary.

• 700 Megapixel images
• Max 16’ x 45’ without repeat
• 10 exclusive styles
• Zoom and crop for unique look
• Residential or commercial use
• Easy to apply and remove
• Scratch-resistant, light-resistant
• Non-flammable, washable
• Quick lead time

The collection features five different plants, including:

Alocasia
Native to rainforest regions, Alocasia is characterized by giant heart-shaped leaves that are often used as impromptu umbrellas in tropical downpours.

Papaver
Throughout history, Papaver has been widely used for its medicinal purposes. It has been believed to promote sleep, relieve indigestion and ease respiratory ailments.

Helleborus
Defined by its dramatic flowers, the Helleborus has made a name for itself in myths and legends. In Greek Mythology, Helleborus was used to cure the madness of King Midas’ daughters after being cursed by the god Dionysus and on the flip side, is rumored to have been used to poison Alexander the Great.

Nelumbo
Nelumbo, sacred to both Hindus and Buddhists, is an aquatic plant that is also a symbol of wellness. Plus, it’s a source of food! The rhizomes and seeds can be popped and eaten like popcorn.

Eryngium
Eryngium is a symbol of admiration. In addition to their ornamental nature, Eryngium is used as an anti-inflammatory supplement, herb for food and an essential oil. It’s even used as a remedy for scorpion stings.

Botanicals is a one-of-a-kind wallcovering that has the power to transform any space from mundane to extraordinary.

Contour is a new series for Spatial Element, who specializes in 3 dimensional, hand formed fabrics. Contour is a lush active surface of woven panels of 3 dimensional silk fabric. This piece is 4 feet in diameter made with a metallic silk.
Contour is available in the following sizes: 6', 5', 4', 3' and 2' diameters.
A wall of various sized pieces would compliment any feature wall. Spatial Element also makes a lush pleated fabric which is an available option for the Contour series.

Spatial Element places an emphasis on creative collaboration and is available for
projects of any size and scope.
We look forward to helping you develop your project.

A printed fabric with 3D effect which plays with geometry and with color. It comes from the reproduction of a contemporary embroidery which, once produced by digital printing on a white linen ground, becomes a sort of textile trompe l’oeil: the embroidery, perfectly rendered, is in fact illusory in that this is a printed fabric. The overlaps and interweaving of color are very interesting. Suitable for heavy use, it is available in 5 colors.

Interior Design Award | 2017 | Category: Wall Covering: Fabric

For 30 years Moss and Lam has been commissioned by the world’s leading interior designers and architects to create handmade artisanal canvas wall coverings. Our team of designers and artists under the direction of Deborah Moss, works closely with our clients to develop inspired wall coverings that are cohesive with the design intent and thoughtfully integrated with the space.

Our approach to developing wall coverings is tailored to suit each specific client and our process includes: initial art concepts, sample development, in-house fabrication, and installation.

Our 14,000 sq. ft. Toronto studio, allows us to create seamless canvas wall coverings measuring up to 17’ x 100’. One of our recent projects, the Four Seasons, Kuwait, contains over 14,000 sq. ft. of wall coverings.

All of our work is hand produced; each finish is an original (hand made) and available in a variety of styles and techniques, including carved plasters on canvas, painted gradients, imaginative murals and gilded surfaces. Moss and Lam has created canvas wall coverings for locations throughout the world including Kuwait, Hong Kong, New York, Dubai, Paris, Japan and India.

All of our wall coverings are ASTM E84 Class A certified.

Spectra is Arte’s latest three-dimensional wall covering collection and features the unique combination of tone, texture and technology for which the company is so well-known. Spectra executes high-relief patterns via thermoforming which gives the surface a suede-like feel and provides a positive influence on the acoustics of a space.

BLOSSOM
A winding path lined by fragrant magnolia branches fluttering gently in the wind inspires BLOSSOM, one of our newest digital collections. It is developed through a digital printing process which allows for millions of hues to be captured in hyper-detail, where artistry meets innovation. Featuring a bold scale of flowering blooms, BLOSSOM is available in 7 sweet colorations on the cusp of budding new design.

Maya Romanoff introduces Cozy™, a brand new wallcovering and upholstery collection in collaboration with internationally renowned architect and designer, David Rockwell. The fourth Rockwell and Romanoff collaboration promises to be a timeless addition to classics Blanket™ and Stitched™. Cozy combines superior woven, heathered wool with metallic foil or three dimensional ink evocative of stitching. Five graphic patterns and a solid coordinate are offered in tonal, metallic, and high-contrast colorways, and take the collection from chic to playful. The plush construction absorbs sound and creates a quiet atmosphere worthy of its name. The collection features 34 design combinations including solid companions.

Layering dense wool felt over sustainable cork, Submaterial wallcoverings are designed to delight the eyes, celebrate natural materials and soften harsh acoustics. Each handmade section engages the senses with its color and craftsmanship, combining seamlessly to create a must-touch dimensional surface. With more than 60 available color choices, our wallcoverings can be specified from soothing monochrome neutrals to striking graphic statements.

Submaterial wallcovering patterns emphasize simple and easy forms that - depending on colorway - can fade visually to the background or leap forward to dominate a feature wall. The Index series works with relationships of rectangles and linear forms, with the patterns finding a randomness and pleasing equilibrium. Our Figure series features repeating organic and geometric forms that are scaled large for whole-room impact.

Our wallcovering designs are tile-based and modular, made-to-order according to each client’s specified colorway. We’ve created digital tools that simplify color layout and waste calculation, and our clear instructions make for an easy installation.
