The look and feel of hand-loomed raw silk walls without the worry. Made of 100% Flame retardant polyester that is stain & fade resistant. BART HALPERN signature pleating is the perfect partner for additional depth and dimension.

Peace is Elitis's fifth 3D wallcovering collection since they created this innovative technology in 2012. A jersey is placed and thermo-shaped on a special foam according to the different patterns of the collection.

Four brand new patterns make up this new collection, fully displaying Elitis's know-how and mastery of this craft. Our internal design team has worked on those patterns for 3 years to achieve the layered looks that are on this collection (as collections came out the technical know-how in relief and layers increased). Those patterns explore natural textures and seek to replicate random patterns that can be found either in handcrafted materials or in the wilderness.

The patterns:

Cascade: evoking petals cascading down a wall, this round pattern has a soothing effect. In three neutral colors (off white, light grey and black) it plays interestingly with light and shadows thanks to its plushness. Straight match 45'', 49'' wide

Vibrato: honeycombs, ancient crafts or pointillism, this pattern speaks to everyone differently. The imperfect hexagonal geometry brings interest and structure to the textured dot pattern. Pattern available in 4 colors, bright white, orange, army green or slate. Straight match 35'', 49'' wide

Touch: a very tough pattern to pull off given the amount of details involved, Touch brings chunky knits to walls. As its name indicates, it also brings up an irrepressible urge to feel its texture. Three neutrals (off white, grey and black) plus a bright green make up the colorways. Free match, 49'' wide

Wood: Sanded planks of wood come to life, where the grain of the virtual wood brings a modern yet rugged depth and warmth. Wood is available in 4 neutral colors (off-white, light grey, dark grey and black), and is a free match, 49'' wide

Aside of their aestetics, all of these products have strong acoustic advantages and have been tested accordingly: alphaW=0.20(H) performed according to ISO 354 and evaluated according to ISO 11654
They have also received an A+ grade regarding indoor air emissions. They are suitable for hospitality and contract uses and easy to install and strip thanks to a non-woven backing.

Product > wall covering: paper.description_html: Like flashes of rock fragments through a microscope, Breccia layers frame after frame of visual texture onto the wall — or ceiling. The hand-painted, hand-assembled collage of paper squares comes in four metallic colors, each named after a type of brecciated marble. From silver-lined Pernice to dark Nouvelle, the exclusive, 36 inch-wide, wallcovering from Innovations adds a unique, artistic touch to any space.

Resembling the glossy bark of rain-soaked Aspens in the Cathedral region of the Colorado mountains, Hartmann&Forbes’ new innovative natural wallcovering design is created with hand-sliced cork skillfully placed on metallic backing paper, then printed with a design inspired by winter woodlands. This meticulous process results in a lasting, timeless design complementing any interior space and reflects the personality of the region that inspired its creation.

“We were excited about the wallcovering; under normal scenarios, it would be a beautiful background but we featured it as a piece of art. It anchors the master bedroom so everything else in comparison is very simple. The impact as you walk in, when you see the texture and sparkle, the beautiful subtleties that come through, it rewards the person looking at it from afar. You see a warmer texture but as you come close you see its character emerge – we like that subtly, we like that play in scale – we love the richness of it all.”
– Balazs Bognar, Director at Kengo Kuma and Associates
Referring to the Cathedral wallcovering featured in the master bedroom of the Suteki House at the 2017 NW Natural Street of Dreams

Fashion and interior design are closely related: both style worlds respond to the changing times and influence each other in something of a pendulum movement. With Revera, Arte highlights those close ties: classic textile patterns are given a modern twist with foil, flock or real textile in this new collection of wallcoverings.

Inspired by family history, Grow House Grow's Cuba Collection is a vibrant homage to the island country and its resilient people. The line is comprised of three patterns:

1) Petticoat Palm: A dynamic palm print made in memory of the tenacious Cuban women who have influenced the designer's life.

2) Fauna Fantasía: A jungle print, designed for a story told by the designer's grandfather, illustrating the unusual fact that there are no deadly poisonous animals on Cuba's shores.

3) Santos Suarez: Named after the neighborhood the designer's mother grew up in, this trellis is evocative of Havana's interiors, as well as a symbol of the separation between Cubans who fled and those who remained behind.

Grow House Grow's wallpapers are hand silk-screened with care in NY state. Known for their narrative inspiration, each wallpaper has its own tale to tell. For further information, the full stories behind each pattern in the Cuba Collection can be found on www.growhousegrow.com.

Arte's Oculaire collection features handwoven sisal wall coverings crafted in couture inlay designs. The contemporary and playful designs in this collection have a subtle, tropical vibe that adds character, texture and warmth - and a touch of the exotic - to interiors.

Cast off in seaworthy style with YACHT CLUB, inspired by the luxury ships cruising down the French Riviera. Authentic wood veneer is cut into two different shapes and hand placed atop a metallic ground, for a pop of shimmer and three-dimensional effect. The interlocking chain pattern is available in seven colorations, YACHT CLUB races to the forefront of design.

Glamora is a laboratory where graphic design, elegant craftsmanship and material constitute a single
language, able to transform space with great narrative and emotional value.
Glam-Metal represents a new expression of this global search: a vinyl covering, lined with a thin metallic layer
that lends the wallcovering the shine and reflection of metal. Like a delicate material weaving together of fine
threads, Glam-Metal elicits particular visual and tactile sensations, making the graphics even more arresting
and every environment even more prestigious.
Suitable for covering interior walls and ceilings, the Glam-Metal material can be combined with all subjects in
Glamora’s vast collection of wallcoverings, playing on its affinity and contrast with themes ranging from ethnic
to industrial, vintage to contemporary, and natural to material.

The Japanese tradition of weaving ultra-thin Paulownia wood onto a flexible paper backing has been modernized to incorporate die-cutting for more versatile design options. Grand Scale Ajiro Coffers is hand-inlaid wood veneer set in a parquet frame. Grand Scale is more than doubled in size from the original to accentuate larger landscapes and soaring ceilings. Cost effective and environmentally sound, this renewable resource is beautifully stained in 15 hues and hand-finished in our Chicago studio. Ajiro wood veneer wall coverings are an attractive alternative to
costly solid wood paneling.

Mason offers a new concept in wallcovering: Each 16” x 16” tile is beautifully handmade of rapidly renewable abaca pulp, which makes them light enough for easy installation—either continuously straight, crosshatched, or mitered—with conventional starch-based wallpaper adhesive. Bamboo stalks shifting in the breeze inspired the organic design. Available in two natural colorways, with the unlimited option for custom colors.

The perfect marriage of two substrates creates a bond of beauty and long-lasting durability. An intricate layer of lace is laminated to a strong non-woven substrate. The lace resists pigment during the coloring process creating stunning depth and texture. The organic and rhythmic pattern also provides an almost seamless installation. With 12 colorways to choose from, Unveil adds subtlety and sophistication to any setting.

Originally made famous at the Beverly Hills Hotel, “Martinique” is HINSON’S most iconic, larger than life, palm leaf pattern. The classic wallcovering is reborn with a brand new coloration featuring a highly textural interpretation, printed on HINSON grasscloth.

Our 2016 collection, called Matchsticks, features the signature and delicate motifs which are a continuation of our interest in finding patterns in the small details of everyday life. Rather than print the patterns digitally, we aim to push the boundaries of what is possible in screenprinted wallpaper. After creating the initial design in the studio and establishing the color palette, we work to see how much of the details and pleasant imperfections can be brought out during the creation of the screens and printing process. The idea is that the combination of hand-drawn patterns, delicate line work, textured brush strokes and the imperfection of the handmade results in a wallpaper that brings a sense of intimacy through simplicity to a residential or commercial space.  

Kim started a daily drawing practice to simply appreciate the things around her, and now our studio work comes from a practice of storytelling through drawing. We are interested in the connection of everyday things with the broader experience of society and life. One of our primary interests is in home and community and how we navigate the public and private worlds. We believe decorative objects are an important tool for communicating how we as a society believe things are organized and should be celebrated. Places we travel, food we eat or things in our home all become content for the drawings we make which eventually become the wallpaper our studio handprints. Connecting to a place through drawing the objects in it and collecting them into a group on the wall, allows viewers to connect to the everyday things around them in new ways. Developing this emotional connection is integral to our process and working with objects in the home or in specific locations is an exciting challenge to find and expose the stories that have always existed.

Eskayel, a Brooklyn-based textile company introduces its latest offering, the Beautiful Decay Mural Collection. The collection will include five murals that were originally painted with water-colors and then enlarged as part of a wall installation for a custom project in collaboration with the design firm The New Design Project.
Drawing inspiration from the patinated textures of weathered buildings, Eskayel’s watercolor murals feature tonal abstract motifs reflective of a modern sensibility. Sweeping curves contrast with imperfect lines, while shadowy brushstrokes punctuate the canvas, resulting in a fluidity that mirrors the peeling exteriors of building surfaces in remote towns of Morocco, Croatia, and Italy.
“Through my travels, I’ve always been captivated by weathered buildings as different patterns and shading emerge from the layers of paint peeling off the exteriors,” stated Founder and Creative Director Shanan Campanaro. “With this being my first ever mural project, I wanted to be able to share what I’ve created for The New Design Project with my customers.”
Available fabric grounds include oyster linen, organic denim and a 50/50 linen cotton blend. Wallpaper will be available in non-woven vellum, which has a light textured print surface in a matte finish. Standard materials are suitable for residential and low-traffic commercial locations. Type II Commercial grade options are also available.

An extremely intensive process involving several steps of handcraft, Mesa is inspired by Japanese crushing techniques and the interaction of dye with the peaks and valleys of the paper. The new realization has a suede-like color palette with a matte, contemporary finish. This collection is available in 9 colorways.
Based on the archival 1947 Josef Frank Printed Fabric, this hand drawn pattern bears the designer's signature modernity, whimsy, and warmth. Also available as a fabric.

The Phantasmagoria Collection by Aimée Wilder brings the dream world to life in a melding of galactic visions, jungle adventures, and desert wanderings. To create Phantasmagoria, a collection of wallpaper & fabric, rugs & bespoke carpets, and pillows & poufs, Wilder experimented with elements of light and shadow, pushing the limits of repeat size and density of detail. In Phantasmagoria, one is easily lost in the fantastical, oversized repeats featuring flora and fauna, both real and imagined.

Wilder shares, “The Phantasmagoria Collection reflects the evolution of our brand, as
the most visually multi-layered collection in our offering. It is also our biggest foray into
rugs and bespoke carpets to date.”

In the recurring dream which inspired collection, Aimée goes on a psychedelic
adventure through time and space. Aimée finds herself floating through an unknown
galaxy. The stars, asteroids, and comets begin to morph into a churning sea of
cheetah spots. Friendly cheetah faces appear but quickly turn ferocious jumping out
of space to chase her through a sleepy jungle. She tumbles through sparkling puddles,
past lumbering sloths and playful primates, soon realizing she has lost the pursuing
wildcats. Her journey continues as the jungle melts into an arid desert. Cacti the size of
skyscrapers tower over her and the sun emerges high overhead. She basks in its
warmth, exhausted from her surreal voyage.

The four patterns for wallpaper are :

Cactus Spirit : a dimensional and layered desert setting, Cactus Spirit brings home a taste of the southwest.
Colors: Sage, Cloak, Contrast, Desert, Kelly, Mist, Peri, Splendid, Tequila, Flesh.
Repeat: 54 inches (137.2 cm) wide x 36 inches (91.4 cm) high

Cheetah Vision : This playful, swirling cheetah-print features an unexpected cheetah face peering back at you.
Colors: Nocturnal, Grassland, Candy, Comet, Oasis, Daydream, Aventura, Safari, Haze.
Repeat: 54 inches (137.2 cm) wide x 36 inches (91.4 cm) high

Cosmic Splash : Awash with movement and energy, this textural pattern conjures the cosmos in motion, yet can be as subtle or bold as desired.
Colors: Luna, Pearl, Abyss, Obsidian, Lazurite, Lapis, Aura, Galaxy, Rose Quartz.
Repeat: 54 inches (137.2 cm) wide x 36 inches (91.4 cm) high

Jungle Dream : An oversized nocturnal jungle-scape adventure featuring jungle creatures, and flora and fauna.
Colors: Monteverde, Emerald, Lily, Newsprint, Parchment, Mediterranean, Zest, Orinoco, Sphinx, Charcoal, Stardust, Contrast.
Repeat: 54 inches (137.2 cm) wide x 44 inches (111.8 cm) high

Juju Papers, the Portland, Oregon artisanal wallpaper studio helmed by artist Avery Thatcher, introduces Graffito, a wallpaper collection based on the theme of mark-making. The new series is simultaneously whimsical and glamorous, featuring abstract runes, signs and symbols rendered in sumptuous metallic colors.

The eco-friendly, hand-screenprinted papers are made in small batches and are customizable, and intended for residential, hospitality and workspace.

Thatcher notes, “Graffito explores the simple power of mark-making, tracing all the way back to those who scratched pictograms on walls, caves and bones. The patterns in the collection are united by their glyphic, graphic qualities: gestural, non-fussy abstractions of such varied inspirations as handwriting, a star-lit sky or masonry wall.”

Thatcher’s signature impact and surprise comes from the collision of humble line drawings with her deluxe metallic inks. The glossy gold, gunmetal and diamond finishes add a layer of elegance to the understated imagery.

Four patterns in a total of fifteen colorways:

Bomba: improvisational composition of lively scribbles, dashes, zig zags, waves, and scrawling lines. Thatcher took her cues from handwritten signatures, the ultimate individual mark-making. Five two-tone metallic colorways: Gold on Cream, Gold on Charcoal, Diamonds and Pearls on Cream, Gunmetal on Navy, Gunmetal on Blush, Gunmetal on Cream.

The Pearl: eccentrically-drawn and arrayed shapes abstract a stone mason’s hand-constructed wall. Four two-tone metallic colorways: Gold on Cream, Gold on Charcoal, Diamonds and Pearls on Cream, Gunmetal on Blush.

Pavlova: delicate overlapping curves, arcs and bends. Named for the Russian ballerina, famous for her sylphlike appearance, grace of movement and expressive nature. Three duo-tone metallic colorways: Gunmetal on Cream, Diamonds and Pearls on Cream, Gold on Cream.

Dusk: minutely-scaled squares and rectangles imprecisely scattered; they appear animated, as sparkling stars or glitter in a rock quarry. Two two-tone metallic colorways: Gold on Cream, Gold on Charcoal.

Sustainable materials. The Graffito collection of hand-printed wallpapers is made with non-VOC water-based inks, printed on sustainably harvested pulp paper with a natural clay coating. The collection is also available in a variety of Type II commercial-grade options including Mylar, Terralon Smooth and Smooth Vinyl (all low VOC). Terralon Smooth is a PVC-free product made with polyester/natural fiber technology containing over 31% recycled materials.

Customizable. The studio offers bespoke services, and all papers may be specified in custom colors.

Juju’s signature style combines the informal look of outsider art with an elegant and approachable touch, all marked by sophisticated craftsmanship and unparalleled quality.

Abnormals Anonymous selected four motifs from Seattle artist and illustrator Anna Redmond and translated them to wallpapers, creating "Currents", a handcrafted, eco-friendly, customizable collection ideal for residential and hospitality applications. The series is lively and full of movement, referencing natural elements and winged flight, brush strokes and stitchery, water, field and sky. Currents is available in a total of 24 colorways.

“Lily’s Pad,” an abstracted lotus pod in lighthearted, animated rhythm. Five unexpected colorways: Colonel Mustard, Moody Blues, It’s Totally Mauve!, Ziggy Stardust and Gray Goose. 45” wide, 28” vertical repeat.

“Flashdance,” notes Redmond, is simultaneously “seascape, landscape, skyscape.” Whether alluding to feathers, grass blades, or brush strokes, she freezes gesture in motion. Eight two-tone colorways: Pink Panther, Purple Haze, In the Navy, Margaritaville, Put it in Neutral, Outta the Blue, Freshly Mowed, and Gray Matters. 43.5” wide, 28” vertical repeat.

“Wavelength,” per Redmond, is “fluid form, an act of movement.” Five duotones: Flossy, Days of our Lives, Sweet Dreams, The Seven Seas and Golden Delicious. 47.5" wide, 21" vertical repeat.

“Twisted Stitcher,” a fluid, kaleidoscopic design featuring large-scale “stitch” marks. Says Redmond, “A recording of time passed.” Six colorways from discreet to dramatic: Lust for Life, Sandcastles, Sunshine Daydreams, Abbey Road, Steely Dan, and Cold Rolled. 50” wide, 22.5” vertical repeat.

The innovative and unusual wallpaper collection by architect and designer Mac Stopa for German wallpaper producer A.S. Creation Tapeten proves that geometry is anything but bleak. The ecstatic graphic decorations in pink, pastel green, orange and intense turquoise are the result of Mac Stopa’s interest in mathematics and geometric shapes – and perfectly express his “Think bold” motto. Futuristic and powerful contrasts as well as vibrant neon colors attract everyone’s attention. The honeycomb, mesh, and bubble patterns in 3-D optics set walls in motion. Boredom was yesterday. These wallpapers bring new energy and make a strong statement in every room. Made in Germany. Distributed in the USA by Sancar Wallcoverings.
Product > wall covering: paper.product_name: Harmony in Motion by Mac Stopa for A.S. Creation

Product > wall covering: paper.description_html: The Japanese tradition of weaving thin Paulownia wood onto a paper backing has been modernized for more versatile design options. Ajiro wood veneer wallcoverings can turn corners and wrap columns. Following the contemporary look of our Ajiro Chevron, the Grand Scale expands the design with 15-inch wide stripes that transform large spaces into spectacular settings. Cost effective and environmental, this renewable resource is beautifully stained in 15 hues and hand-finished in our Chicago studio. Ajiro wood veneer wallcoverings are an attractive alternative to costly millwork.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
Handmade in California using time-honored techniques, Fireclay Tile’s Agrarian Collection is a tribute to the place the company calls home.

“Inspiration for the Agrarian Collection was right in our back yard,” said Jamie Chappell, Creative Director at Fireclay Tile. “Looking to the rich heritage of agriculture that surrounds our factory in Aromas, CA, the Agrarian Collection pays homage to a place that brings our story to life.”

In designing the collection, Fireclay’s team was moved by aerial photography of geometric crop formations in Aromas, and the diverse agricultural patterns that are revealed when seen from a bird’s eye view. From 10,000 feet above the earth, a variety of shapes, colors and sizes come together to make an idyllic patchwork quilt-like scene, which directly inspired Fireclay’s designers.

The collection’s eight bold patterns, ranging from linear grids to circular pivots, highlight the dynamic yet structured patchwork of fields, while its three colorways are representative of land use in the region, as well as the elements of nature that are key to agricultural production: the Warm motif pays homage to the earth and soil, the Cool motif the rain, and the White Motif the sun and sky.

The Agrarian collection also represents Fireclay’s commitment to sustainability, environmentally friendly manufacturing processes, and the preservation of Aromas’ natural beauty by using resourced local materials.

These large-format 8x8” tiles are painted by hand with 100% lead-free glazes on a Fireclay's signature Recycled [red] clay body, which is made up of a minimum of 50% recycled products including post-consumer recycled porcelain and glass, as well as pre-consumer recycled granite dust. In addition, the brand recycles their own tile and glaze waste to be re-incorporated into their recycled clay bodies.

The collection's geometric designs are ideal for creating impactful focal points in residential and commercial environments alike – mix-and-match for a unique tile landscape, or choose a single pattern to create a striking feature installation.

The Agrarian Collection is suitable for both indoor and outdoor use in temperate climates, and for flooring as well as wall surfacing applications. However one chooses to use Agrarian, the collection’s versatile patterns and color motifs offer endless possibilities for self-expression, while simultaneously telling the story of Fireclay Tile and the place that makes its story possible.

For more information and images, please visit: https://www.fireclaytile.com/handpainted/agrarian/.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
For a modern twist on timeless stone, the Classentino Marble™ series by Marazzi delivers the bold look of marble with all of the benefits of porcelain. The intricacies and veining reproduced in this series create an authentic marble appearance without the high cost and maintenance. Classentino Marble helps designers looking for a cohesive look achieve an elegant and seamless transition from floors to walls.
In addition to its stunning beauty, Classentino Marble is low maintenance, which is ideal for high-traffic residential or commercial areas. Because porcelain is naturally water, liquid and stain resistant, this tile will sustain its appearance through years of impact. Combining these porcelain qualities with proper installation – designers can rest assured that this collection will last for years and require minimal repairs during its lifespan.
As trendy as it is sturdy, Classentino Marble meets designer needs for realistic marble patterns with a variety of finishes, mosaics and trims. The color palette for Classentino Marble boasts five versatile options in both matte and polished finishes. The signature veining of marble is intricately reproduced using Reveal Imaging® technology. This state-of-the-art digital printing allows tile to perfectly emulate surfaces and textures found in nature. When combined with other technologies during the glazing process, Reveal Imaging can develop 3D-style visuals that are almost indistinguishable from real minerals. Incredible color and detail come to the surface of every tile through this process, setting these products apart from industry competitors. TruEdge™ technology reduces the overall appearance of grout lines in the surfaces, resulting in a sleek and lavish façade.
The Marazzi design team focuses on both design and creativity when curating collections to deliver the best-in-class wallcovering and flooring solutions to customers. Classentino Marble offers an aesthetic rooted in Italian heritage and artistically combines the best of both old and new marble surfaces. The matte and polished finishes give customers the ability to find a look that takes their designs to new heights.
Classentino Marble is also available in classic weave and linear hex mosaic styles. Making a profound statement on walls, these mosaics can be used as an accent to the collection or to add a personal touch to surfaces. The available coordinating trims also give contractors the ability to seal off the tile edges, providing a cleaner finish to project spaces.
Whether you are designing your dream kitchen or a bathroom oasis, Classentino Marble serves as the ultimate tile choice for trusted performance and a luxurious touch.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
Description
Tratto is a series of through body, glazed porcelain tile with a hand-drawn appearance. Tratto, which translates to “sketch” is reminiscent of architectural drawings, wherein lines are somewhat linear, yet imperfect. The surface of each tile has a matte finish, and designs are stenciled onto the surface, then coated in a powdered material that becomes commercial-grade glass upon firing. With Tratto, the individual styles (Circuit, Lines and Brick) are modular and can be used on their own or paired with other styles in the collection.

Colors, Finishes & Sizes
Tratto is available in 3 styles (Circuit, Lines and Brick). Each has a Matte finish and a thickness of 10mm:
Circuit is available in 2 colors (Black and White) in the following nominal (and actual) size: 8” x 12” (19.3cm x 29.8cm). The design on the surface is glossy.
Lines is available in 5 colors (Black, Black & Grey, Black & White, White, Beige) in the following nominal (and actual) size: 8” x 12” (19.3cm x 29.8cm). The design on the surface is semi-glossy.
Brick is available in 2 colors (Black and White) in the following nominal (and actual) size: 2½” x 8” (6.2cm x 19.3cm). The design on the edges is metallic.
Tiles are rectified and mono-caliber.

Applications
Tratto is suitable for interior and exterior walls and floors, including heavy-traffic commercial flooring applications.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
Silk—such a luxurious and time-honored fabric—is the inspiration for Crossville's Seta, a line of gauged porcelain tile panels. The surface visual of these impressive, large format tiles reveals the replication of delicate silk strands woven throughout the nuanced appearance of the line’s four color options. Perfectly dressy but equally casual, these 1mx3m panels are high fashion. Yet make no mistake, as visually captivating as Seta is, underlying strength and technical performance are the hallmarks of the line. Though only 5.6mm in thickness, Seta’s polished style will perform beautifully on interior walls in demanding commercial installations. These innovative panels may even be applied directly over previously installed tile or stone, offering great savings of time, labor, and budget—helping interior design projects to be as smooth as silk.
Learn more at crossvilleinc.com/laminam-by-crossville/

ENVIRONMENTAL STATEMENT

Laminam by Crossville collections are excellent choices for those seeking green surfacing solutions for design projects. Laminam porcelain tile panels are responsibly made with natural raw materials in one of the most advanced, environmentally sound manufacturing facilities in the world, located in the heart of Italy’s renowned tile production region. Reflecting global standards in sustainability, the Laminam manufacturing process uses leading edge technology and recycling practices and incorporates innovative methods to minimize waste and generate energy without depleting the earth’s resources.

Laminam products, created to meet Green Building Council standards, support specifiers’ goals for durable, healthy environments. The porcelain tile panels do not release emissions or substances into the environment and require minimal maintenance, contributing to indoor air quality and providing ease of cleaning long term. The panels’ superior performance characteristics lead to long product lifecycles—reducing the need for replacement. However, should panels be removed, they can simply be unbacked, milled, and recycled back into the tile production stream.

As porcelain tile panels’ popularity grows, the green innovations at the Laminam manufacturing facility advance, as well. The plant’s recently installed photovoltaic roof has already produced 1 GWh of energy and is capable of generating an estimated 1.387 GWh within a year, cutting the CO2 emission into the atmosphere by 617 tons and empowering the Laminam plant to self-generate 15% of its energy requirements.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
“Giovanni Barbieri developed new way to create floor patterns.
It is the first Series presenting a different no-repetitive shape-drawings result by using standard production tiles.
What has been possible through custom made design projects so far,
is now available thanks to the production of standard tiles,
which can be easily installed randomly without having repetitive designs,
by virtue of this avant-garde process.
This is a new concept to create infinitive ways of styles
and models in 3 versions: mosaic, tiles, 3D walls.
The first example is Floways Collection.

On this presentation we are happy to show the aesthetical result only and not the lay-out patterns that give easy installation.

“FLOWAYS”
Available in waterjet mosaic, tiles and 3D wall pattern on infinitive colorways , Natural Stone, Handmade terracotta, Murano Glass and metal combinations.
"Floways" is a part of the New “Sophisticate Simplicity” Series: this name is by the sophisticated aesthetical result of the simplicity of it’s installation.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
The gradual, constant engineering of the production processes of architectural ceramics has made it possible to manufacture larger and larger sizes and develop more and more precise colour gradation systems, which also produce slabs of material in amazingly bright, shiny colours; at the same time, increasingly accurate controlled mechanisation of manufacturing cycles has helped to make the potential, minimal flaws in the finished product completely imperceptible. On the one hand, this has had the beneficial outcome of quality standards absolutely inconceivable until the recent past, but on the other it has often led to worries about the risk – intrinsic in a virtually “perfect” modular, mass-produced product – of minimising, or even completely eliminating, the stimulating visual variety once created by the sequential repetition of ceramic tiles when every one had its own, individual flaws.
With the Cromatica collection, Formafantasma investigates fresh possibilities provided by the “colour factor” in contemporary ceramics manufacturing, while at the same time meeting the need to provide continuous spreads of covering, technically perfect but still offering the fascinating potential for compositions of individual pieces which are never monotonous. The entire collection – produced in a variety of sizes – includes six basic colours, with two types of surface finish (one natural, the other glossy); the slab production cycle combines different technologies to deliver a rich lexicon of shades and gradations on the large surface of a single ceramic panel: the small sizes in the collection, "offcuts" from the larger slabs, are combined – even at random – to create compositions with a wide variety of colours, for design schemes featuring unique, original chromatic blends.
The colour range developed for Cromatica is the outcome of in-depth design work conducted by Formafantasma with the aid of materials from the CEDIT archives; amongst the initial inspirations which stimulated the two designers’ creativity in their search for a concept which could combine the brand’s past with its near future, pride of place must definitely go to the major “colour definition” work reflected by the “41 Colors” collection of glazed tiles, designed for the company by Ettore Sottsass at the end of the last century.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html: New Ravenna's tribute to the thriving vertical garden, in mosaic form. Vibrantly colored glass is cut into shapes that resemble succulents, pothos, ferns, vines, and philodendrons and are hand placed to create a 3-D illusion of a live plant wall.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html: Ocean reefs, rhythmic waves and meditative spaces—Lunada Bay Tile expands the Shinju glazed ceramic tile collection with Shinju Mirai, a collection of three-dimensional field tiles with varied surfaces. The patterns and textures transform light, influence scale and create dimension in commercial and residential spaces through fired clay and lustrous glazes.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
“Shadow owes its birth to light.” – John Gay

The interplay of light and shadow to create an artful display of actively shifting shapes is uniquely illustrated through Emser Tile’s multidimensional tile series, Code. Minimal and neutral forms offer endless designs of large-scale wall art with flat, faceted, and reflective variations in surface, shape, and texture. 

Three tile shapes include a hexagon, wedge, and trapezoid. Hexagon and wedge shapes are available in nine 2D, 3D, and textural takes, from smooth to lines in bas relief and metallic matte finishes. Flat trapezoid tiles allow for unique compositions on the wall and floor simply by orienting tiles in various degrees.

Flexible tile formats invite designers to test the limits of their creativity—the ability to form unique overarching pattern through the very way in which they integrate and orient tiles unleashes enormous design potential. Strategically mix flat and dimensional tile patterns on the wall to create large-scale art with transforming texture, or move from the floor up to and throughout the wall in a single shape for a clean, angular aesthetic on multiple surface planes.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html: Mio is a new hexagonal tile collection from Nemo Tile + Stone. With its geometric shape and multi-colored porcelain composition, Mio provides a contemporary twist on a classic style. A play on traditional parquet flooring, Mio features an asymmetrical striation that provides an angular and elegant look, making it the perfect solution for any residential or hospitality space. Dark and dramatic base tones of the ebony wood veneer are elevated with the nature-inspired patterns with white, tan and brown color options. The collection is suitable for both floor and wall applications.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
The Fiandre Group’s Brand Iris Ceramica, teamed up with the iconic lifestyle fashion brand Diesel Living to present their new collaboration of floor and wall solutions, inspired by industrial and modern urban design trends. Fence is one of the latest collections to debut in Diesel Living's first tile collaboration. Along with Diesel’s global fashion savvy and innovation, the final product was achieved together with Iris Ceramica’s technical expertise and manufacturing capabilities to produce unique high tech fashion forward architectural surfaces.

The new tile collections are in sync with Diesel’s fashion brand attributes, including the use of rough materials like metallics and concrete, contrasting shapes, geometric patterns, iridescent colors and textured treatments. Following are the product collection inspirations and descriptions:

The Fence ceramic wall coverings collection is inspired by chain link fences, expanded sheet metal and metal mesh coatings. Color on color creates movement and a sexy solution. Colors and sizes (20x20) available in large mesh: white on white, grey on grey, black on black, and black on white. Micro Patterns: white on white, grey on grey, black on black, black on white.

For more information, visit www.irisceramica.com/products/fence
More photos available if interested, please contact janineflamerpr@gmail.com

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
Our latest fashion-forward foray into marble mosaics, the Luminous Collection gives fan-favorite luxury materials a distinguished charm. A range of finishes mingles with trending geometric shapes and crisp lines to provide playfully rich textures. The predominantly clean, white palette introduces nuanced pops of metallics and different surface finishes to a variety of the available colorways. Luminous is a modern, marble-meets-metals collection with textural depth that will lend an inimitably personal look.

Whether used for commercial or residential applications, the interlocking shapes allow for unique arrangement, and as a result, a multitude of patterns. The foil accents are sure to add exquisite contrast to classic marble design.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
With a style drawn from Michael Aram's Orchid collection, this pattern exudes the floral charm of delicate
orchids, sculpted in three dimensions from crisp Thassos marble. Deep undulation in the stone petals creates
life-like movement and a sense of lightness as the flowers dance across a Bianco Carrara background. Subtle size
and tone variations between the stems, petals, and leaves animate the design, evoking the first blush of Spring.
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.product_name: Michael Aram Orchid for Artistic Tile

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
Kelly Wearstler named her fourth series with ANN SACKS, Gem, to express the ornamental, visual presence and time-honored, age old techniques required to create encaustic tiles. The choice to bring an encaustic collection into the ANN SACKS fold was never far from Wearstler’s mind from the very beginning of this partnership. “I admire the beauty of encaustic tile-making, its textural layers of clay and organic variations of color and pattern,” said Wearstler. “I have collected these tiles over the years and been inspired by their individuality and explore the historic technique and reinterpret it in an altogether modern way.”

The making of encaustic tiles is a time-honored, centuries’ old technique that combine a mixture of cement, sand, ground marble and pigments, then fired to seal the design. The pattern is not produced by the glaze but instead by combining two or more colors of the clay achieving an appearance of being an inlaid design, with a surface softly worn and timeless in appeal.

Elope features a layered solid color face broken by a series of curved lines that rake across the backdrop. “Elope is organic and fluid, classic with a modern mood,” explained Wearstler. “It celebrates the soulful anomalies of organic form.” The design is available in three colors: Ebony, a stark Black field with White rake; Azure, a deep Navy field with White rake; and, Oatmeal, a warm Taupe field with White rake.

The second tile is Swell, a seemingly simple striae design at first but actually quite complex in execution as each gently curved line varies in placement and thickness for a visually expressive tile. “Swell is a painterly stripe of radiating, evolving curvatures, its face defined in soft lineage with a relaxed playful geometry,” explained Wearstler. A two-shade color palette of Ebony, a stark Black field with White stripes; Azure, a deep Navy field with White stripes; and, Ivory, a creamy White field with Black stripes.

Rounding out Gem is Evoke, a remarkable pattern that mimics the swirl and shifting face of marble. “True touch of the hand detail with heavy brushstrokes defines Evoke,” said Wearstler. “It is a bold statement, full of movement and dual-tone line-work reminiscent of linocut prints. Evoke’s color palette is Ebony, a deep Black field with White marbling; Azure, a deep Navy field with White marbling; and, Ivory, a creamy White field with Black marbling.

Gem by Kelly Wearstler for ANN SACKS is available in 8”x8” tiles and appropriate for all indoor wall and flooring applications. Outdoor use is subject to climate and method of installation with special emphasis that in exterior applications the tiles may experience some fading over time due to UV exposure, especially in the darker color combinations. The precision sizing allows for exceptionally tight grout lines for an almost seamless end result. The tiles capture and retain heat naturally, the gentle warmth making it an excellent choice for radiant heat flooring.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html: Nemo Tile + Stone’s new Urban Collection alters a common form — the subway tile — to create a not-so-common design focal point. Created to emulate the look of painted weathered brick, the new collection’s 16 color options can be arranged in a variety of color combinations for a dynamic application or installed as one color as an accent piece. A porcelain tile, Urban can be used on walls in residential, retail, and hospitality spaces. The collection is available in soft neutrals as well as bright hues, offering a vibrant take on an industrial look.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
ANN SACKS raises the bar significantly within the decorative tile category with its introduction of Paire, a visually captivating and sophisticated collection that marries the softly honed beauty of stone with the warmth of brass. Depending on the stone and design selected, rooms can be customized to appeal to personal tastes, whether something more understated is desired or a statement-making room is preferred.

Paire is crafted from stone and brass in three distinctive designs. The stone choices are Black Limestone and Verde Marble, their creamy depths differentiated by three patterns of inlaid brass – Ascend, Strobe and Horizontal. A complementing plain tile completes the choices, serving to juxtapose the decorated versions. Ascend is also offered in a reverse design that when paired, its mirrored patterning produce a dramatic visual effect.

Exclusive to ANN SACKS, Paire comes in 6”x6” and 6”x12” field tiles that are slightly beveled for a finished edge. Additional sizes are offered through special order. Suitable for all interior wall and flooring applications and outdoor applications dependent upon climate and method of installation, it is not recommended for submerged areas. The brass will naturally patina over time but can be brought back to its lustrous glow with simple cleaning.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
Inspired by the organic, woven look of fabric, Elemental Canvas™ by American Olean uses rich colors and graphics to create the illusion of texture. Perfect for hospitality settings and urban residential applications, Elemental Canvas integrates natural beauty with contemporary design. This tile stands apart for its interlaced surfacing, which takes modern design to the next level. Adding a hint of intrigue, Elemental Canvas creates a welcoming and relaxing atmosphere in a multitude of public and private venues.
A popular trend in 2017 is experimentation with texture and gradient. Elemental Canvas adds subtle texture to walls transforming monochromatic surfaces into rich works of art. Available in five color options, ranging from ivory to dark gray, this tile can lay the foundation for a broad spectrum of design styles. Also offered in 1” x 3” glazed ceramic mosaic options, this series gives designers the ability to customize their projects without sacrificing performance.
Designed with Reveal Imaging® and TruEdge™ technology, this porcelain series delivers classic wall tile and linear mosaic accents for sleek, fashionable combinations. With TruEdge technology at the helm, grout lines become less apparent to the average eye. Colorbody™ technology infuses every layer of tile with rich color to ensure that its appearance is maintained and durable for years to come. The porcelain composition of this tile also means that it is resistant to moisture damage, chemicals and scratches. Through years of wear and tear, these unique features will work together to keep your surfaces looking new, vibrant and chic.
State-of-the-art Reveal Imaging ensures that this series imparts the modern look of canvas – with all the ease of porcelain. Using this innovative printing technology creates minimal pattern repetition for a more authentic appearance. Providing unmatched color definition and sharp details, designers can use this series as the star of their project or to harmonize with other features.
Whether you are a commercial architect, homebuilder or interior designer, American Olean has a variety of beautiful products that can bring your vision to life in an environmentally responsible manner. Elemental Canvas falls into this category as the series is composed of a blend of 48.30% pre-consumer recycled materials, minimizing the use of raw materials in its production. Pre-consumer recycled ingredients combined with naturally raw materials means that, at the end of its lifecycle, Elemental Canvas tile safely assimilates back into the environment.
With eco-friendly projects growing in demand, Elemental Canvas not only delivers a high-end product, but also helps designers demonstrate their commitment to sustainability, durability and sophistication.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
The Ginkgo tree is believed to be the oldest tree species on the planet, a "living fossil" if you will, surviving the Ice Age. The graceful fan-shaped leaves are enchanting symbols of peace, hope and longevity and are a favorite motif from the Arts & Crafts movement. The branches of this symbolic tree reached into the minds of the designers at Motawi Tileworks and grew into Motawi's latest installation series, simply named Ginkgo. Motawi's Botanica series is a collection of classical designs inspired by nature. Now blooming at the Tileworks are all of the darling parts of the collection; 4x4 and 2x2 Pansy, 2x2 Fleur, 2x2 Fern and 2x2 Signet, each begging for a starring role in your next Motawi installation.

Motawi Tileworks is a maker of fine American Art Tile, handcrafted with a design aesthetic that is both historically-inspired and often borrowed from the natural world. The company believes that it enriches the world with its beautiful products and healthy business practice. Life at Motawi is lively, positive, cooperative, process-driven and result-oriented. The tiles are created for use in homes, commercial buildings, and public places, and are installed world-wide.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html: Luce, a collection of contemporary handmade glass mosaics, uses reflection and refraction of light to create shifts in color and illumination. As light bounces off the tile surface, these semi-opaque mosaics absorb and reflect nuances of the colors around them. Luce breaks barriers in glass mosaic design with four distinctive patterns: Feather, 2-inch Hex, Fin and Clipper. The 12 subtle pastel hues in Pearl and Silk finishes coordinate with today's movement in color.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html: Tides is a new series in the watermark collection of hand crafted porcelain tile. Designed by artist in residence Luca Osburn, an avid surfer, the collection is named for the magical quality of the tides effecting the waves that greet him each session. This collection adds four new colors, which reflect Osburn's favorite surfing locations in Northern California.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html:
ANN SACKS illusionary Ermanno is a metallic glazed porcelain tile that features two intricate, two-shade repeat designs and a contrasting singular color design. Ermanno is crafted in Italy and exclusive to ANN SACKS in the United States. Inspired by Art Deco design, Ermanno has slight variations in color and irregularities within the pattern resulting in an organic, handcrafted appearance. Ermanno’s two patterns feature a rich palette of various color combinations. The Pavone and Geometric designs are offered in Gold on Black, Gold on White, Silver on Black, Silver on White, or stand-alone White. Trama is available in Bronze on Black or Bronze on White.
This completely in-stock program accommodates the tightest of installation schedules for large-scale commercial projects as well as the striking appearance required to create sensational residential applications.

Product > wall covering: tile and stone.category: Product > wall covering: tile and stone
Product > wall covering: tile and stone.description_html: Our newest collection of timeless glazed terracotta tiles - eastern earthenware. Inspired by Moroccan zellige - but created using far east sensibilities, eastern earthenware is a creation of primitive tiles hand-formed from rustic terra cotta then hardened using ancient firing methods and kilns. The great tradition of ceramics received huge momentum from Asia from the discovery of new forms of clay to the experimentation with minerals to colorize glazes. It is this influence that has provided the heart of our collection. eastern earthenware features over 30 glazes that are highly textured, gloriously imperfect and infused with the most unexpected color variations. This concert of elements can only be derived from an artisan’s hand using unfiltered elements freshly mined from nature and further distinguished by the use of a volatile firing atmosphere. Available in 2"x6", 3"x8", 4"x4" and 6"x6" sizes. we encourage you to explore this series for any of your bath or kitchen splashes, your walls and floors, and your interior or exterior spaces.

Product > window treatments.description_html:
Interbraid – A New Contemporary Design by Hartmann&Forbes
The process of creating luxury woven products is drawn-out from nature by choosing only the finest sustainable natural materials. Ramie fibers of pale grey and golden wheat are hung to dry, hand-braided then individually placed in this handwoven-to-size grassweave. Rising above a finely woven field, these delicate braids create a unique horizontal pattern, resulting in a gentle rhythm. A modern design which lends a natural restfulness and comfort to any interior space.

A time-honored method of shade making, Hartmann&Forbes’ Woven-to-Size Collections are handwoven on traditional wooden looms to the window’s dimensions, up to 180" wide without seams. This arduous weaving technique delivers an exquisite loom-finished edge. Each shade is then handcrafted to designer’s specifications, creating a true one-of-one original piece of art.

The Jonathan Adler Roller Shade Collection for The Shade Store celebrates the irreverent luxury and modern American glamour that defines a Jonathan Adler piece, and the meticulous handcraftsmanship that’s synonymous with The Shade Store name.

This exclusive collaboration focuses on color and pattern with designs that range from a waterfall in azure to a bold three-dimensional pattern inspired by a 1950’s Italian mod look. Modern patterns mix with classic colors for a clean aesthetic that works beautifully alone or that can be layered with other styles.

The Jonathan Adler Roller Shade Collection is the quintessential “form meets function” collection. Available in 24 colors, it can be customized in blackout and light filtering materials. The collection is available exclusively at The Shade Store. All Roller Shades are handcrafted in the USA and ship free in 7 days or less.
Product > window treatments.product_name: Jonathan Adler for The Shade Store

Product > window treatments.description_html:
The Ombre Collection from Fabric Innovations allows hotels to get the dip-dyed look of ombre without the hassle. Through our innovation digital printing technique, designers can create distinct drapery, bedding and pillows in virtually any color.

(Please note: the images that show the custom "blue" dip-dyed ombre drapery in the W Hotel submitted in this case were specifically for a project that Fabric Innovations custom designed for Meyer Davis Studio)

This interactive tool, hosted on the MechoSystems website, allows a designer to search for a specific shadecloth (window treatment textiles) via commonly used/needed criteria for a specific project. This is done by selecting desired attributes through the multi-level search criteria/filters. Environmental certifications and technical specifications criteria can be selected for sorting by the Shadecloth Features Selector. Then, the list of selections can be saved as a Spreadsheet, emailed, or saved as a .pdf for the particular shadecloth or certification based search results.

The MechoSystems Shadecloth Features Selector is unique in that a textiles’ environmental certifications and technical attributes can be custom sorted by series for the desired project requirement in an unlimited number of combinations. The search for a shadecloth can be complex, multi-attribute, or simple, a single attribute. Once a search ranking is done, another one can follow instantly. A shadecloth series identified by the Features Selector Guide can be located by clicking and the product page is instantly located. Technical certifications can be reviewed and samples can be ordered by a click. Term descriptions are answered by mouse hovering over the attribute.

Now a Designer can perform a search for a shadecloth series based on official environmental certifications and/or technical parameters in an objective manner to meet owners’ criteria or for compliance with various ratings standards such as LEED or Living Building Challenge or Healthier Hospitals Initiative.

Today, a major focus within buildings is WELLNESS. Designers and Project Owners are keenly aware of this and are striving to choose materials that “do no harm” and meet the technical criteria for the project. Therefore, a chart that allows for environmental and product attributes to be sorted eases the product selection basis and demonstrates transparency.

The Shadecloth Features Selector guide is organized with clear headings, distinct gridlines and numerous links to other pages on website. The Guide is constructed on a white background with black text and the logos of the environmental certification are used as an aid to locating the desired shade. Except for the data, nothing is pre-configured. Since the software is hosted on the website, information will be maintained as environmental certifications get more stringent and new textiles are introduced. All information will always be the latest, assuring the Designer gets current and accurate results.

The total list of sortable criteria is:
Openness, Opaque, Less than 3% open, More than 3% open, Railroading, Flame Retardant, NFPA 701®, HHI compliant/CFR free, GreenGuard®, PVC-Free, Eligible for LEED®v4, Cradle to cradle™, Material Health Certificate, Health Product Declaration. The list can be sorted Ascending or Descending.

MechoSystems is proud to offer the Shadecloth Features Selector Guide as an aid in helping sort window treatment textile by criteria and in simplifying the process of gathering environmental compliance for those projects that require rigorous product selection.

Product > window treatments.company_name: Glen Raven Custom Fabrics and The Shade Store
Product > window treatments.description_html:
The Sunbrella® Ventana™ Collection seamlessly blends the legendary performance of Sunbrella fabrics with the artisanal craftsmanship of The Shade Store®.

Sunbrella is the first performance fabric The Shade Store has offered giving way to high style, worry-free window treatments. Like Sunbrella, The Shade Store is also a family owned and operated business, founded in 1946. The companies’ shared heritage of style, quality and values create a perfect marriage for exceptional products.

“We understand that life can be messy, but that doesn’t mean you need to sacrifice style, quality, design or performance,” said Ian Gibbs, Co-Founder and Chief Creative Officer for The Shade Store. “We work closely with our customers to create custom window treatments that fit each individual’s lifestyle and offering Sunbrella performance fabrics allows us to provide even more options that stand up to busy family life.”

The collection includes 45 versatile, fade-resistant materials including textural solids and patterns for custom-made drapery, roman shade and cornice styles.

“As we design for the whole home, the appeal of Sunbrella for window treatments continues to grow,” said Benji Bagwell, market manager, Glen Raven Custom Fabrics, the manufacturer of Sunbrella fabrics. “The fade-resistant qualities of Sunbrella are especially important for window treatments, which are subject to strong UV rays.”

The Sunbrella Ventana Collection is available at The Shade Store showrooms nationwide as well as online at theshadestore.com/sunbrella. All of the custom window treatments from The Shade Store are hand-crafted by skilled artisans in the USA.
Product > window treatments.product_name: Sunbrella® Ventana Collection™ for The Shade Store®

Product > window treatments.description_html:
No wallflower when it comes to high-end design and innovation, Hunter Douglas is once again making a statement in the window coverings category, unveiling a new product that turns traditional treatments on their head with souped-up substance and style. Silhouette® ClearView™ Shadings deliver dramatic, unparalleled view-throughs, and further demonstrate the brand’s dedication to quality, craftsmanship and ingenuity.
The How + Wow:

• It’s signature S-vane construction tilts to beautifully diffuse harsh sunlight, placing the view as star for an enhanced, crystal-clear look to the outside.

• A unique shade combination consisting of white or black front sheers with a highly transparent black rear sheer makes the magic of the view-through possible.

• Protects floors, furnishings and artwork from UV rays.

It’s yet another first for Hunter Douglas and the window treatment category—and a real win when the view is everything. As an added bonus, Silhouette ClearView Shadings are available with the brand’s cutting-edge wireless operating system PowerView® Motorization, which allows homeowners to program shades to automatically adjust throughout the day, anytime, from anywhere, to complement their lifestyles.

Daybreak, the first drapery collection to be released by Fil Doux Textiles, invites the outside in with its nature-inspired designs. The mill-direct fabric supplier focused on matted metallics for the extensive collection of 13 patterns in 12 colorways, which is accented by the unexpected addition of a mid-century modern inspired merino wool option.

“The addition of drapery rounds out the full offering of Fil Doux Textiles’ extensive options for hospitality environments,” said CEO, Leo Novik. He continues, “We’ve waited a long time to introduce this new category to our portfolio. Drapery is the finishing touch to the room and, for us, it is like we’ve just completed the masterpiece. We can now supply all the fabrics needed for a hotel room.”

Both romantic and emotive, Daybreak’s textural elements reference timeless artworks such as the Venus De Milo or Christo and Jeanne-Claude's epic installations. This combination of bold and dramatic patterns with soft and humble color tones creates a beautiful contrast that can help frame any space.

Highlights

Sensation: Inspired by the ancient Greek meditative labyrinth experience, where it is said that psyche meets spirit, Sensation is a modern geometric design.

Indelible: This pattern reflects the details of Christo and Jeanne Claude's majestic archways, layered to create an etched look.
​
Bloom: Resembling that magical moment when flower petals blossom and expand outward, Bloom is soft and organic.

Intrinsic: A colorful variation in the delicately striped design with hints of gold and silver, this pattern adds a touch of glamour to any space.

Finesse: Like the slightly aged look of plaster, Finesse has a weathered appearance that replicates the delicate friezes created by great artisans of the past.

Slumber: An effortless classic, Slumber is both elegant and inherently helps to control room temperature, thanks to its 100% merino wool construction.

The MechoSystems WhisperShade® DC Electronic Drive Unit is the powerful and very quiet low-voltage motor for shades that’s compatible with the MechoNet™ operating system used in roller shade automation. The WhisperShade DC motor offers addressing, customizable preset shade positions and rotation speed. The motor features built-in networking capability and can be used in locations where other MechoSystems motors are used or in areas that require a DC powered motor. The special bracket system insures virtually silent operation.

The WhisperShade DC Electronic Drive unit offers designers and specifiers another motor to choose from when specifying shading systems. Now, in addition to line-voltage, the new low-voltage motor will offer superior lifting capability (40 pounds, shade at a max height of 24 feet), while being super quiet!

The addressing functions and compatibility with MehcoNet™ ensure shade automations for office or whole-building can be done effectively. The DC motor will enable many more installations of motorized or automated shades due to easier installation and not needing electrical service at 120VAC. Shade control can be done automatically, by wired switch, or by wireless switch. The motor features a soft start and stop and a variable speed control and 16 preset positions for precise shade alignment. The motor is virtually silent and tests <38Db. Control can be done via local switching (wired or wireless) or via commands sent on the network via the unique address each motor will have. Networking also easily enables zoning of motors when under central control. A complete family of power supply options are available ranging from discrete power supply transformers to a ten-unit power panel.

The low voltage WhisperShade DC Electronic Drive Unit enables shade automation to occur in spaces where the installation of line voltage motors was difficult due to professional electrician labor expenses or due to construction issues dictated by the pre-wiring for 120 VAC powered roller shade motors. Shade automation fosters daylight integration which saves energy and the use of daylight promotes circadian rhythm and combat Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD). Promoting Daylight is often an earned LEED point.

The unique DC motor offers support, tight edge clearance and is designed to minimize vibration and noise via coupling to building structure. The minimal edge clearance (7/8 inch) is same at drive, idle, and center support brackets resulting in a symmetrical placement on the window. The movement of the shade motor when installed with the special DC bracket results in a noise measurement of <38db. The matched sound-absorbing brackets are available with or without a clip for Fascia.
Product > window treatments.product_name: MechoSystems WhisperShade® DC Electronic Drive Unit (motor)

Product > window treatments.description_html: Innovations’ draperies and sheers complete the room. The collection of 16 patterns address the wide range of design needs: sheers, textures, large-scale patterns, acoustical, dim-out and double-width options, all woven with fire-retardant fibers. This complete line, featuring subtly layered textures of various colors and patterns, is a natural extension of Innovations’ sophisticated solutions for the vertical surface, moving the practical into artistic without compromising durability or practicality.

Lutron Palladiom Shading System is a beautiful, revolutionary shading solution that features highly crafted exposed hardware envisioned for the world’s most exquisite homes. Lutron’s classic Palladiom keypad was the inspiration for the design language, exemplified by the brackets and hembar for the Palladiom Shading System – minimal in form and deliberate in its simplicity. It’s a visually striking solution that offers industry-leading shading performance and reliability, as well as seamless integration with Lutron’s HomeWorks QS system and other third-party control solutions.

Every Palladiom shade bracket begins with a solid piece of extruded aluminum -- brushed by hand and crafted to last a lifetime. All visible elements of the system, from the bracket to the fastener covers to the tube-bearing sleeves, have all been hand-finished to create a continuous and clean look. Palladiom Shading System also showcases a new bottom rail, designed to ensure a minimal, balanced aesthetic, and one that completely disappears when the roller shade is fully open. The Palladiom Bottom Rail beautifully features Lutron-patented Intelligent Hembar Alignment, designed to synchronize the movement of multiple shades in a space.

Capable of covering a 12-foot-by-12-foot window with a startlingly slim two-inch tube, Palladiom shades have an innovative tube geometry that results in a structure that is remarkably rigid, yet extremely light. Designed from end to end to cleverly conceal all wiring and programming interfaces, Palladiom Shading System offers symmetrical ½” light gaps to complete the clean aesthetic.

For more than 50 years, Lutron has been a pioneer in technology, innovation, and design. Palladiom Shading System embodies the best of our capabilities. In the precision of its workmanship and the wonder of its technology, Palladiom Shading System is a thing of beauty.

The Nate Berkus Roller Shade Collection for The Shade Store features a sophisticated palette of grays, neutrals, and inspired colors, mixed with a breeziness that feels effortlessly stylish, no matter the room or decor.

But while the patterns and style feel “effortless”, this collection is the result of countless production and design hours - playing with patterns, scale, and color – to create something thoughtful and elevated, approachable and unexpected.

The Nate Berkus Roller Shade Collection is both functional and fashionable. Available in 24 colors, it can be customized in both blackout and light filtering materials. The collection is available exclusively at The Shade Store. All Roller Shades are handcrafted in the USA and ship free in 7 days or less.
Product > window treatments.product_name: Nate Berkus for The Shade Store

Product > window treatments.description_html:
Artline is Bandalux’s most exclusive product, created by industrial designer Joan Gaspar (Barcelona, 1966). This is a roller shade with a decorative built-in valence that gives the shade an additional aesthetic effect.

The decorative front strip of the Artline shade has two sides, enabling the user to choose between an aluminum profile with a relief and a decorative strip with different available designs. Moreover, it comes with a methacrylate plate as an optional cover for the decorative strip, to give it greater depth and shine.

The Artline roller shade is a high-end shade made with aluminum and high-quality finishes for indoor installation.

Artline is part of Bandalux collection of roller shades with front covers, highly decorative systems with high-end finishes for indoor installation. Bandalux systems ensure excellent sun protection, user privacy and a perfect roll of the fabric, with a straight and firm drop. They also personalize the interior decoration of the rooms where they are installed.

More information: https://contract.bandalux.com/en/roller-shades-decorative-covers/artline

The TZ100 Zipper Tension System from Hunter Douglas Architectural is a new internal and external window covering system that’s ideal for horizontal skylight applications and designed to eliminate light gaps at any angle and in any direction through its Zip Lock Technology.

The TZ100 Zipper Tension System’s Zip Lock Technology is engineered to lock fabric into an extrusion that runs the entire span of the system. By keeping solar control fabric under constant tension in top down, bottom-up, sideways, and skylight applications, the fabric is prevented from blowing out of the guides while remaining taut, providing blackout design and defending against unwanted insects.

“The Zip Lock Technology used in the TZ100 Zipper Tension System keeps both aesthetics and performance in play for projects that are looking for the best of both worlds,” said Nick Inman, Manager of Specialty Projects at Hunter Douglas Architectural Window Coverings. “At the Broad Museum in L.A., we used over 300 systems to cover each of its individual, sloped, external rooflights, which play a big part in the unique lighting atmosphere you find there.”

A great option for new construction or existing windows, the TZ100 Zipper Tension System’s compact design can easily install inside window mount frames and exterior face mount applications with minimal visual impact. The aluminum profiles can be coated in a multitude of colors to match any building. The TZ100 Zipper Tension System can also provide a fully automated, smart solution to solar shading through Radio Frequency (RF) sensors and transmitters compatible with a variety of control systems including commercial BMS, open network platforms, or individual wall switches that work together to control the integrated, quiet motor.

“The TZ100 Zipper Tension System is another example of how Hunter Douglas Architectural approaches the challenges of supplying modern buildings with state-of-the-art solutions for sun control and window coverings,” said Nick Chiaro, General Manager, Hunter Douglas Architectural Window Coverings. “We’re pleased to have had the opportunity to create and develop a custom, highly-coordinated sun control and skylight system for the University of Michigan’s Stephen M. Ross School of Business, and we’re eager to see how it impacts the students and faculty that will frequent the building.”

The ‘Sheer Genius’ Collection boasts over 100 light and airy deluxe sheers in patterns, colors and textures ranging from linen-like soft hands to metallic accents and stripes. Featuring 118” widths, the Sheer Genius Collection meets all contract industry hospitality standards and NFPA 701. Design your hospitality guestroom with the Sheer Genius Collection from Fabric Innovations.

Dynamic. Transformative. Versatile. Cool. The new Sonnette™ Cellular Roller Shades from Hunter Douglas are hardworking beauties with impressive benefits. An update on the classic honeycomb shade, this modern newcomer’s innovative, soft curved design diffuses and disperses natural light throughout a room to beautiful effect, creating more comfortable living spaces. And, was designed to offer customers the streamlined aesthetic of a roller shade with the perks of cellular construction, lending energy efficient layer to interiors by insulating in the winter and cooling in the summer. The collection is also completely cordless—the LiteRise lifting system is a standard feature, while new SoftTouch™ Motorization technology and PowerView® Motorization complete the offering. Available in 48 colors—from neutrals to bolder brights—with both semi-opaque and room darkening opacities offered, Sonnette Cellular Roller Shades are fashioned to complement and enhance all spaces and lifestyle needs, and are yet another example of Hunter Douglas’ dedication to the art of window dressing.

In our quest for inspiration, CONRAD looks to the vast canopy of the night sky, where a dusting of stars and a silent moon scatter brightness and light the imagination. Our Moon & Stars collection debuts nine new shades in heavenly hues that range from the soft violet of twilight to the pale gold of a rising moon. A variety of texture offers delightful choices for creating truly unique and beautiful rooms.

CONRAD shades are made of select natural fibers, each woven by hand with meticulous attention to the details of design and craft that bring a look of natural elegance to public and private settings.
